Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Perthies
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the hotel after a sleepless 24 hours we asked if we could check in early and were advised that we could, for an extra, fairly pricey, fee. We decided to just leave our bags and check in later but were then advised that we could have a room at no extra charge and check in then and there, for which we were really grateful. The room itself was fine; clean and comfortable, like any regular hotel room. Although we had requested a bay view, our room had a view over buildings but, at that point, we were just too tired to argue. Staff were efficient but the hotel lacked the warmth that makes you really feel welcome. The extra taxes and charges do add up so be aware of this when planning your trip. WiFi was not cheap either with their "special offer" adding an extra $17 per day to our bill. Connections dropped out frequently. Location was good; just a short walk to Robertson Quay and a good walk to Clarke Quay with their extensive selections of restaurants . The walkway leading to these locations runs alongside the river and is free of vehicles which makes it both safe and pleasant and we enjoyed srolling back to the hotel after our evening meal. While in Singapore, we had the Jungle Breakfast at The zoo, in the presence of a company of orangutan. Sentosa was a full day of fun (don't miss the typhoon experience at the Maritime Museum); Changi Chapel and Museum were fascinating and thought provoking and the Chinatown tour and Trishaw ride was a laugh.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive!”
Reviews.Author: vikasmohan12
Reviews.Content: Thanks to my frequent travels, a run of the mill standard 5 star hotel does not excite me much! To me that means just another place to have a shut eye and somewhere to have my morning eggs! I have been to Singapore many many times and usually prefers to stay near marina (I like my walks there :). However this time as I was deliverining a lecture I was booked at this hotel, being the venue! My travel desk booked me into a club floor, which had these nice suites full of amenities you find in your house! So had I everthing to entertain guests or throw a party, but alas I did not have the time! The room service provided some delicious food and free mini-bar makes it easy to rehydrate yourself! I like the pristine white color scheme of the suites, broken by small pools of color and forms. The club lounge had limited F&B options but that was compensated by very warm and helping staff! Only peev I had that it's bit steep and not exactly near the action in the city! But over all I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel , and polite service”
Reviews.Author: robervaleri
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the first time in Singapore, and we chose this hotel, we are very good stats, good rooms, the servizioeccellente, and the staff are always available, great location for taxis, easily reachable by the center or marina bay, fun also visit the island of sentosa. hotel with full breakfast buffet, dinner buffet and also, good quality '.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms check extra charges”
Reviews.Author: MaisieSydney
Reviews.Content: Located on the waterfront close to lots of good restaurants- but no public transport options so its Taxis everywhere. Pleasant comfortable rooms. Lobby the most unfriendly of any hotel I've stayed in- not a seat to be found. Service chjarges can add 1/3 to your bill- and as in US one night can be double the cost of the next depending on rate of occupancy.

Reviews.Title: “such a great location”
Reviews.Author: molly1203
Reviews.Content: very new to this part of town,but what a surprise...great shopping just down the road,and plenty of fine dining right on the doorstep.will stay again in this location and hotel staff were above and beyond in every instance...well done.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star MacDonalds”
Reviews.Author: Dean M
Reviews.Content: This is a great, luxurious, hotel that is so so ordinary. Save your money and stay somewhere else where you will get better food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great "staycation" option”
Reviews.Author: eatshopeatshop
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night for a birthday weekend. Was given a room facing the river and city view with Marina Bay Sands in the distance. Room has been given a new modern look after the slight refurbishment. Also the complimentary birthday cake from the hotel was a nice gesture. For dinner, we walked down along the river to robertson quay with plenty of dining options. The breakfast the next morning consisted of a big spread with regular top up by the service staff. Hotel was also close to the shopping mall Great World City. And Zouk is just next door. Overall a great place to do a staycation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrew h
Reviews.Content: Stated for 4 nights had great service and the staff very very helpfully will return

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel near Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: luq97
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the Singapore river where there is a jogging track, perfect for a fitness head. Surrounding area are quiet , away from the hustle and bustle of shopping area. The lobby is not big but pretty impressive. we were greeted warmly by the hotel staff and much to our joy, we were given the room very early. The room is small but adequately equipped. Our room has a view of the river and surrounding condos. Sleep quality was okay , unfortunately internet are not free and there is also no free Wifi at the lobby. Hotel staff attitude are quite okay. Our heartfelt thanks goes to Madam Mary who helped us in her own sweet way, in which we will never forget. Her professionalism would be the main factor of us coming back to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: TheWilkosUK
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Singapore was a 3 night stopover here on the way to New Zealand. Enjoyed it so much we will have to go back. Had an excellent room here with fabulous views. Breakfasts here were among the best we've ever had; get down early in the morning and insist on a table by the window overlooking the river and the morning activity along the banks. The hotel isn't near an MRT station but we thoroughly enjoyed the walks along the river side where there are plenty of reasonably priced restaurants. We walked in to China Town (under 30 minutes) every day and two evenings and were very lucky to be there for Chinese/Lunar New year. Felt very safe even late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Wheelchair Travel”
Reviews.Author: DonandElaine
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Copthorne Waterfront earlier this month pre and post cruise with our mother in law who required disabled access. Quick checkin and rooms allocated as requested....we were all very impressed with the disabled room, allocation of a wheelchair and service given to the needs of MIL - she was thrilled to find everyone so helpful. Breakfast was included in the package as was late checkout....breakfast was super and was the icing on the deal. have stayed at the Copthorne previously and found rooms and views great. We used room service on a couple of occasions, very much enjoyed same and reasonable price. No hesitation in recommending the hotel to anyone travelling with an elderly relative or requiring disabled access, will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: Fragi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is BIG. Be prepared to fight for you seat (OK, the staff seats you) and food in breakfast room (which is really not a restaurant, but lobby converted into breakfast room), to wait for taxi in front of the hotel, to wait for elevators, to wait for check in/out,... In the lobby I could not sit down, because there are no chairs/sofas... I had to walk from elevator to my room for almost 100m... The location looks very sexy - right at the river; but it is far away from everything interesting. I walked every morning and evening 15 to 20 minutes to reach the forst metro station. Definitelly not a good location! Gym and pool area are quite nice, but small (remember the hotel is BIG).

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel, organised professional staff with reasonable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: TKiriP_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and will go back. Didn't book through the hotel website itself, used a hotel deal website, which was a mistake. Will definitely book directly next time. We had breakfast included (valued at SGD$30 per person), which was yummy (standard for most hotels) but probably not worth it when other cafes are nearby, e.g. Boomerang. The room was okay, not big but big enough to fit a cot in for our daughter. The bathroom was a mixture of modern shower and old vanity. No bath. Bathroom accessories were not replaced everyday (cotton buds and facial cotton). Bathroom wasn't cleaned well one day. We checked out at 12noon but our flight wasn't until later that night and we were able to use the amenities on Level 5 - shower and waiting lounge area with TV, as well as the pool, which was very handy. Friends stayed on Club level, but it was not worth it, disappointing for a Millenium group hotel. We would stay there again if we found a reassonable deal.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: RayleighTasha_1985
Reviews.Content: Taxi from the airport at 9pm cost us SGD25. On arrival check in was quick - we were allocated a room with a river view an high floor as requested so we were very pleased! Room is just the right size for 2 people - wardrobes for storage and a safe too. Bathroom nice an spacious good water pressure and a bath/shower combo. Flat screen tv with around 30 channels a mix of languages. We had room service 2 nights and it came very quickly, was piping hot and delicious! Amazing view of river and city. Hotel offers a free shuttle to the main attractions (apart from the zoo) which is a bonus. We got a taxi to zoo for SGD 20. The zoo was amazing and such good value for money a must whilst you are in Singapore! Check out was also speedy and staff are so lovely (as were most of the people in Singapore). Only negatives were the charge for wifi - i feel that for over £100 per night this should be included. We were offered a promotion combo of wifi and breakfast when checking in but we decided it was still too expensive for us - grabbed some food web we got to the zoo much cheaper! Hotel also has a pool, tennis courts and a gym! Would stay here again though as it is a lovely hotel in a good location with friendly helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel for business travellers and city breaks”
Reviews.Author: Nicodem
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night in December 2012. I received a very good rate and was generally satisfied with my stay. The rooms are spacious and well equipped. I had lunch in the main restaurant on the ground floor. The quality of the food and service was very good. The only downside of the hotel seems to be its location - there are hardly any shops and restaurants nearby. Which means, in turn, that you have to wait for ages to get a cab as everybody needs one. I would recommend the hotel to business travellers and families with children staying in Singapore for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor hotel filthy carpets”
Reviews.Author: andreasmz1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 2923 for 2 nights and we would not stay in this hotel again. I noticed that parts of the hotel are/have been upgraded but the room that we were in was old and tired. Also from a size perspective they are small rooms and will stay small regardless of how polished they look. The room had all the appointments that a five star room should have with the marble in the bathroom ironing board and bathrobes etc. Unfortunately, these points do not make it a 5 star room if the carpet is worn and filthy. I mean filthy, not just dirty but black and discoloured. It was so dirty that we didn't want to walk on it in bare feet. The skirting board were badly kicked around with lots of black marks there was also some damage on the the walls. The valance on the bed was also filthy and this is something that is easy to clean. The quality of the towels were variable. On one day one towel was plush and the other towel was thin and frayed, something I would use in washing my car rather than providing to a 5 star hotel client. The room was also very small and tight and nothing like the pictures on their site. Conversely, they have used a really wide angle lens to have the room appear much larger than the actual. It's the total package we pay for when we stay in a hotel and in this case the total package fell way short. So in a nut shell there is no way I would stay at this hotel again and further would and will warn anybody against using this hotel as I am sure there are many better hotels at comparable prices available.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel away of the center”
Reviews.Author: dafna_delevie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good, but away of the main shopping centers of the city. The hotel is clean, good breakfast, bussines center with breakfast (poor) and dinner (very poor). To get any shooping or an interesting place you need a taxi and the city is a big trafic jamme all the day. There are very good restaurant next to the hotel. There is swiming pool, gym and sauna included inside the hotel. The attention is very good and kindly.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasing stay.”
Reviews.Author: Shailender1969
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. The rooms are very good and quite spacious. The house keeping is prompt to respond. The buffet breakfast has a very good spread. Easy to get the taxis as any where in Singapore. All in all a very pleasing stay of three night in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gerardlee
Reviews.Content: My company uses this hotel and I usually stay here when in Singapore. By great location I mean right alongside the river and the quay. Roberston quay is lined with tons of bars and restaurants and walk a little further you reach Riverside Quay. So dining options are a plenty within a 15-20min walk from the hotel. Nice views from the hotel overlooking the river. It is virtually a 10min and $5 cab fare to Orchard Road. The service is a little slow and I usually have to ring a few times to get any housekeeping. A little disappointing but not a show stopper. The staff at the reception and concierge desk are most efficient. Taxis are also a plenty.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, okay service”
Reviews.Author: DJDunoon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine for business or pleasure, not as Grand as the title suggests, but pleasant enough. View of the river are great.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and secluded spot by the riverside”
Reviews.Author: skichick09
Reviews.Content: A great hotel situated on the riverside. It is the perfect base for a stopover en route to Oz. We were impressed by the efficient staff, tasty buffet breakfast (included in the rate) and size of the rooms. The hotel itself is a little dated in places, but you have to bear in mind the price you are paying in comparison to other hotels and for this reason you simply cannot fault it. We decided not to do the buffet dinner option as this was $59 a head, opting for a la carte was more value for money and they weather was pleasant enough to eat outside and enjoy the river view. Would definately recommend and consider again for a stopover. P.S. we reserved through booking.com

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Zac L
Reviews.Content: A pool, great views, great rooms, great service, great location. This hotel has it all.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel are little less understanding to the Needs”
Reviews.Author: INDIAOUTSOURCES
Reviews.Content: Grand Capothorne was not a very good experience , but would still rate it as a decent hotel , in terms of cleanliness and facilities it had. Location is Poor or may be I am not guided that way . But in general there is nothing to walk around . Costing is over USD 230 which made it little expensive for us We had a group tour this time so lot of things were not dependent on the hotel . Hotel served good food , American Break fast , vegeterian as well . Hotel has nice lobby , but no free Internet which is a Curse for any Business Visitor . But you can find SingTel Card for Unlimited 3G @ 18 SGD for 4 days which can be good Hotel Reception was not very friendly and seemed as if they were doing some big effort for even providing water ( At the end of the day they charge ) Hotel Grand Capathorne is a choice if you have no other for couple of days ... Not more at all Thanks Rohit

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel tucked away from the hustle & bustle from touristy places”
Reviews.Author: Abhishek_Saha
Reviews.Content: Along with my spouse and my 9 month old kid, we stayed at the Grand Copthorne Waterfront for 3 nights during last week. On arrival around midnight, we were promptly allotted our room which was kept ready for us. Our room was on the 14th floor facing the riverside, which was a good thing. The room size was average but I understand that's the standard in S'pore. The bathroom had a stand-in shower and was quite small in size. On the upside, the staff were very friendly throughout. Special mention to the staff at the front door for their helpfulness. During the 3 days of our stay, every time we would return to the hotel they would promptly pull out my kid's stroller from the taxi's boot even before I finished paying the taxi driver. The breakfast was quiet nice and we did not have to wait long in the queue on any of the days. While the hotel is remotely located, it is not too far a taxi ride from Clarke Quay or Orchard Road. Taxis would take around SG$ 10 depending on type of taxi & time of the day. Having said that the hotel is enroute to 2 hop on hop off bus routes. One can board the SIA bus from a bus stop which is just 2 minutes walk from the hotel, and the open top sightseeing bus leaves from opposite the miramar hotel which is just across the road. The riverside location is an added advantage and worth a stroll. The hotel also apparently provides complimentary bikes for the enthusiasts. Overall our experience was quiet nice and we would recommend this property to other leisure travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Can offer good value in a City of increasingly expensive hotels”
Reviews.Author: Simon63
Reviews.Content: This Hotel, located in Havelock Road is described as 5* but is really a 4* and is showing its age. It overlooks the River and is a short stroll down the river bank to Robertson Quay with its bars and restaurants. Clarke Quay is a considerable walk in the very humid atmosphere. Any business meeting in any of the business locations is a taxi ride away and its remote location means that you cannot 'pop' back between meetings. There can also be queues at the hotel for taxis. My room overlooked the river and was wonderfully quiet. It was reasonably furnished and the double bed (with duvet) was comfortable although the feather pillows were hard (no down in the mix). The bathroom was small and lacked a bath ( just a shower). There was one small piece of soap to be shared between sink and shower. There were only two bath towels in what was described as a double room and both were old and worn. There was a kettle to make coffee but the sachets of coffee were powdered instant and disgusting. Two bottles of complimentary mineral water were appreciated. There was no evening turn down service and there was neither fruit in the room nor a daily newspaper - things that you expect in 5 star hotels. My internet booked rate included free broadband internet access. This was as well as it was an outrageous S$28.50 per 24 hours. It required logging in again each time you wanted to use the computer. I had a cup of coffee in the main restaurant opposite the entrance. It was small and expensive with no refill. I also had a glass of red wine from the adjacent bar which was smaller and from an obviously much earlier opened bottle for S$15++. The whole are lacks charm and has an institutional feel. It was full at breakfast - mainly from groups with an inclusive breakfast deal I surmise. Avoid the very highly marked up minibar. In an increasingly expensive city, a good internet rate at this hotel can offer good value for money. The service is functional and the whole place lacks charm but is OK. If you were looking for a luxurious five star experience you would be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not Five Star”
Reviews.Author: oliverAustralia
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at the hotel for one night but it was long enough to decide that it was definitely not a five star experience-even though we had booked a Club Room. I would have given the hotel a rating of average, rather than poor if the hotel had been classified as four star, but at nearly 300 dollars Australian, it was over -priced. I also resented the extra $30 that appeared on my Wotif account because there were two people in the room, rather than one. The bathroom had mould in most of the grout and there was a large piece of grout missing from the edge of the bath. This contributed to a look of slight seediness. There was no separate shower and the shower over the bath did not run freely. The wireless internet was very patchy and to use the ethernet connection, the charge was 50 cents a minute. The room itself was small and dated. There were marks on the doors and the furniture was chipped. The room suffered an inadequacy of power points and there was no milk for coffee. On the upside, the bed and pillows were comfortable and the buffet breakfast was reasonable. Maybe this hotel was grand once, but it certainly is not now.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, remote location”
Reviews.Author: LanPing
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for one week, twice. On the first occasion I arrived late at night and was told that only smoking rooms were available, but was offered an ionizer. After pointing out that I am asthmatic I was asked to "try" the room, but it stank and I was then given an upgrade; nice, but at 1.00 am after a long flight, all I really wanted was a non-smoking room, which surely isn't a big ask. Free wifi works well - but unless it's an all-inclusive rate, really expensive. Bathroom products of good quality and quantity, rooms large and clean, room service very good indeed. The 29th floor Club Lounge is awful and worth avoiding - if you can find any staff around to avoid. The hotel is 30 minutes walk from Boat Quay / CBD, and although this is a very pleasant stroll in the evening, in the morning it's hot, humid and very uncomfortable. The taxi to Raffles Place is between S$6 - 13 depending on the driver's mood, which is the decisive factor. On 3 occasions I queued for up to 40 minutes for a taxi in the morning - on two of these occasions, cars turned up with their lights on, and then the waiting guests were individually quizzed about their intended destination before the driver decided who he wanted to take. On two other occasions I pre-ordered a car; once it was 15 minutes late, on the other occasion it failed to arrive and the Concierge ended up driving me into town in the Hotel minibus. There is no MRT station nearby. Staff - especially in the lobby restaurant were consistently surly and unhelpful; the Concierge desk was frequently unmanned. During my second stay my room key card needed replacement 3 times in 4 nights, and on every occasion I had to go downstairs, be accompanied back to my room by a condescending Receptionist like a naughty schoolboy, be "shown" how to use the keycard, recoil in horror at the unexpected conclusion that it didn't work, get dragged back downstairs again and grudgingly given a replacement, accompanied by the patronising admonishment to keep it away from my mobile phone. In addition, on two days bathroom linen and consumables and the minibar were not restocked. This is a good hotel in a bad location with awful staff; the Swissotel on Clarke Quay is far better and sits on top of an MRT station

Reviews.Title: “Will be back soon”
Reviews.Author: inlycampbell
Reviews.Content: First time stay here.. the room was comfort and nice, view from the room also good. Have lots of choice for the restaurants. Near Clarke Quay. but need to took cab to other side of the city..

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IvorHoliday
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and location for seeing the sights in Singapore. Within easy walking (15 minute amble along the river) distance of Clarke Quay for eating out. Mid way between Marina Bay attractions and Orchard Road, need taxis to get to both. Rooms were very comfortable and good seating area outside for "sipping a sling" beside the river. Not much in the immediate vicinity of the Hotel but close to get taxis everywhere. About 10 minute walk to nearest underground station. Clarke Quay excellent for restaurants, dozens to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business stay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gillbhai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Copthorne waterfront for 18 nights for a business trip. This was my first time to Singapore so I wasn't sure about the location or the hotel. In the end everything turned out to be great. The hotel is a bit away from the center of the city (including areas like Beach Road, Orchard Road etc) so if you are thinking of catching the SMRT (Singapore Mass Rapid Transit) subway then the nearest station is Tiong Bahru which is quite a walking distance. Also if this is your first time in Singapore, getting taxis sometimes can be a pain especially on a Monday morning. The taxi queue on Monday's was especially brutal around 7am - 8am, so call ahead to the taxi company instead of waiting in line. I got the executive club room which is what I would recommend if you are on a business trip. There is an executive lounge on the 29th floor and it serves breakfast, snacks in the afternoon and evening, plus you can check out instead of going down from the executive club floor. The executive room gets you free breakfast in the executive club lounge or the buffet downstairs, free internet and two pieces of laundry along with all the non-alcoholic drinks from the minibar. The use of swimming pool and the fitness club is also included in the room rate. The room service was average with parata, chicken rice, cheesecake, fudge cake and banana split being the highlights (yes, I have a sweet tooth). There is an Italian restaurant Pontini in the hotel which is really good. I tried the Pasta e Fagioli soup which was okay but the lasagna was truly exquisite. The rooms were relatively small but for Singapore they were average size. Rooms were clean and the hotel overall was tidy. The service was excellent with everyone chipping in to create a great atmosphere. The hotel is relatively close to Zion hawker center, Great World city mall and the exquisite Five Star Chicken & Rice which are all walking distance. Overall the stay was really good and I would go back and definitely stay in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Copthorne Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: Twristiaeth
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a very good stay at the hotel. Internet is free for club rooms - charge for others (not published) We stayed in a club room which had the added advantage of using the club lounge for breakfast. There are also snacks during the day and drinks and snacks in the evening. It is approximately 3km from Marina Bay. There is a water taxi to Marina Bay (we gave up after 1/2 hour and got a taxi. The staff are very friendly and helpful. There are plenty of bars and restaurants close by alongside the river and it is close to China Town. I would certainly recommend this hotel and would return on a Singapore visit

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a bit on the expensive side.”
Reviews.Author: Capt_Camper
Reviews.Content: Location, Great. Rooms clean but small. Food Excellent. Staff Friendly. Alcohol very Expensive. Very Expensive. Try and avoid the bar. Try walking along the river some of the bars towards Clarke Quay have great food and more reasonably priced drinks. The Boomerang cafe is a favorite amongst the Expats. All the sports from Oz shown live most weekends.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION - BUT”
Reviews.Author: daviddruid
Reviews.Content: This hotel may be due for renovation so the comments and observations below should be viewed with this in mind. The location of this hotel, for those who like to vary their eating places and access to shopping without the expense of Orchard Road, is ideal. It is within walking distance along the river bank to Robertson Quay, Clarke Quay and if you like to walk a little further Boat Quay and Marina Bay. From the Fullerton Hotel or through the shopping centre at Marina Bay Sands you can watch the "light Show" most nights at 8.30pm. China Town is close by and for the best bargains get a taxi for 7 Sing Dollars to Bugis, everything from clothes to electronics. A Tiger beer at Bugis or Little India costs one third compared to Orchard Road. (Cost of a Tiger beer 3 to 4 Sing Dollars Orchard Road 12 to 14 Sing Dollars). The same applies for snacks or food. For the hotel itself, good prices are obtainable as packages but you will have to enquire for availability. The staff are very polite and always greet you by name, even on the first day. Rooms vary, hence my opening remark. If you are on a Club Floor, Check-in is on the 29th Floor at the Club Lounge, which offers complimentary breakfast 7am to 10.30am, free soft drinks and coffee/tea all day and free Cocktails/drinks with canape's from 6 to 8pm. The staff in the Club Lounge are outstanding with a real wish to assist. We found the Club rooms a little jaded and a few items not working as they should. The worst thing was the heavy sliding doors to the wardrobes which tend to "bang" so you can hear your neighbours quite clearly. The beds were very firm and are probably at the end of their useful life. It was noted that rooms on the 5th and 6th floors were better appointed and of course handy for the swimming pool which is also on the 6th floor. The swimming pool is rather disappointing being rather small and shallow (ideal for children) and service at the Poolside Bar is disappointing. Snacks and drinks are available but they have to be delivered from the "Room Service" area and the waiting times vary. The choice of restaurants is very good, Chinese, Italian, Western and Eastern buffet being available every day and night. The quality of food is excellent. Be careful when ordering a Gin and Tonic Water or Tonic water on it's own - you may end up with Soda Water in your drink. This is a misunderstanding not an intention to deceive, just ask for Tonic and not Tonic Water. As my normal choice of hotel location for many years has been in the Orchard Road area, this hotel was a break from the norm but as it turned out a good choice. The Conference rooms are excellent and well organised.

Reviews.Title: “A place to sleep....”
Reviews.Author: Lone K
Reviews.Content: Well placed along the river about 10 minutes walk from Clarkes Quay and 20 mins from Chinatown. The area around the hotel was lacking in facilities and it is a fair way from a MRT station. They advertise complementary bicycle hire but beware, it is on first come first serve basis and they have a total of 3 bikes! The breakfast area is reminiscent of a food court in a UK shopping centre and completely devoid of atmosphere. The rooms were not large but had the bare essentials you would expect for a hotel of this standard including internet for 28SD per 24 hrs!!! Nice riverside area for a drink if you are prepared to pay the prices in the bar. All in all if you are looking for a place to sleep it fills a gap, if you are looking for more than that, I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A lil old but functional for business traveller”
Reviews.Author: cylia82
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is right by the Singapore river, but not close to any MRT station. I like the short walk to Robertson Quay and Clarke Quay from the hotel, but there's really not much amenities around the hotel. The room was a little old to my taste, but still functional enough for business travelers as I was with one. Also their TV channels were limited in choices and boring.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for business and conference”
Reviews.Author: Soo L
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from October 25th till 28th for conference meeting. We were invited guests so this hotel was selected by the host of the conference, but the main reason I see why they have chosen this was due to the hotel's nice accommodated conference halls. They have quite many well managed conference halls, good catering. Breakfast was good but not more than average. There was a cook making the hot omellette on request which was the good part. But the selection of the fruit was not satisfactory. Rooms were very tidy and the bathroom was in good size and clean. Location however could be a bit problem for those who would like to move around w/ public transportation. I did not ask the front desk, but I couldn't see the Metro station nearby. We took a taki which was always stand-by at the front door. ON the back side of the Hotel, there was a water taxi stop. If you are interested on browsing the city in water line, it would be convenient. But this would be availalble upon pre-reservation since I didn't see the boat standing by. In 10 min. walk we could find good shopping mall. If you are in Singapore for business, I would definately recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff make a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gazzadav
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location despite not being close to the MRT. The walk along the river after crossing the a bridge to Clarke key is worth the experience. There are so many places to eat and drink. The staff at the hotel are very efficient and extremely helpful. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special, but nothing to grumble about”
Reviews.Author: mikebkk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Copthorne in early February, for two nights on a business trip. The location is good (though Singapore is pretty easy to get around anywhere) - restaurants and bars at Robertson and Clarke Quays are very close. The lobby is OK - nothing special - check in was reasonably efficient, very informative (detailed instructions on my complimentary internet) but done without a smile. The lobby was full of tour groups, so perhaps that explained why the reception staff were a little dour! The rooms are plain but effective - the bathroom small (no bath for me) but the bed comfortable, internet worked, there was a desk etc. Basically all that is required - no more, no less. My food experience was limited to room service (average) and the breakfast buffet (reasonably good). My first coffee was cold, and there was no-one on duty at the egg station when I arrived; but all in all an OK experience. All in all there is nothing bad to say, but nothing that the place really excels in either. I'd struggle to recommend the place but I'd probably stay again. If you can get a good deal, then you won't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Meets all basic expectations for a business traveller”
Reviews.Author: VLYC
Reviews.Content: + Room is large but a bit dated. + Wi-fi connectivity is good but the rate was on the high side. Surprised that it was not for free. + Plenty of taxis outside the hotel hence no problem with transportation. + Pool is small considering the size of the property. + Concierge was very helpful with printing facility. In summary : If you are combining holiday with work on the side, this is a decent alternative to 5 star business class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not worth it”
Reviews.Author: BabyHelsinki
Reviews.Content: I had huge expectations for this hotel as two different parties had recommended it. One of them had stayed in a club room, the other in Superior room. But I was disappointed. We had a Superior room that was ok, but the bathroom was very much out-dated. And not properly cleaned - there was a hair on the side of the shower and the lamps had dust on them that dated back from the 1990's probably! Also, our tv did not work as the transmitter was missing and we had to ask it to be mended. I had let the hotel know in advance that we were on our honeymoon, but they had not arranged anything special in the room - not even a bar of chocolate or a bowl of flowers.. A minus point comes also from the fact that in front of the hotel there are only the "luxury taxis" in a queue, and you end up paying a lot more driving them than taking a normal cab although there is nothing special about them taxis...! The location of the hotel is not too great, it is a 20-minute walk from the closest metro station. If you wish to stay in a Millenniun hotel, I would highly recommend the sister hotel Studio M which has a better location, much nicer rooms and a much nicer pool area. The pool area of Grand Copthorne is quite small, and what is worse is that there are two fountains by the pool, and the wind blows the water from the fountains to the sun chairs, so there are very few seats that you can actually sit on and sunbathe on if you do not want to get soaking wet! And what comes to sleep quality: the beds are lovely, very comfy. But the sound proofing is not too good, you can hear every noise in the corridoor! We woke up to children screaming every morning when they went for and came back from breakfast. What is good: we stayed on the 15th floor and the view from there is pretty nice.

Reviews.Title: “With all the other options, don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: cliffrose1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Copthorne Hotel January of 2012. The girl that checked us in was very unfriendly and short with our questions. The lobby and main floor of the hotel are beautiful, so we were expecting the same in our room. However this was not the case. On the surface everything seemed fine until I went to take a shower. The floor of the bathroom was very dirty, with hair and other things. It was obvious it had not been swept. The shower had black mold in all of the corners. But the worst thing of all were the bugs, There were tons of little black nats mostly in the bathroom but I did notice them within the rest of the room. We were on the 11th floor so I assume they are throughout the hotel. I am actually quite surprised no one else has mentioned them in other reviews. Maybe it is a recent issue. We did have a bug inspector come to our room without mentioning the problem so someone else must have complained. We could also hear people in the rooms next to us and in the hall as well, no sound proofing here! This hotel is nothing special and is not worth the money. It is out of the way so you have to take a taxi everywhere you would like to go. With all the other choices in Singapore I would certainly try somewhere else. The only plus is the Bellmen were extremely nice and helpful. They were very quick at luggage pick-up and delivery.

Reviews.Title: “Overall experience was satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Sutendra
Reviews.Content: We had chosen this hotel as the information given was that it is a nice resort atmosphere and located right on the CLARK QUAY. Both these points did not turn out to be true.

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: CVCHONG
Reviews.Content: Stayed a night in the hotel, 27th floor .. nice view facing the singapore flyer, singapore river, and the Marina bay sand. one thing to note is, the hotel is not at the centre of the city, if you dont mind walknig there is a shopping mall just near by. 15-20 mins of walking ..

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, good food, prompt service”
Reviews.Author: TRICOM
Reviews.Content: Had been here for the Second ISODA Tech Summit 2012 from 25th January 2012 to 29th January 2012 and travelling with a group of 124 PAX. The checkin and chekouts were guick and food was good during breakfast and two lunches that we organized and the guest were glad that the taste was very Indian and they really did not miss their home during the stay and were surprised to find dishes like Idli, Pav Bhaji, Puri aloo, chana batura etc during breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great property in a nice quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Steven E
Reviews.Content: The property is a good choice for this standard (it's rated 5 star. I would suggest 4.5 ). This was booked through Asiarooms.com at S$123 per night for a Superior twin on the 16th floor. The room was very well appointed and the quality of furnishings high. The hotel was virtually empty prior to Chinese New Year,but was full from the 25th January. The location for my needs was good, it's quiet and although not at the centre of things, being at Robertson Quay, it does have a neighborhood feel with terrific restaurants located along the riverfront. Room service at hotel was efficient and the quality of food good.We ate at Brio's (ground floor restaurant)for dinner one evening and it's quality was also good. All of the staff we came into contact were very friendly and efficient

Reviews.Title: “Great view from the upper floors”
Reviews.Author: wtgn_ling
Reviews.Content: Got upgraded to a higher floor facing the City Skyline. NIce views at night with the MBS and a full moon in the background. Room-wise, rather standard, not much difference from the other similar-starred hotels. Location-wise, slightly out-of-town but the riverside walk made up for it. Pleasant for a stroll along the riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating Stay - nobody answered phone”
Reviews.Author: windycity08
Reviews.Content: I agree with Tripadvisor Contributor ASEAN_Travellor. It was a frustrating stay for us who checked in 20th Jan and checked out 24 Jan, 2012. Their hotel has this "1Touch" button on the phone. Guests have no other access to assistance , only 1Touch. ( please take this advise seriously - only 1Touch , ok. ) So on night of 20th Jan, we hit the 1Touch button repeatedly over 40 min to get help for an extra Bath Towel for my child and Internet password. On hindside, we should have just taken the evalator down to the Front desk and get everything done in 5 minutes. So they should just throw their phones away. On Jan 23rd , my husband called 1Touch for 2 bath towels, 2 boxes of tissue and 2 hand towels. The chambermaid brought 2 bath towels and 2 toilet rolls !! Thats ok, I am a simple person, so we can blow our noses using the toilet paper. But what happened to the hand towels? So we had to call 1Touch again. My recommendation is AVOID, why put yourself at mercy of 1Touch ? If you are keen on this location , there are other hotels too : 1) Mirama Hotel 2) Riverview Hotel ( where a murder took place in a room over a decade ago ) 3) King's Hotel , sister hotel of Grand Waterfront , also has 1Touch but the staff seem more productive. The club lounge leads to a putting green, putters provided. 4) two Furama hotels - at least 30 years old but renovated Otherwise, find another location.

Reviews.Title: “Feels very old school...”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Teddies
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Grand Copthorne Waterfront before, and have had many of my meetings held there. While service is generally good, guest rooms on the other hand was quite a let down. I checked in late that day (about 10pm) and had to wait a good 15 mins before i was served at reception and there wasn't even a long queue. Just people checking in and enquiring. That's ok - maybe it was just my day. We were given a room on the 24th floor - nice and high, just like how we wanted it. The room had part view of the city, and part view of the river. Room was basically clean, but very dusty - to the point where you can run your fingers on the furniture and lift the dust with it. They had LCD TV, which is great, very modern and the bed was also comfy. The room however felt very basic and old school - how you would expect every hotel to provide - bed, TV, minibar, a chair, dressing table - and that was it. For a hotel like that, you would generally expect more. GC certainly Did Not have that extra "wow". The best part is the toilet - It was so tiny and cramped - the door actually opened just inches away from the toilet bowl. You can't help but wonder if the designer or architect actually miscalculated the size. Made the room big, but "Oooops... hmmm... now let's see, how do we squeeze in the toilet here..?" The toilet had a shower, a sink and a toilet bowl - for something that cost S$470 a night - its very very very very very basic. Wall paint is scraping off, cracks here and there. The toilet wall and tiles reminded me of an old HDB flat they lease out to senior citizens. I'm disappointed. Something i don't expect from a 4-star hotel, honestly.

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice hotel but need to be refurbished”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel004
Reviews.Content: First the hotel is not conventiently located unless you plan on using taxi all the time. There is no MTR station near by, and need to walk a bit to go to an animated area. Overall the hotel was plesant but the room was old and showing need for a refurbishment. Breakfast was decent. Looking for a 5 stars hotels, there would be better choice in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Made us very welcome”
Reviews.Author: I'madesertgirl
Reviews.Content: We had an unscheduled overnight in Singapore due to aircraft maintenance and after a number of hours delay at the airport were taken to this hotel for a day stay. The hotel would have only received a couple of hours notice that about 50 people were about to arrive unexpectedly but were extremely well organised. They provided a coach and separate luggage van to the airport so our luggage arrived at the hotel before us and was already unloaded. They also provided registration forms for us to complete on the coach so check in at the hotel (about 2pm) was extremely quick and efficient. I daresay they've had a similar situation previously. Our room was on the 18th floor and was enormous, with views over the river. By this time we'd been travelling for 24 hours so fell into bed for a few hours. And a very comfortable bed too. The bathroom was large, with a shower over bath and separate large and powerful shower and quality toiletries. We had dinner in Cafe Brio's which was a fantastic buffet with an enormous variety of hot and cold dishes - seafood, roasts, curries, sushi, tepenyaki, salads and a sumptuous spread of desserts. The restaurant was very busy but all the staff were cheerful and efficient with vacated tables being cleared quickly ready for new guests. After dinner we enjoyed a stroll along the river checking out all the other local cafes and restaurants - there were plenty of other options. We finished up staying overnight as our flight was further delayed and left early next morning so didn't get to sample breakfast. Based on the friendliness and efficiency of the staff, and the standard of room I would certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: 255093Sue
Reviews.Content: Our arrival was early (9.30am) but we were immediately taken to a room on the 26th floor which had fantastic views down the river day and night. The room was spacious and clean. Hotel is in a great spot out of the hustle and bustle a bit but within easy walking distance of Clark Quay (about 15 mins). Staff were very friendly and helpful. A taxi was always at the front door to take us wherever we wanted to go. Pool was nice, not enormous, but never had many people at it. I would definately stay here again, it was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “overall pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: zs29
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 12/25/11-12/28/11 and was satisfied. Room was a little on the small side. But location was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Give this one a miss”
Reviews.Author: schalcs
Reviews.Content: This is not a 5* hotel by Singapore standards. Location is on the waterfront but a good 10 minute walk from the MRT which can be tedious after a few days.We stayed in a club room which is worth the extra but you still have to take breakfast in the cafe downstairs as the club breakfast was cereal and a cup of tea ! As for the cafe it was very crowded and for couples the tables were really in the corridor !. Service was poor. For the price not good value there are better hotels in the area or stay at The Regent a real 5*

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paulinejoan
Reviews.Content: The Copthorne Waterfront Hotel is in a perfect position I think as its close to China Town and a subway not far away. I love eating breakfast in the restuarant as it overlooks the river. The breakfast was great and a full buffet. The rooms are nice and spacious. There is a shopping centre just down the road where there is plenty of restuarants. The staff is very helpfulas well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location, Affordable Rates”
Reviews.Author: FrankFurness
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel on the waterfront and only a 10 minute walk from Boat Quay and Clark Quay with it's mant restuarants. It is modern with a nice pool and gym, nice rooms and good food. A good choice. A little out of the way, you sometimes need to wait a while to get a taxi, also not close to any MTR stations.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: HannTi_Tan
Reviews.Content: I checked-in to the Grand Copthorne together with my wife, just last weekend, and after a long drive from KL. We had no issues with the checking-in, as everything was handled quite professionally and very quickly. Our room was located at Level 18, which was halfway up the building (it has 30 floors), and as such, it offered a good view of the brownish-looking Singapore River and the Raffles Place financial district in the distance. However, the room itself was a bit on the small side, although it was quite complete and came with a large King-sized bed together with LCD TV and usual writing desk. Toilet was also a bit cramped, mainly due to the wardrobe located on the same side and taking up a chunk of real estate space, resulting in there being no bathtub and just a shower stand instead. The Hotel did place a bottle of Mumm's champagne as well as a nice chocolate cake (both at my request) in the room as a small celebratory item, since it was both me and my wife's birthdays! One other bad thing is for the price we paid (SGD184++ per night), there was no free WiFi or broadband internet in the room and it was chargeable! Since most people now travel with either a notebook or iPad / iPod touch, there is a need to be able to check their urgent matters via the Internet. As such, I don't understand why there is a need to pay for access, and at quite high rates as well (SGD1.00 per minute, as well as one for 24-hours access)! Furthermore, when we asked the staff at reception for the WiFi password in the lobby, they said that this was chargeable as well, which is just too much! The location of the Hotel was at the Riverside, near Havelock Road, which probably explains their slightly lower prices for a 5-star. We were fortunate to have driven to Singapore as there is no way we could have walked the 15 minutes to Clarke Quay MRT station, without getting drenched or sweaty (it was raining throughout our stay in SG). It did help that the hotel provided a regular shuttle service to the Paragon Mall in Orchard Road, and there is also an abundance of taxis at the doorstep. Furthermore, the Great World City shopping complex is within 5 minutes walk and had, among others, a McDonald's outlet (our place for a supper!) as well as Marks & Spencer and a Golden Village cinema. Well, in short, what I can say is that for the price we paid, the Grand Copthorne is an affordable option for those traveling to Singapore, compared with the more expensive properties on Orchard Road. Of course, you must expect tired legs and sweaty shirts when trying to get to the nearest MRT station and slight inconvenience to checking emails, due to spotty Internet access!

Reviews.Title: “Bet thing about the hotel is its exec lounge.”
Reviews.Author: Vnehru
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Ok located. Good for shopping or business stays. Exec lounge is well run. Would recommend a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: stuartcardiff
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 9am after a long flight and we had asked for an early check in, the room was ready and we were given our room on the 30th floor,the view was amazing and the room perfect,my son and his new bride were also on the 30th floor,receptionist very helpful and courteous.We ate in the executive lounge on the 29th floor and the breakfast was very good, the staff were very attentive and profesional ,a special mention for Gina our waitress. The hotel is not in the middle of the night life but taxis are so cheap it doesnt really matter. We drank in the piano bar on a few occasions and found the drinks to be reasonably priced compared to uk and cheap by comparison to perth au. All in all a wonderful stay in a first class hotel. Mr wang i would like you to give my thanks to gina,jeff in the piano bar and joseph the bell boy for there kindness during our stay with my family and grandchildren. Only one negative: It would be nice to be able to take cocktails from 29th lounge to outside area or order drinks from piano bar,once again many thanks

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: perkins4108
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a week after coming down from Malaysia. I found the place to be quite cheap in relation to most hotels in Singapore and the quality of service and room standards is great. A few weeks ago I stayed in The Grand Hyatt by Orchard Road and paid at least twice as much as this hotel. When I am Singapore again I will definitely stay here. It seems that the hotels South of the river are so mch cheaper and yet it is only a few minutes by bus or taxi to the city centre. Summary, great hotel, great staff, great room and great service.

Reviews.Title: “stop over”
Reviews.Author: vicsta21
Reviews.Content: stayed her on stopover to Europe; rooms were clean and comfortable, view from the room was amazing Buffet breakfast(included in package) was good, plenty of variety although found restaurant expensive, plenty of close by restaurants to choose from amenities were satisfactory and hotel walking distance to many of the attractions of Singapore Staff were courteous and helpful. Pool was a small and a little disappointing would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with several shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: bradleystat
Reviews.Content: The pros: Rooms are ok, like simple clean European rooms. Neighborhood is up and coming trendy, right across the river are some slick high rises with new restaurants. The cons: 1. Weight room is basic, pool is not big, and sun deck goes into the shade at 12:45pm in the winter. If you like to tan by the pool, this is not a good hotel for you. 2. The hotel is a 10 min walk from Clark Quay, and the MRT. It's not really that far, but honestly if you want to spend time in Clark Quay or use the MRT, just get a room at the Swisshotel for the same price. 3. The restaurant for breakfast is weird. It is all spread out and there are pillars so that wherever you are seated, it's probably a 5 minute walk to get a glass of juice. It's just not a good layout for breakfast. And the food is blah.

Reviews.Title: “We wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Luna1951
Reviews.Content: We try and go to Singapore once a year, and we have stayed at the Grand Copthorne each time since it was about 18 months old. We love it, it is in a beautiful location, the rooms are very good with large windows letting in plenty of light, and the staff are all so friendly. They have recently updated the furniture and fittings in the rooms and it looks very smart, a good choice of everything. A large shopping complex, Great World City, with good shops and places to eat is only 5 minutes walk, and it has a supermarket too if you need anything. Breakfast is always good, catering for different nationalities and the dining area is lovely with full height windows and views of the river. It always feel like home away from home to us and we will continue to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice riverside option”
Reviews.Author: SweetTea1831
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for something away from the shopping areas and more geared towards entertainment, the riverside area near the hotel offers many nice restaurants and bars, and this hotel is walking distance (20 minutes) to Clarke Quay. For shopping, we used a taxi to get to Orchard Rd and took only 5 minutes and less than $5 SGD. In the hotel, there are plenty of lifts so waiting time is minimal even with multiple events going on. We didn't use any of the restaurants in the hotel but there are several options. The gym is small and dated. It rained the whole time we were there so we didn't get to use the pool, though it looked nice. In the room that we had, the bathroom is tight between the toilet and the door, but the shower is roomy. We had free wifi which we consider a huge plus. Overall the hotel is clean, friendly, a good base for going out and exploring, and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hidden gem away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: Veronica1984
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on a recent solo getaway to Singapore as i got a really good deal for the rooms for two nights. First and foremost, the location of the hotel is by the riverside hence it is away from the hustle bustle of Singapore city in some sense. There are two MRT station nearby (i.e Clarke Quay and Outram Park). Not exactly a short walk but the walk is quite pleasant to Clarke Quay along the Singapore River where you will pass Robertson Quay and Boat Quay, this should take around 15 minutes. Alternatively you may opt to take a taxi which should cost you about SGD 5 to the nearest MRT or opt to take the free shuttle that the hotel provides which takes you to Orchard Road. The hotel is clean and cosy, and it seems to be more for business travellers. The service in general is acceptable but I would think it could be better. IMHO, an extra smile on the face and a pleasant morning greet from the service staff would do wonders. While they are helpful but only if you enquire. Room is clean and has all the necessary ammenities, however i do like the fact that the hotel is going green and thus invest in water saving shower heads and faucets. Unable to comment on the food as i did not eat there. Overall it was a pleasant experience however the service could be a tad warmer and checkout needs to be a bit efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to standard”
Reviews.Author: ThailandTazz
Reviews.Content: There are many better places to stay for the same cost. I recently stayed two nights, had quite a few bad experiences, and I have stayed at many Singapore hotels. The in room TV volume is very low, called the engineers who spent some time trying to fix the problem, but eventually told, it is the managers decsison to reduce the TV volume and he could not alter it. TV volume was so low, you could not hear the sound, and I am not deaf. Wanted to eat at the Chinese restaurant, was kindlly given directions by reception staff, but it was shut. Returned to concierge and asked where I could get some sweet and sour pork and directed to Red House restaurant, and walked there. On arrival, they did not serve sweet and sour pork. Not a big deal, but staff really did not have a clue. Rooms are dated, hair dryer did not work, bathroom not clean, I could go on, but avoid this hotel and book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “My Short trip stay at Executive Club”
Reviews.Author: Schrodder
Reviews.Content: I was waiting for room to be ready early in the morning. I checked in via the ground reception and they told me that the room is not ready and i was directed to level 29 for check in. Was so tired after a long flight but i managed to maintain my behavior. Preparing to listen to another explanation from guest relation staff at level 29, till this young gentleman offered me to sit down and about to prepare the necessary process. He did professionally and informed me very straight forward that the hotel was running high occupancy last night and due to that most of the room was occupied. He did mentioned, he will monitor the status of my room closely and i was surprised he did offered me for a breakfast and a Coffee Latte (two thumbs up) at the Executive Club Lounge with a superb panoramic view which overlooking the South China Sea (he told me that while on Cocktail Hour). Surprisingly within 15minutes,i was told that my room will be ready for about 30mins and i was glad that he expedite the process for my room to rest after 18hour flight journey. The rest of the team- i guess the manager, a lady was another superb excellent service. ( She works in morning (breakfast) and i see her working hard till late at night (after the cocktail hour). With the price i paid, benefits, professional butler services, and excellent services i should say my P.A did a good job for choosing this hotel and here i am would like to Thank you to the young gentleman who is fully sincere in his job. Well Done. See you again on March 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Riverside serenity”
Reviews.Author: GeelongFlanders
Reviews.Content: We stayed for eights in November 2011, selected a Club Room, and enjoyed excellent friendly and efficient service from the enthusiastic and helpful staff. The access to eating areas along the river offered a huge selection of places to enjoy the atmosphere and watch the passing parade. Clark Quay is only a short stroll, with a bit further to walk to the Merlion. The executive club on the 29th floor offered excellent value. The staff were helpful in suggesting and arranging places of interest to visit without being pushing. When my wife was unwell for a short time we had as much help and assistance we could ever need. The location is a little far from the MRT, but there is a shuttle bus hourly on a circuit including Orchard Road, and taxis are cheap and plentiful most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: dannyanb
Reviews.Content: Nice, renovated hotel. the rooms are nice and modern. the business lounge has a magnificent view but is small and often full. the river is just below and as new restaurants open the hotel will gain in location.

Reviews.Title: “Good for corporate stays, won't recommend for a personal stay”
Reviews.Author: AdhisheshS
Reviews.Content: The GCW is a great hotel when one wants to talk about architecture, layout, conference halls and everything else related to a corporate setup. The service staff was great. The cleanliness in the lobby and other public areas of the hotel was great. The size of our room, a dlx double, was not as large as you would expect at a multistar property like this. The rooms on the waterfront view are much better and larger than the city view. A walk along the waterfront is a hotel attraction. It's a regular jogging strip for many & is a great promenade. The breakfast spread was good. The cuisine had Chinese, Indian, English & the other local delicacies. The turnoffs were few but pretty major. The bathtubs in our room (a deluxe double) were tainted yellow as if they had not been cleaned for a long time. The biggest turnoff was the paid Internet, as high as $28 a day. All in all, the GCW ensures you a good stay but not if you want to do a romantic getaway or a personal kids trip. More of a business destination this.

Reviews.Title: “2 nights en route to London”
Reviews.Author: Nicholap19
Reviews.Content: Good, clean, excellent service. The room was fine but we had a view of the road rather than the lovely riverside. The bathroom was small, the toilet and bathroom door almost touched but on the plus side the shower (no bath) was large with good water pressure. There were some issues with maintenance in the room, some of the lighting was not working and the voile curtains were very dirty. The room, although given to us as a non smoking room, smelt of cigarette smoke and this had obviously impregnated the curtains. The location on the riverside was superb, an easy walk to Clark Quay. There is a little grocery shop just the other side of the pedestrian bridge which is very useful for cold drinks and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great room”
Reviews.Author: Christine_sing
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a club room, which was in my case located on the top floor. Did not have the view over the river and the city skyline (get even numbers for that), but never mind. The rate included 2 free laundry items per day, free access to the club lounge (breakfast), and free soft drinks from the minibar. All in all, great value. At breakfast which was comparatively underserved by the food selection, the staff was extremely helpful with requests. Within walking distance is Great World City, a mall where you have a supermarket and all sorts of other things. After all, this is Singapore. Things work.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Asian_traveler2011
Reviews.Content: Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel is located at Havelock road amidst 6 -7 other hotels... Interestingly, all of them are booked most times! The hotel is very close to a range of attractions like Botanic Garden Singapore, Singapore Flyer, Harbourfront, Singapore Nightlife & Singapore River. Also, it's very close to the Central Business District for business travelers. And yes, the happening Zouk Club is close by too :-) Also, the River Taxi by the Waterfront is a good option to folks who are heading to the Marina Bay Front - it's about 45-minute River Cruise! The room was quite spacious with very comfortably sized Kings sized bed. The overall service was impressive. Also, breakfast buffet offered a sumptuous spread - perhaps, the reason to Cafe Brio was too crowded in the morning! Piano Bar offers a good of cocktails, beers and bar snacks. Live screening of all major sporting events is also available at the upper deck.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: YYCLady
Reviews.Content: This hotel was accommodating with many requests and comfortable for a 3 night stay -- minor complaint was distance to MRT station (about a 10 minute walk) but we had brilliant weather. This was also the ONLY place that would accommodate 3 adults in a room with a king bed and an additional cot. I did not eat at the hotel ~ but sampled the Executive Level Lounge for breakfast and happy hour (additional charge that turned out to be worth the extra $$'s) every day and found the food adequate for the purpose (breakfast and happy hour! hard to mess those up)... My person gauge is: Would I stay again? the answer for this hotel: Yes

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: rakesh18uk
Reviews.Content: location: middle of nowhere room: good room service: arrived on time but food looked so unappealing. not worth the price. especially paying sgd8++ for a small glass of milkshake. there are better places for similar price. best avoid

Reviews.Title: “Our two stays were fab!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Durhamlady13
Reviews.Content: Playing catch up with reviews so this one is a bit late. Our first stay was in Jan 2011 for over three weeks. My husband had been in Singappore on business for well over 6 months and had sampled a good selection of hotels and the Waterfront was by far the best he had come across.Its location is perfect, slightly out of the hussle and bussle but picking up a rivertaxi right outside the hotel is a joy in itself or a lovely stroll along the riverside to Clarkes Quay to pick up the MRT or a taxi direct from the hotel - all are very cheap.There's easy access to cafes, shops etc. We booked a club room with a fantastic view over the river - simply stunning. the level of service was outstanding. My husband was at work all day and my hours were dawdled away by lazy mornings by the lovely pool and lunch in the club lounge - they serve snacks and beverages all day - the coffee latte was to die for.Interenet access was good and free daily laundry was a bonus.I spent over three weeks there and loved it!!They deliver everything that they promise in the hotel describtion apart from they can't describe the wonderful service.We headed off to Australia for five weeks and on our return to the UK returned to the Grand Waterfornt for a few days.We were welcomed by staff and even the duty manager took the time to look us up and deliver a rather good bottle of wine to us.Home from home?? This hotel certainly is. My only negative remark is that my husband relocated with work so our stay with the Waterfront came to an end.I long to return. Well done The Waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby chic without the chic”
Reviews.Author: yeemui
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a short break at the end of Oct 2011. For the rate, I expected a LOT better. Comparing this hotel with others in Singapore within the same price bracket and age (I've stayed in a quite a few over the years for work and holiday), it just doesn't hold its own. My overall impression of our room was shabby - there were chunks of marble missing in the bathroom, mold was coming through the wallpaper in the bathroom, the carpet in the bedroom felt musty and, sorry, dirty, under (bare) foot so I kept the slippers on. Outside, the corridor smelt of really bad air freshener that seemed to be coming from the carpets! Anyone familiar with "shake n vac" will know what I mean!! All this was on the top floor, to which we had apparently been "upgraded" after we checked-in well within the check-in period and dutifully waited 50 min for a room that didn't appear (I wonder whether the "upgrade" was to a room that was kept for dire emergencies, such as when there is no room available and there should be one!!). The food was pretty poor for Singapore, and for a supposed 5-star Singapore hotel, and way overpriced. With young kids, it isn't always easy just to nip out, so I was at the mercy of the hotel catering, unfortunately. The service was fine when we got it, but there were too many examples of staff either run off their feet (breakfast buffet, room service) or simply MIA (concierge in the morning, reception at the Italian restaurant). All in all, the hotel needs to bite the bullet, renovate and update.

Reviews.Title: “Second time staying here and still a joy!”
Reviews.Author: camak
Reviews.Content: I chose this place again since there was a good deal including a deluxe room and breakfast. We stayed for three nights in a smoking twin deluxe room on the 13th floor. Had an amazing view of the river and city this time, and also a huge bathroom with both shower and separate bath. Absolutely love the beds here they are super comfy! Room was very clean each day. We also enjoyed the buffet breakfast - loved the hashbrowns! The staff at the front desk were professional and welcoming. Check in and out was quick. Our check out was extended til 2pm for free which was awesome. The free shuttle bus to orchard road, Chinatown and Clarke quay was great. I really think this hotel is great quality and priced well in comparison to many hotels in the same class. Singapore accommodation is very expensive so I know that I'll be staying here whenever I travel to Singapore for work or play! Thanks again grand copthorne!

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelgigg
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week on business at this hotel. It is clean, well managed and very friendly. If anything it maybe needs a little sprice up due to the high volumes of traffic - this hotel is busy! The staff are very obliging. The otel is not on the MRT line - so taxi is essential. However it is on the river which is pleasant to amble along. there are many restaurants along the river to choose from and all in walking distance - albeit that they are predomiately "Western" food style options.

Reviews.Title: “A truly fabulous week here with my young family!”
Reviews.Author: rpmalone
Reviews.Content: On the way back to the UK from Australia, we spent a week here as a family. When we arrived we were upgraded at no extra cost as they considered our room too small (two adults and two toddlers). We were booked into the Executive Club Lounge and this proved a real winner, with breakfast, high tea and happy hour ( hors d'oeuvres and all drinks on tap from 6pm - 8pm every evening!) all within the price. As we had small kids, they really looked out for us. The concierge was excellent and we felt very looked after, especially by the team at the Exec Club Lounge. There's a good pool and a small gym, all of which we used. The breakfast on the ground floor is pretty comprehensive or you can stay up in the lounge and opt for a smaller more boutique style brekkie.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wow!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GoaKuldeep
Reviews.Content: An amazing hotel. Got different smoking and non smoking floors. Superb service. Amazing food. Lovely ambience. Closely to a lot of places like Clarke qay, world super mart, zeop disco. A highly recommended place to stay in singapore..

Reviews.Title: “False Advertising and Untrained staff”
Reviews.Author: ASEAN_traveller
Reviews.Content: I booked the Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel online. It was presented on Agoda as a Five Star. Although they may like to see themselves as a Five Star, they are anything but. The rooms are dated.and not maintained. Being classified as a Five Star, I expected a four point bathroom with a separate shower from the bathtub...guess again. Wallpaper was dirty and coming off the wall. On top of that, service was that of a three star. When I checked in, I asked about internet and was told it was $28 per day. When I went to access, the instructions did not match those on the tent card in the room and I called their "one stop" service which took about ten rings to answer, only to find out that internet was included in my rate. It would have been nice if the Receptionist would have check before telling me I must pay. In preparation for the next morning, I inquired if there was any shuttle to SunTec conference centre to be told no and it was a ten minute taxi ride. Well, the next morning, I happened to grab a shuttle schedule for Orchard Road for later that day, only to find that there was a shuttle to SunTec. Again, misinformation. I would not recommend to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average 4* Hotel, value for money ?”
Reviews.Author: Thefox_11
Reviews.Content: I'm a little let down by the average hotel. Nothing really wrong with it, it was just that I was expecting more for the price and the fact it is a bit further away from everything. Small things like no ATM machine or convenience stores nearby. 10-20 minute walk to robertson quay and clarke quay, a bit further than I would like in the humidity. Rooms are basic but finctional and clean. Would I stay there again ..... only if was at a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore..”
Reviews.Author: dipu2011
Reviews.Content: Singapore, a common destination now, still is one of my fav places..The hotel we stayed at this time, Grand Copthorne....failed ti impress me much. Though it is some 10 mins from Clark Quay area it seems a lil far from the regular hang out joints. The rooms are average just like any other biz hotel....it doesnt give a feel of luxury. The breakfast buffet spread is also nuthing great....but despite it it does not come cheap. The staff is friendly, overall is was a average experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Standard Hotel, nothing outstanding”
Reviews.Author: KLP63
Reviews.Content: After a efiicient and friendly check in I arrived in my room to discover it was not the room type I requested. After phoning the front desk I was offered another room but infomred that it would not be available for an hour or so. As I was planning to go out anyway this worked well. When I returned I collected my new key and found my luggage in the new room. The next thing was discovering that the hpone in the room did not wokr, meaning a trek down to the front desk to report the fault. Again the problem was fixed quickly. The room was spacious and clean and bathroom well equipped. The hotel is certainly not in the centre of things however it is only a quick walk to the Great World Plaza and a quick taxi ride to Scotts/Orchard Road. My stay of 2 nights went quite smoothly apart from the initial problems. The hotel was quite good, though nothing outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Very good except the wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: ibnibatutta
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. A very good business hotel. My only complaint is that there is no complimentary wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Kajol D
Reviews.Content: Rooms not cleaned after check-in. Ants on bed on 2nd day. Impersonal staff at the reception and dining

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation”
Reviews.Author: tatho7367
Reviews.Content: We have spent 6 nights at the Copthorne Waterfront. The room was clean and spacious with nice panoramic view of the city and the river. The bathroom had separate bath and shower. Room was cleaned daily. We arrived quite late and a big disappointment - the children beds were not ready. Although pointed out to the reception we ended up tipping the luggage guy to organize the beds for us. We also did not have enough towels. It took the reception 2 days to finally provide us with everything we needed. The internet access was very expensive. The breakfast at the hotel was ok but quite pricey so we only had it once. The waterfront area offers a variety of nice restaurants for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The jogging along the river is a nice experience. Although the hotel is a little bit away from the CBD it is easily accessible by taxi. Overall it was nothing special about this hotel. The service was below our expectations, however we enjoyed the view and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but watch for the other costs.”
Reviews.Author: Grahame_B255060
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week while we were in town for the Grand Prix. Got upgraded to one of the nice serviced apartments on the 5th floor. Really liked the stay. Room nice, two big screen TV's, a shower that can fit more than one person, full sized bath and fully equipped kitchen. Everything nice and clean, and people seemed always to be happy and helpful. However, if you supply a cappichno machine, it would help if coffee and milk was supplied. I've never stayed in a place that did not supply milk. Tried the Happy Hour one evening. It didnt make me happy. 6 beers and a plate of chips - $98. $28 per day for internet access, and $10 for ordinary coffee at the bar. These are the things that annoy travelers. While the hotel is a little away from the CBD, a shuttle bus every hour will get you around. A shopping centre five minutes walk away serves coffee at a resonable price, and the food hall has a great lunch for about $5. The MRT (subway) station is about a 10 minute walk. A taxi got us to the Grand Prix for $4.30 in about 5 minutes. Why catch the train?? Taxis from the Grand Prix back cost $10, and there was 2 people in the queue. Anyway, back to the Hotel - I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Rajan G
Reviews.Content: very supportive staff,we had a room facing the river,good view ,good food loved to stay again there

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel Good Location”
Reviews.Author: RICHOSingapore
Reviews.Content: Check in Staff were excellent. We arrived early in the morning and they had a room ready for us by 10:00am and with a free upgrade to a deluxe room with a great view along the Singapore River toward Boat Quay.
