The hotel is within easy walking distance to Robertson Quay. We stayed 2 nights and would definitely stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated!”
Reviews.Author: SNTas
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay at an over rated hotel thrs busy and impersonal without any extra service then stay here, they will happily take your money! Won't use this one again

Reviews.Title: “Better then Average but not very good.. Singapore you are awesome.....”
Reviews.Author: Sunil-Globetroter
Reviews.Content: Checked into this for 3 days, with my wife on my honeymoon trip in Singapore. We had heard so much about singapore and really excited to enjoy the singapore. However we were driving from Malaysia to Singapore and were a bit tired as it took us about 6 hours to reach Singapore. So when we reached the hotel we were too tired to notice anything. The room was a little small for our expectation, as this was suppose to be a five star hotel. We didnt have much time to think about our room then cos we have planned a trip to the night safari that night and it was awesome. We came back to room and had a good night sleep that night as next day we were suppose to head to the unviersal studios. All the Major attractions a re quiet close to the hotel and at a max 30 mins drive to any of the attractions. The night life on clark quay is very close and can be reached in 5 mins drive or 15 mins by walk. The room has a good view to the Flyer. The china town as well is very close to the hotel. Most importantly the shopping center, little India and Mustafa market is quiet close and will cost abt 28 to 30 SGD for a taxi ride. The breakfast in the hotel was decent. A honest review would be that we liked the hotel, but honestly we were so much into seeing singapore that we never bother what the hotel had and what it didnt. yet in my opinion the Hotel is good, but not as good as what Singapore itself has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel In Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Tingdene
Reviews.Content: A wonderful Hotel that is situated in close proximity to Robertson Quay, Clark Quay, China Town and within easy reach of the Orchard Road shopping extravaganza. The staff were most helpful and friendly an could not do enough to help us. A thoroughly enjoyable week and we will stay in this hotel when we return to Singapore and recommend the hotel to our friends

Reviews.Title: “Claims to be five star but is reaaly a sub standard three star hotel”
Reviews.Author: gillingworth
Reviews.Content: Reception was slow. It took 30 mins to check in at 3pm on a friday aftrrnoon. The room was smallest I have stayed in in Singapore. The bathroom was very ordinary and tight. The privacy was non existant. I could hear my next door neighbour rustle paper !! I am now very intimate with his business !! Confidential telephone calls impossible. Price over the top for what you get and compares poorly with competition. Will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: pgiess
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stopover in Singapore and wanted a 5 star hotel to relax and recover. We arrived early on a UK flight so were tired but were given a room straight away. As we had a late flight the next evening we asked about an extended checkout time and was offered 2pm. The room was large and the bed fantastic. It was a $5 cab ride to Orchard Road which in the heat was a must. The ION Plaza was about 15-20minute walk away but would recommend the taxi. The new ION plaza is also worth a visit and the food court had pretty much anything you'd desire. We ate breakfast in the buffet restaurant and you'd have to be pretty picky to fault it. All in all we thought our hotel stay was exactly what we'd hoped it to be. The airport trip by taxi was about $20-$25 as well. We'll definately stay there again on our trips between UK and Aus.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and airy hotel for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: JMFTravels
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and airy feel. Staff are friendly and a great location for restaurants, tourism and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly dissapointing.”
Reviews.Author: Hoppy35
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the "5" Star Grand Copthorne Waterfront SIngapore. We all thought the little things needed some attention. We had to change rooms after 1 night as the toilet wasn't sucurely attatched to the floor and the bathroom sink wouldn't drain properly. We had a package with buffet breakfasts thrown in but the majority of the the time, the food was luke warm as well as the coffee and tea. The alcohol prices are slightly dear in Singapore but the prices this hotel were charging was ridiculous! $15 for a pint of tap beer when the Singapore Slings were only $1 more at $16! I'm sorry but that is crap in anyones language and after coming in to your hotel after a stinking hot day I would love nothing more than to sit down at the bar for a drink without gasping everytime I opened my wallet. On the up side, it was comfortable and the trainee wait staff in the restaurant were exceptional, especially with our 11 month old daughter which they adored. If you are looking for comfortable accomodation then this venue would be fine, but if you enjoy all the little things being perfect which in a 5 star hotel, they should be, then I would not recommend the Grand Copthorne Waterfront SIngapore.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Location....but not great value”
Reviews.Author: snrman
Reviews.Content: Stayed over a weekend while transiting on to India. The hotel is located (barely) walking distance to Clark Quay - 15 to 20 minutes along the Singapore river. A pleasant walk. For those looking for nightlife, Singapore's premier nightclub, Zouk, is next to the hotel. Orchard road less than 10 minutes by taxi. Stayed on the Club Floor. Service was good, but must say the breakfast and evening cocktails/snacks were not overly generous. I was a frequent visitor to Singapore 2006-2009, and recall other 5-star hotels having better amenities. Room was adequate, but a bit tired. Fitness center and pool was quite adequate, but not in the same league with many of the hotels in Singapore. Certainly not a bad experience, but I would consider other hotels and shop around. I felt the price (SGD350/night) quite excessive for a weekend night.

Reviews.Title: “La Residenza Serviced Suites at the Grand Copthorne”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy O
Reviews.Content: As a family travelling with young children, it can be pretty difficult to find a suitable place to stay in Singapore. Nearly all of the hotels are mainly set up for the business crowd, and serviced apartments, while very good, are very expensive - with some having a long minimum stay. La Residenza is a group of serviced apartments located on the 5th and 6th floors of the Grand Copthorne, and I'm very pleased that we found out about them. To get the less positive out of the way, the pool area is small and rather unimaginative. If you have young children, note that there is no paddling pool - just a few steps down into the main pool, with the main pool being 1.2 meters deep. The pool towels were not reliably replenished during the day. On the upside, the pool isn't that heavily used anyway, and we often had the use of it to ourselves. The hotel is in a rather picturesque location on the Singapore river, and you can take a river taxi from just outside the hotel if you prefer. It's quite a long walk to the MRT, but the hotel puts on a regular shuttle to Orchard Road. This leaves promptly, but take care to arrive early at the bus stop when returning to the hotel, as the bus doesn't keep reliably to the timetable, and often arrives about 10 minutes early at Orchard Road. The apartments are of a modern design, thoughtfully equipped with fittings and furnishings of a high standard. The bed is one of the most comfortable I have slept in at a hotel, and there is no noise from outside or from other rooms, despite being very close to Zouk, one of Singapore's premier nightspots. The staff are, without exception, friendly and very efficient. If I had to single out a particular department for praise it would be housekeeping, who managed to meet even a couple of unusual requests. However, the reception, concierge and restaurant staff were all very good indeed. Rooms are cleaned daily to a very high standard, with a nice bonus of several complimentary water bottles being left in the kitchen each day. The restaurant, Brio's, is quite good, and well priced for such an establishment. While it is possible to get better, the quality and quantity of food was very reasonable for the price. In summary, I am very likely to return next time I go to Singapore, and would recommend La Residenza to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, slightly off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: atreides75
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Grand Copthorne for 8 nights during a business trip to Singapore. It is a well established hotel at the riverside, about 10min walk away from Clarke Quay. Decent facilities as can be expected from a 4* hotel. My only reservation is it that the location is slightly off the beaten track, the nearest MRT station (if I am not mistaken) is at Clarke Quay, which means that you either use the bus (stop is right off the main entrance) or take a cab to go places like Orchard Rd or Marina Bay. Overall - for business travel, it is a good option, for hols I would probably stay in more central location.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: sariban
Reviews.Content: Our family has just had a very comfortable stay at the Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel. The staff were amazing, especially Ryan who looked after us on the Executive Club level. We had a comfortable, refreshing stopover. Room was spacious and comfortable. Great views. The only (slight) drawback is distance to a MRT station - however it is very convenient if travelling west to Jurong attractions such as the Bird Park, Science Centre etc. City Sightseeing buses are a 5 minute walk away, as is a Hawker market and large Shopping Mall. Would thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for Business visits”
Reviews.Author: Ode_to_Joy_9
Reviews.Content: Nice location in terms of proximity to the riverfront. Good Conferencing and Meeting room facilities. Gym and Swimming facilities are good. Rooms are well equipped and Service a is good. The breakfast was well prepared. Slightly far from an MRT station- 1.2 kms.from Outram Park.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: CassieSC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night on the return leg of a trip and booked it through a travel agent who got a much better deal than we were able to find anywhere else. As our flight wasn't until late at night the 4pm checkout our travel agent had included in our deal was appreciated. All of our requests at time of booking were followed through by the hotel right down to the river-view room and we even arrived to find our son had been provided with his own bed when he was going to just share our king size one and a timber cot was provided for our baby. The room was easily big enough for the 4 of us and our luggage. The pool area was pleasant and provided a welcome relief from the heat and a good chance for our son to unleash some energy after a day of travel. The staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was good with a lot of choices. I am sure there are fancier hotels in Singapore but this hotel met our needs well for our short stay and was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: zaqxswcde
Reviews.Content: Looking at the ranks on the Tripadvisor one thing came to my mind; "Who doesn't know the hotel is good when it's a five-star hotel located in the heart of a city and expensive?" I mean, for most of the travelers, they are looking for the best deal in town which is affordable and convenient. Well, if you are one of those travelers, this place is it. Located within 15 minutes walking distance from CBD(Central Business District) and along the Singapore River, this hotel offers 5 star service with a 4 star price. One of the best things about this hotel is that it has a superb complementary breakfast compared to other hotels in this area. The 'not so good thing' is that there's a famous club called "Zook" right next door. It's not noisy, but there's always a bunch of drunken fools around especially late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Family trip in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Mohd S
Reviews.Content: We had a great Stay in Grand Copthorne, it's a clean and very organized Hotel! The room was clean and the room service team very efficient......only the swimming pool was a bit too small! But this is my seven years old son complain! The breakfast in Cafe Brios is very good, but the gold medal goes to Porcini, the Italian Restaurant: the modern look of this outlet is amazing and the food, superb. The wine somelier, a guy from the Philippine is very helpful and the Chef (He seems like Nintendo's Supermario is very polite and funny in the some time! Good job!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice but with a few minor hiccups”
Reviews.Author: motheroftwoin
Reviews.Content: It was a good hotel which was a little pricey. But I guess Singapore has become very expensive with respect to hotel rates. As we entered, they were going absolutely full. We had a booked a total of 5 rooms in the hotel for five nights. We had gotten off a red eye flight and we were all just dying to see our bed. We entered the hotel at 10 am. When we booked the rooms, we were informed that one room would be given by 11 am so that we could rest and that the other rooms will be given as and when they were cleaned up. But no amount of requesting or pleading helped. We were given our first room at 1:30 PM ,after we were forced to spend a sleepy 3.5 hours at the coffee shop. Later when we looked out of the window we saw a great number of pool loungers. They could have suggested that we slept on the pool loungers which were going totally free The bell desk was very efficient in handling the luggage. The breakfast: The room rate included a sumptuous breakfast which was a blessing as we could set out for the day without worrying about when our next meal was going to be. We did not have the opportunity to eat any other meal at the hotel. Housekeeping was good and quietly efficient. They never cribbed to bring extra towels, pillows or sheets. The main impression one gets of the lobby is a constant crowd with large noisy groups of people waiting to check in or check out. It is a very well located hotel with a couple of malls close by. It was very easy to hail a taxi to get to Orchard Road ro anywhere else. Overlooking the Singapore river, the view out of the windows was fantastic to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: shettymanohar
Reviews.Content: Hi. Was on vacation to Singapore with my family and i was suggested this place by one of my friend, the place is really nice and had a pleasant stay here with family, not one of the best but definitely worth staying

Reviews.Title: “Good Place...”
Reviews.Author: lrmsaldanha
Reviews.Content: Nice palace to stay...they have complimentary shuttle service to many places in Singapore...friendly staff..

Reviews.Title: “Great views, nice waterfront”
Reviews.Author: Tadashii66
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly typical Singapore hotel - Asia-lite, easy to stay in, hugely professional, slightly anonymous. But the waterfront cafe is very nice, the food as good as any international Asian hotel and our conference room spacious and well laid-out. So a perfectly good option to consider.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it & if we come back to Singapore we will stay here”
Reviews.Author: Jaschl0
Reviews.Content: When we booked we booked into an Executive Room, & because of this we were entitled to "The Executive Club ", & the "extras" that went with this, the service was great & the staff gave superb service. The room was very good with a view of the Singapore River.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel...almost faultless.”
Reviews.Author: CaryF
Reviews.Content: The best hotel we have stayed in at Singapore for the price . We had a great room that was a very generous size/clean/ modern (there is even space in the mini bar fridge to put extra drinks in that we had purchased -some hotels have electronic sensors in the fridge so that if you move mini bar items around they try and charge you & also have no spare room in the fridge to force you to buy from the hotel).We had good views and the breakfasts were great with huge selection of good quality food. There is a short walk (10-15 min ) required to get to the best restaurants along the river & the central sightseeing areas but the hotel does have its own shuttle service and ample public taxis outside the front entry if you prefer. The real stand-out is the fantastic service, we arrived on a dawn flight from Europe and went to the Hotel to drop off our luggage so that we could get some breakfast and do a bit of early morning sight seeing, as our check in was not until 2.00 pm. On arrival the front desk immediately ordered a urgent room clean, gave us access to the Hotel lounge and pool area and had us in a room by 10am, less than 2 hours after our arrival. All of the service from the staff was exemplary, they had a good sense of humour & were more than happy to give their advice on things to do in Singapore etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with a nice location and a lovely view”
Reviews.Author: eddieU84
Reviews.Content: As expected with a Hotel in Singapore, the stay was a satisfying one. The Hotel is a very impressive looking building located very conveniently close to the Business districts. When inside, the service is fast, friendly and efficient. The rooms are well laid out and well equipped with all basic amenities. The food is quite good with a fair basket of offerings for vegetarians. Room service is Prompt. Another fantastic facility is a One dial option on your room phone. No matter what service you require, there is only 1 number to dial. The conference facilities are excellent and the rooms, vary spacious. Coffee and food is very good too. Coming to the downsides, for a business traveler, connecting to Wi-fi is a bother for 2 reasons - 1. You need to pay an arm and a leg for internet facility and 2. The connectivity and speed is very poor. Honestly, in today's age, surely you could expect a free Wi-fi and better speeds from a Hotel of this class.Another bugbear is the small size of the bathroom, especially the bathing area which feels extremely claustrophobic All in all however, the stay was a very comfortable one with very good quality beds and pillows !!

Reviews.Title: “Name sounds great”
Reviews.Author: MALTP
Reviews.Content: Just the name sounds great. CheckIn and out takes very long. Unefficient staff at the reception, asking twice for the same thing, slow and partly friendly. Breakfast is OK but not really special. To all coffee lovers: coffee here is a punishment! Rooms are not in best shape. There are definitely better hotels in Singapore at this rates.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Riverside Hotel with business efficiency”
Reviews.Author: Sogoesit
Reviews.Content: On the Singapore River and Havelock Road this hotel is, welcomingly, away from the hustle of the business centre hotels and reasonably priced. Very convenient for a walk down the riverside and to most other attractions in SIngapore. Everything within a few minutes taxi ride or 15 minutes or so walk. If doing business In Singapore take a Club priced room that has many "complimentary" extras rolled-into the price. Rooms are spacious and adequately furnished. There is also an ApartHotel section called La Residenza which appears to have been recently installed/renovated on the 6th Floor. Longer stays would merit a stay here in my view. The Club Floor I was on (27) had rooms that were just a little tired (carpeting) but everything was clean, modern and reasonably well equipped... although the pull-out desk was a bit cumbersome and old fashioned and there were insufficient plug locations (to place the kettle other than on the floor). Business Centre was very efficient and could do everything required... printing, scanning, distribution by email etc.... without a hitch. The pool area was a haven but note that there are no lockers in the changing rooms so take a pool bag to keep your belongings in.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!!”
Reviews.Author: trebor_skraps
Reviews.Content: We had a late check in but the staff was extremely helpful. they had a small tray of snacks sent to the room since we missed the dinner and only had airline food. the location was not far from the action of Roberts Quay and Clarke quay. we booked the trip with Expedia.com and received some very nice amenities such as free internet, free breakfast, free laundry (not dry cleaning) and no service charge for money exchanges and free access to the 29th floor lounge. the room was immaculate. my wife and i loved the view and the comfortable bed and pillows. i will certainly stay the the Grand Copthorne again when we make another trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Greybrow
Reviews.Content: This my first time in Singapore and I couldn't have asked for a better experience. Everyone at hotel worked hard to make my stay a pleasant one - from the lady on the front desk who offered me the choice of upgrading to the Executive Club package which both saved me money and made my stay all the more pleasant by being able to use the Executive club facilities at the top of the hotel. Breakfast there in the morning was an oasis of calm whilst free evening drinks and snacks was the perfect way to unwind at the end of a busy day. Singapore itself was wonderful and my stay at the Grand Copthorne only enhanced a great week there.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: maketrip7
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, well maintained, well mannered staff. Room size is good and if you get a river view room that is awesome. Bathroom and accessories supplied is good. Bed comfortable. Food quality is good. The only drawback I found was there is no ample seating arrangement in the lounge for people who want to wait for someone. There are just two small sofas on one side. Our tour operator just kept standing for an hour or so when we all gathered there and there was hardly any place for 20 people to sit even for few minutes while checking in the hotel was going on.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable, high quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crystal2161
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week and found it to be a reliable and high quality hotel. The first impression of my room was that it was bland and characterless, but I grew to like it after a few days. I especially liked the view over the river. The location of the hotel is very good as it sits right on this river and its in the centre of town. There are many interesting bars and restaurants within walking distance along the river bank. I thought the staff were friendly and helpful and I received a warm welcome when checking in. A highlight was the quality and range of food at breakfast - a great way to start the day. The gym and swimming pool were fine - as you would expect in a decent hotel. I used the business centre for team meetings and found the surroundings to be very pleasant and it was staffed by very helpful and courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, have been back twice”
Reviews.Author: SandyPants79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just lovely. The rooms and bathrooms are modern and have everything you could desire. Everything is clean and up to a great standard. The staff were friendly and helpful, and spoiled us both times we went there, once for our honeymoon and once for our 5th wedding anniversary. The restaurant food is top quality, I did feel the buffet lunch and dinner was a little overpriced this time around though. This hotel is walking distance to the "Great World" shopping centre which has shops, eateries, KFC, McDonalds etc. The other bonus is this hotel is right on the Singapore river so you can catch a water taxi all the way to Esplanade (Merlion Park), or get off at Robertson Quay or Boat/\Clark Quay where all the riverside restaurants, clubs, bars and night life happens "Washy washy" is across the road if you want to wash your clothes in a laundry rather than use the hotel's service. The pool area is awesome. The only negatives for this hotel in my opinion is that there is no MRT close by. And,somethings are quite expensive, we paid $9 for a filtered coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful riverside hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sygr89
Reviews.Content: I went to Singapore with my sister this summer for 3 weeks and stayed at the Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel the entire time (20 nights)! We used to live in Singapore so we went to visit friends and chose this hotel because of location and price. Having stayed in many hotels in Singapore i think this is a really beautiful hotel and one of the best I've stayed in so far. The location is great, even though the MRT station is a bit far (closest is clarke quay, about a 10 minute walk), but as taxis are cheap in Singapore most visitiors dont take the MRT a lot. And even if you do, the walk is along the beautiful river lined with cafees, bars and restaurants. Walking along the Singapore river from Marina Bay all the way up to Robertson Quay is the most amazing walk which anyone in Singapore should do at some point! The service at the hotel was great, everyone are super helpful and quick. The rooms are not huge (space is very expensive in Singapore, so rooms are usually not gigantic!), but it was big enough for the two of us and the furniture and bathroom were up to date (the soaps smell amazing!)! We were on the 16th floor and had a great view of the area and we could see the river all the way down to the CBD and the Marina Bay Sands. The outside dining area at the hotel is also beautiul, with gazebos and lights and theres a little specialty shop right across the river which sells all the essentials! There are restaurants along the river as well as all over Boat and Clarke Quay, which is just a quick walk away. Clarke Quay is also the main bar and club area in Singapore, so after a night out you can walk back and avoid the midnight taxi charges :) . I really recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to live close to where everything happens, but who don't want to live right in the middle of it. Amazing hotel, I will def. stay here again next time i visit!

Reviews.Title: “Very |Good”
Reviews.Author: airliftdreamer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short business trip and found it suitable for my purposes. Rooms are not large but comfortable with everything you would need for a short stay. Buffet breakfast had an excellent selection of cold and hot foods -well presented and stocked. Conference facilities are very good. Location is excellent right on Singapore river and easy stroll to a number of tourist facilities. Local area is very clean and safe. Half hour drive from Changi Airport - but then again most things in singapore are no more than 30 min away.

Reviews.Title: “Professionalism at its best”
Reviews.Author: Erin265
Reviews.Content: The staff must be commended for their politeness and professionalism. Any requests were always delivered promptly and with a smile. Their knowledge of the "hot spots" to visit were endless and they were more than happy to take the time in helping us. The room was very comfortable and clean with every amenity available and in working order. The location was sensational, just a 10 minute walk to the fabulous clarke quay, a short bus ride to the MRT station - a marvellous public transport system (Perth Transportation minister please go and visit), which lead us conveniently and quickly (5-10 mins) to Chinatown, Bugis Street, Sentosa monorail, Orchard Road, Indoor sports stadium (Go Diamonds!) etc etc. I can't praise the transport system in Singapore enough...Amazing. So the hotel is brilliantly situated. I can't fault the Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel and would highly recommend it to my friends and family. A big congratulations to you all and thank you for making our trip to Singapore a truly memorable one :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Sueda3116
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Copthorne for 4 nights. Huge bathrooms! Good view, good food, good service however the food and drinks were very expensive so make sure you include breakfast with your booking so fuel up for the day! Terrific location next to the river and great to sit outside early morning or as the sunsets and watch the people and the boats go by. The bumboats are frequent and you can also ask the concierge if you want one. A short walk to the hop on hop off bus and such a terrific deal - $33 each for 48 hours including bus, duck boat, and trip to Sentosa. Would definitely stay there again. The higher the room, the better the view.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: ConstantPlanner
Reviews.Content: I was not expecting much because of some of the reviews, but the three nights we spent turned out to be rather enjoyable despite the cons mentioned below. Pros - very comfy bed - good buffet breakfast - bus stop in front of the hotel - 5 min walk to the Great World City mall - 10/15 min walk to Robertson Quay and Clarke Quay respectively - shuttle service to Great World City, Orchard Road, Clarke Quay and Chinatown (starts at 9:55 AM). It originates from the hotel so seats were always available (at least while we were there). - great service - one example was the concierge agent - when I called to inquire about the shuttle schedule, the concierge guy asked if we wanted to make a reservation and even showed up later that afternoon to check if we were on board. We found out afterwards that reservations are not needed as the shuttle was on a first come, first served basis. Cons - one of the walls in the bathroom needed cleaning. There were a few "things" left behind by a previous guest which dried up on the wall. I tried to clean it up with alcohol but it was rather difficult to take out so I gave up. - the shower stall walls also needed scrubbing. You could see the mold and mildew even though the grout and tiles were dark. - the last shuttle from Orchard is at 8:30 PM so if you stay up late, you would need to take a taxi or the bus back to the hotel. - the nearest MRT, as mentioned by the others, is a 20 min walk away (Clarke Quay MRT station).

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: flowerbomb84
Reviews.Content: we stayed here before the orhard road hotel, this room was much nicer than the other, nice view , light room, comfy bed, walk in shower, would stay again,

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: guykb
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel - we got it as a mystery deal on wotif so it was very well priced and then we got an upgrade which made it even better. I think the rack rates are a bit inflated but if you can get it on a deal you could do much worse. The hotel is well placed a short stroll from Robertson Quay and many dining options. Not so handy to the MRT. There is a shuttle service mentioned but is is only every hour and sometimes not for 2 hours so probably better to jump in a cab if you want to go anywhere. The rooms are very well appointed and the facilities are excellent. We only spent one night here in transit but would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky Stay at Copthorne”
Reviews.Author: NavvyTravel
Reviews.Content: The Grand Copthorne came through after I suffered a severe sports ankle injury that left me immobile for several days. The club staff arranged for me to get breakfast in the room, ice on a recurring basis, and special care for transport to the airport. The club floor is nice, the breakfast is very competent with solid choices for full breakfast, and the evening social offers heavy appetizers that can fill you for dinner if desired. Very good and pleasant service. I am a stickler for details in a hotel and the Grand Copthorne met my expectations under difficult circumstances. I would recommend it without any hesitation. Club floor will enhance your visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: nzskater
Reviews.Content: In a great spot near the river, this hotel was a brief but great stay. Great food and service, and a decent room (though nothing special). Only stayed for one night so can't offer too much insight, but overall was happy and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: pawankes
Reviews.Content: OK is the word which can be best used for the hotel. Not any awesome factor nor any let down factor. Upsides :- Staff is friendly, very prompt, rooms are clean, quiet ambiance, amazingly located besides singapore river Downsides :- breakfast ( virtually nothing for veg indians), few elevators to cater a big property, expensive internet & call rates will come again if the breakfast is improved

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: christopherdb
Reviews.Content: We booked a club room which was one floor below the club lounge. That made it easy for us to go up one flight of stairs to enjoy the lounge and the great view. The food was great, the service was prompt and the staff were courteous. Our bed was comfortable and my wife was happy with the amount of pillows present. We were able to book a boat tour from the concierge which arrived fifteen minutes after we made the request. The hotel is very nice, the outside riverfront area was very pleasant, getting a taxi was easy.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Grand In Every Way!”
Reviews.Author: Bigbloke66
Reviews.Content: We had the most amazing four night stay last month at the Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel. We have stayed in quite a few five star hotels and, despite some negative reviews on Tripadvisor, this is most definately a five star hotel. In fact, we both agreed that overall it was the best hotel experience that we've ever had. When planning our trip we wanted to stay five star all the way but on a fairly tight budget. The Grand Copthorne was by far the most affordable of the hotels that we considered staying at. So affordable in fact we paid the extra to upgrade to an Executive Club room - probably the best decision that I made when planning our holiday. Upon arrival we were greeted at our taxi by Ian the Duty Manager, who personally escorted us up to the 29th floor Executive Club reception desk. Check in was swift and efficient then we were shown to our room, also on the 29th floor. The room was just terrific, having a recent upgrade but retaining lots of character and charm. The marble bathroom, with seperate shower and bath was sparkling. But the view over the Singapore River all the way to Marina Bay took our breath away. The room contained all the facilities you would expect of a five star hotel, the bathroom toiletries were lovely, the airconditioning was set just rght, and the TV had 20+ channels, both asian and english speaking cable channels. The king size bed was comfortable and the room was very quiet - we never heard another door slam or shower running in another room. Staying at the Executive Club was wonderful. The breakfasts in the club were ala carte with buffet cereals, breads, cheeses, fruits etc, but also had the choice to dine at Cafe Brio's which had an extensive & delicious array of eastern and western breakfast dishes. The Club had a daily afternoon tea consisting of sandwiches and rolls, cheeses, and other nibblies. But in the evening from 6pm - 8pm the canapes and cocktails were wonderful. We had the absolute best Singapore Slings each night, as well as ice cold beer and quality wines and spirits. And the canapes were plentiful & absolutely delicious. The service from all of the staff was wonderful, from a cheery "Hello Mr & Mrs ....." each time we got out of the lift on our floor, to efficient & friendly service in the Club, to the cleaners, and the doormen who always were on hand to open the taxi doors for us. The pool and jacuzzi were a good size, great temperature and had a convenient pool bar. We did not use the fitness room, but it was well equipped. The location of the hotel is sensational. Some reviewers have complained about the location but we loved it. The 15 minute stroll to Clarke Quay was a daily (sometimes twice daily) highlight for us. The hotel offers a complimentary shuttle service to get you to the major tourist locations, but we did not use it because taxis were always readily available and very inexpensive. Another highlight of the location was the Great World Shopping Centre, just a block or two away. It was terrific to shop with the locals, rather than the glitzy malls in the tourist strip, and the food court there was a treat. We are already planning (dreaming of ) our next trip to this wonderful city, and we would not stay anywhere else but the Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but tired hotel with poor service”
Reviews.Author: expat_sealover
Reviews.Content: Reasonable room, but poor service. We booked a Deluxe room, but were given a superior room (still charged for a deluxe room). After some discussion we were given a decent Deluxe room which looked good. However, the hotel is quite tired and lots of things were broken, half broken or malfunctioning. The AC changed the room in a fridge and could not be adjusted - switching it off was apparently not appreciated by the staff as they kept on switching it back on and putting it at 10 degr. Overall the service of the frontdesk was poor, as was the service at the restaurant. No friendliness and a long time before somebody acted on requests. Breakfast was ok, but nothing special. The little convenience shop was still closed at 4 pm for lunch. Overall a decent but tired hotel with poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Worth visit a 3rd time”
Reviews.Author: munna50099
Reviews.Content: I am rarely impressed. But Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel has stood up to its reputation. I visited this hotel one and half years ago, wrote a review which stated it was a good hotel. Now on my second visit, let me stand up and say, its an excellent hotel. The price, the location, the service, the food, the stay quality, all are above high standards. I commend the staff and the management for keeping this property a place every family should make a home during stays in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, easy access hotel on the river.”
Reviews.Author: LeitaLuetta
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel is located on the Singapore River. The breakfast has a very nice variety of Western and Eastern foods -- don't overlook the cinnamon rolls with the abundance of cinnamon. Easy access to the hop-on/hop-off bus for city tour. Clean, fresh hotel with accommodating staff. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: gomcoite2
Reviews.Content: A great trip with wonderful service across all departments. I must say, a perfect business outing at the place with very nice cooperation across for whatever business needs we had. Food was great but Indian vegetarians have limited choice there, so that is one area where they might look to improve.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Tbear378
Reviews.Content: The Grand Copthorne is a wonderful hotel to stay. I stayed for nine nights! I had read about the reviews on this site before hand and had prepped my expectations for an average hotel. But, to my surprise, I had one of the beautifully renovated rooms overlooking the Singapore river. The furnishings are contemporary modern. The bed was ohhh... so.. comfortable! And, the bath (actually shower) was nicely done. The best part of the Copthorne is that the temperature setting in the room is just right - not too cold and not too warm. Many hotels that i walk into have the setting too cold for myself; but, at the Copthorne the temperature is perfect I did not have to adjust a thing. The gym in the hotel is excellent too. They had various exercise equipment to get a good workout, and everything is in working order. The swimming pool is right next door, and so once done with the gym, one could hop on into the pool to relax. I think one of the nicest features of the hotel is that it is on the Singapore River, and to walk along the path up to Clark Quay is so beautiful and romantic. My only gripe about the hotel is that the free shuttle service provided operates once every hour and that the stopping points are limited to a few locations. In the morning, if the shuttle is too packed with passengers from its previous pickup point, one may find himself stranded waiting for the next shuttle bus that arrives an hour later or availing himself to a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Best bed in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: camak
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night during our stop over back home. We got a cheap deal through a last minute booking. The room was large with a huge shower. The decor was a little tired, but you can vision in its hey day it would have been grand. I believe majority of the rooms have been refreshed since (maybe we were put in a non refreshed room because we scored a very cheap rate) The bed was super comfortable! I've stayed in many hotels in Singapore and this is for sure the most comfortable bed I have slept in! The hotel is right on the riverfront of Roberston Quay so you can easily walk along the river and find a good place to eat - you can even stay in, the hotel has 3 or 4 restaurants along. We wanted to hop on the free shuttle bus to Chinatown the next morning, however we waited a while for our bags to be collected and stored during check out and as a result we missed the shuttle. It was slightly annoying at the time but these things happen on occasion and it does not bring any negative affect to our time here - we were being lazy! We really enjoyed our stay here and will be back again when in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarloRago
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from April 10-13 as we attended a workshop sponsored by the company. My room was large enough; the king size bed was very comfortable and I slept very well. The bathroom may need some renovation but remained clean. The hotel is not along the shopping district so I don't recommend it to tourists. You will have to walk around 20 minutes to get to the nearest subway station but there are bus stops less than five minutes away. There is also a mall (5-10 minute walk) catering to the residential community nearby which has a supermarket, several fastfood outlets, and a number of outlet stores. The best thing I can say about the hotel is the service as they accomodated my request several times. Of course, it helps that a number of the service people were my countrymen.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD STAY”
Reviews.Author: DavideBali
Reviews.Content: Very good 5 stars hotel, special if you stay in the Club room at highest floors. Great breakfast and service, very good business centre. For people travelling for business and leisure, not so far from Orchard Road, around 10 minutes by taxi. For this price is difficult to find better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay - picked hotel for the location”
Reviews.Author: JanieT
Reviews.Content: My partner and I regularly visit Singapore for a few days whilst traveling around Asia. I picked this hotel due to its location (we tend to stay in a hotel nearby). After reading some of the comments on here I was a bit apprehensive. However except for a few hiccups with the access cards to my partners daughters room and the undercooked eggs at breakfast everything was OK. Taxis as always were plentiful and cheap. Bar service was excellent and the chambermaids did a really good job. Polite and efficient check-in (we got into our room at 10.00am which was great). Great World City is a 5 minuet walk away and has a supermarket and cheap dining options if you do not breakfast at the hotel. I would give the Boomerang Bar/Cafe a miss for breakfast (across the other side of the river) - very expensive for poor quality service and food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: dacaty
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel, with nice buffet breakfast (only had first morning due to early arriving flight). Although were unable to get into our rooms earlier, they provided us with 2 rooms to freshen up in whilst they waited to hear from another visitor if staying longer or not, so we could get the interconnecting rooms. Unfortunately the vistors stayed longer so staff managed to get 2 rooms closer together. Our sons room had plumbing problem one morning, which maintenance came and sorted within half hour. Reception staff were great, with exception one staffer with limited English. Assistant consierge Kumar was brilliant - he had a happy disposition all the time, and was very helpful organising our Kranji outing, as well as searching for an elusive item I was chasing, unfortunately with little sucess. The doormen were also friendly. Lack of easy access to MRT was a disappointment, but taxis were plentyful and staff knowledge of bus routes good. Only down point was from other visitors who were pushy, pushing in front of airline staff trying to book out, but you can get that anywhere. Had great views of river and Singapore Flyer area.

Reviews.Title: “Used my bank card without my knowledge - do not touch this hotel”
Reviews.Author: FleecedinSingapore
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in January - they asked for details of a bank card on arrival to cover an unpaid expenses following after my stay, and I gave my debit card. After returning home I found 200 Singapore dollars had been withdrawn from my bank account by the hotel a few minutes after my checking in, without my knowledge. I was told nothing on checking out when settling my bill in full (unaware that 3 times as much as I owed had already been withdrawn from my account by the hotel) and found this out only from my bank statement later. After 2 months of having many emails and phone calls responded to with 'I'm sure we cancelled it' - motivated either by an astonishing ignorance by a hotel as to what debit cards do, or an intention to keep the money - I am looking at having to try to lodge a complaint with police over in Singapore in a final attempt to get my money back. At one point over the phone I was asked again to disclose all of my security details for the card, on the apparent grounds that the hotel would need these to contact my bank. I would not wish my experience on anyone, and I would certainly not touch this hotel with the longest bargepole in the world. I have given it 1 star only because it does not seem to be possible to award it none.

Reviews.Title: “Fun stay at grand copthorn”
Reviews.Author: sumitsurius
Reviews.Content: a beautiful client friendly hotel with all aminities including gym and open air swimming pool with jakoozi at 5th floor. Friendly and smart staff always available at everywhere you need without feeling any disturbance in your privecy.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: travelady042
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our 6 night stay at this hotel for a trip that was a mix of business and leisure. I was a bit wary after reading other reviews about the hotel on Trip Advisor, but was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. The staff were friendly. The hotel was well decorated. There is a large lobby with check in and concierge, but there are no seats in the lobby. The room was very clean, comfortable and stylish. The only downside was that it was compact. The bathroom looked as if it had been newly remodeled. It had a shower but no tub, which I don't consider a problem. Our room did not include the buffet breakfast, so on that I cannot comment. However, we had two excellent meals at "Portini", the hotel's Italian restaurant, which is a beautiful space. In regard to one review about the room service tray not being collected, I had no problem. The hotel requests that you dial the "one touch" button on the phone to request tray pick up, and then it is promptly collected. The fitness center is small with two treadmills and other machines, but it has large windows overlooking the pool and condos next door, which provided a pleasant view. The hotel is not in the downtown business district, unlike many other hotels in Singapore. It is in a neighborhood with modern condos on one side of the street and HDB flats across the streets. I liked the fact that when I went out, I saw local residents out and about, waiting for the bus, etc. Also, it was a nice area in which to run. One shopping mall, "Great World City" was a 5 minute walk down the road. There is a famous nightclub, Zouk, next to the hotel. We had to walk about 15 minutes to get to a subway stop or Chinatown and 20 minutes through a nice residential neighborhood to get to Orchard Road shops. Cabs were readily available, except once when we needed one early Sunday morning. This is not a luxurious hotel like a Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons, but it also is priced much better than luxury hotels in Singapore. I gave it 5 stars because of all that it offers for the price. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel with dubious cleanliness standard”
Reviews.Author: ZLJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for two nights. Found the room and bathroom to be unusually small for a twin-sharinrg room. The furnishing is pretty dated and there was a constant faint pungent small coming out from the bathroom. We had to ensure that the cover of the toilet bowl was constantly closed to reduce the foul small. It seems that the chamber maid does not bother washing the toilet bowl as long as it "looks clean". Very bad cleanliness standard for a supposed 5-star hotel. Housekeeping standard is also not quite up to mark in comparison to the other 5 star hotels that I have stayed in. Place somehow does not look very tidied even after the house-keeping. The pool and jacuzzi were very small considering that there are so many many guest rooms in this hotel. Buffet breakfast was also average. The hotel is situated at River Valley with no easy access to any MRT stations. Only buses and taxis. I will not advise tourists who are not familiar with Singapore to stay here. There are definitely better hotels in town with similar pricing. Furthermore, the service is also slow. Took them almost 20 mins to just get me two complimentary bottles of mineral water. Have a feeling that the Hotel is understaffed. But the bed is nice and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: BLA07
Reviews.Content: For a hotel with "Grand" in it's name, one would expect a bit more. The hotel itself is lovely and modern (much like Singapore) but with underlying secrets (again, like Singapore). I was impressed by the number of front desk staff but less so when they started to check me in. There is an awful lot of running hither and yon. The deluxe rooms have internet access but by cable, not wireless -- so if you're a Mac user, take note. These rooms are quite spacious and from what colleagues tell me, worth the extra S$30 per night. Breakfast, while included in the price of the room, is awful. Never in my life have I had worse scrambled eggs and the poor young woman cooking omelets just can't get them cooked all the way through. One pet peeve: when I leave my room service tray in my room, I expect it to be removed by the cleaning staff. I ended up putting it in the hall and there it sat the entire rest of the day and all night. Let's see it's still there when I go back to my room.

Reviews.Title: “Really not too bad as a city centre hotel...not perfect, but fine”
Reviews.Author: SeresM
Reviews.Content: I spent a few days there this month teaching. Check-in good. I was surprised by the genuinely Waterfront location, which is not too busy, unlike nearby Clarke Quay. The service at the bar is attentive and the food reasonable (though I have had much better satay at Downtown East in the old days....). The TV in the room malfunctioned and it did seem difficult to get it right, and my room did not have a bath (some do) but this is only a four star hotel (I assume) so that's reasonable. Travel to the city centre is a bit fraught unless you take a taxi, because walking, though not far, would be an unenviable proposition in the sultry heat if you had a meeting at the other end. Gym has two running machines, both worked. Shower there too. And they gave me free internet as all respectable hotels should. Really acceptable for a city centre location though.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average - better 5 stars in Singers”
Reviews.Author: ferrisgirl
Reviews.Content: WE arrived late at night after a flight from Melbourne and were consistently pushed in front of at check in by business men. I requested a late check out which I was happy to pay for but the recptionist took half an hour to understand me. Rooms were small but comfortable. Pool ordinary and general service left a lot to be desired. Oh - not to mention the construction noise all round the building. And it's not a great location - riught on the river but not near much else. I'd give it a miss next time

Reviews.Title: “Arrived late at night very tired.”
Reviews.Author: TnTOz
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly and upgraded us from a room to a suite on arrival. This meant our teenage son could sleep on a bed in the lounge area which was separate. The suite was spacious the bedroom was large with great views across the city. The hotel was right on the river bank so we could catch a boat up and down the river to explore the city. I would really recommend this mode of travel rather than taxis because of the congestion. There is a pretty cheesy comentary that plays on the boat but if you can tolerate the cringe it does give some interesting information and history. Travelling on the boats was relatively cheap and they work a bit like a bus system with boats running up and down the river night and day. The breakfast menu was extensive and you could choose from the buffet or have an omlete cooked to your liking. The staff were very happy to store our luggage until we flew out later that night. They also offered us shower facilities to use after we checked out before we went to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Better options in Singapore for better prices”
Reviews.Author: freobhoy
Reviews.Content: I visit Singapore every month, so have stayed in many of the 4/5 stars, booked through corporate travel dept. This hotel is ok, rooms are small to average, service was ok, location is ok. Felt that it was over priced, but hotel costs in Singapore seem to vary so much with demand / events / season it is hard to directly compare. Would have other choices before recommending to a friend, but would have no concerns if the travel dept booked me back.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: farrowp
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel to which I had pre booked a week in advance to find there was no room ready I was sent to the bar with a voucher for a free drink, on arrival at the bar I was told that this was only for a soft drink if I wanted anyhting else I would need to pay for it, I was left there for over an hour. when I finally did get told my room was ready a receptionist gave me a key and did not even direct me to the lifts. I was mildly annoyed. On arrival at my room I found it was a smoking room even though I asked for non smoking. Also really bad was that when I went to the bathroom I found the toilet seat was not connected to the bowl. I called the duty manager to ask to be moved after a long conversation I was told that another room would be made ready. after almost 3 hours of arriving at the hotel I got a room which stank of smoking against my wishes. I so annoyed I asked to be changed again but was told no more rooms were available. I had 6 nights of bad sleep due to the smell. To add insult to injury on check out I spotted a telephone call on my bill. I challanged this and they had attempted to charge me for the compliant call to the duty manager of the hotel . dont bother there are some great alternatives in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Stay it's nice but when things go wrong they go wrong”
Reviews.Author: charlesmoore686
Reviews.Content: I arrived from a 12 hour flight from the UK, so I was very tired. I asked for a no smoking room and was given a smoking room. The room was changed and when eventually wanted to get into bed I pulled the covers back and the sheets were stained. I was then moved again to another room. I went to sit down on the chair a nearly pulled piece from the chair. I informed the Manager I asked her to replace the chair in the morning. I then came back from a meeting the following day, to find 2 men in my room to inform me I had to move again because a pipe was leaking. I was given an up grade to a really nice room. I then needed to stay at the hotel for a further 2 days and the option to extend my stay. I thought the might give me the 2 nights for free because of the room change but they charged $235 for one night. They give me free internet which I thought was free any how and breakfast. ( which I don't really much care for ). The hotel is a nice hotel and in good location the staff are very helpful. But it might be just a case of everything went wrong for me that evening.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,Good quality”
Reviews.Author: markrosh
Reviews.Content: During my last visit to Singapore,I had stayed in Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel. It is well located in the center of the town ,close to many nightlife sites (Clarque & BoutQue). But is far from other tourist's attractions like Bugis,Raffels,Suntec,Marina square. The room is not big,but a convenient one. Breakfast is quite good . Internet in room is for free,but use computer in the business center is for charge. Service in hotel is like in all high standart hotels in singapore. You will get what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and comfortable surrounds”
Reviews.Author: Beachsiders_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nicely appointed and comfortable. The hotel is located within short 5-10 min taxi rides (between $5 - 8 SD) to the cbd, chinatown, orchard rd, Raffles etc. Don't worry about eating at the hotel, there is a lot on offer within easy walking distance. We really enjoyed walking along the peaceful riverside walkways which are dotted with a lively cafe & winebar scene. Roberstons Quay was a 10 min walk along the river. The Great World shopping plaza is a 5 min walk away and don't miss out on the delicious food at the Riverside Hawker stalls (opposite the plaza). Depending on the time of day, the taxi to airport costs was about $23SD

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable good quite location”
Reviews.Author: Keosn
Reviews.Content: Whilst this hotel is not close to the MRT (Mass rapid transport- train) , taxis are cheap to get you close to the city or a MRT station. Location on the river is good, easy 15 - 20 min walk to Clarke Quay and plenty of restaurants on theleft hadn side of the river as you walk towards Clarke Quay. Hotel can arrange a ferry (upmarket bumboat) which will cost $12 per person one way to Marina Bay, return trip will cost $20 PP. Yes a bit expensive when compared to taxi's and buses but something a bit different and you see plenty of the original buildings built by the British when they dominated trading here. Singaporean people are very helpfull, and will be happy to give you directions.After going out late one night we put on our "do not disturb" light on to get a sleep in. The next morning we went out and left it on, when we returned we turned it off and within 30 mins we received a call asking us if we needed our room serviced, how good is that! Hotel staff here were friendly and very helpful.Room cleanliness and daily serviing was excellent. We did hear a bit of noise through the walls, but I have stayed in many 4 star hotels and have experienced the same thing, so nothing major here. Beware the following when staying in singapore, and please take this seriously, DO NOT SHOP AT SIM LIM SQUARE at BUGIS FOR CAMERAS, LENSES OR COMPUTERS!!!! THIS PLACE IS FULL OF THE MOST UNSCRUPULOUS LYING DECEIVING BUSINESS'S IN ALL OF ASIA! I WAS RIPPED OFF TO THE TUNE OF $1,600 WHEN I BOUGHT A CAMERA LENSE. WHEN I LOOKED CLOSER AT THE SPECS AFTER PURCHASING I FOUND THE SALES PERSON HAD LIED AND SUBSTITUTED AN INFERIOR SPEC LENSE WORTH AT THE MOST $420. My research on the Internet since my return to Australia has uncovered multiple similiar ripoffs from this shopping complex and one business in particular, who has a slick salesman called Eric. What shame Eric and these people bring on Singapore. The business in question will not return calls and when you ask for the sales person by name they say they don't work there or are not there. The only option is to go to the Singapore Tourism Board, the Police and the small claims court- more pain after being ripped off. The best advice, DON'T BUY EXPENSIVE ELECTRONIC EQUIPMENT IN Simlin Square,stick with the big name stores.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Value and poor standards”
Reviews.Author: Jzin2010
Reviews.Content: I have stayed a few hotels so I could compare my past experiences with the experience i had with Grand Copthorne. Firstly the name "Grand" is a misnomer. Compared to MANY other hotels equal or cheaper, for $$ paid, there's DEFINITELY NOTHING grand abt this hotel. The decor is old and messy. There was a very noisy stage setup (for celebrations) near the RECEPTION??? the counter staff could not hear me and neither could i hear them. They made us wait for ONE HOUR for our rooms to be ready. The room was not clean (it had a dried fruit on the carpet?!) there was no pens despite having feedback forms and notepads ard. I have to pay for internet...erm, there are many much nicer hotels better value and yet provide FREE wi-fi I am too exasperated that I am loss for words. 'nuff said!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Singapore, which are strangley enough not always easy to find...”
Reviews.Author: Roeljong
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one week with my wife for a quiet 7 days off and have absolutely no serious negative remarks about this hotel. In the past, we have beeing staying in similar priced hotels in S'pore, but would not come back to those. Location is good, lots of dining-out facilities at walking distance. Nice pool, good fitness centre, efficient service with a smile, clean rooms and compared to many other hotels in Singapore, the price/value is well in balance.We did not have breakfast and diner in the hotel but ordered a couple of times at the poolside bar and without complaints. All worked smoothly. If I have to mention something it would be that these days internet access should be given free, but then, nobody is doing that in S'pore so why should they? That is something for the government to solve..:) Negative remarks from other comments about this hotel is that it is difficult to get taxi's at certain times. That is true, but is that situation in the whole of Singapore. At times there aren't simply enough of them. I would definitely come back to this hotel and can recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “A true oasis in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: regulartraveller67
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights in this Hotel and it was a delightful experience. Our initial intention was to be nearer Orchard Road and the shops. However this Hotel provides a shuttle bus, but we never used it as the Taxis are cheap and plentiful in Singapore, only S$5 or UK£2.50 to Orchard Road in airconditioned comfort. We arrrived early evening from Melbourne and there was no queuing or waiting at Reception. The staff were very courteous and helpful especially the Concierge Team. We had an Executive Room with a River view on the 26th Floor. The Restaurants (3) includes one outside by the river, plus a fixed price Buffet and were all first class, as was the Bar and pianist.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: martin g
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 night prior to Joining a Princess Cruise of South East Asia in November. The hotel is very modern however retains and old charm. 5 minute walf to shopping centre with a variety of restaraunts and shopping, plus free wifi in Starbucks.15 minutes to the metro system which was clean, fast efficient and allowed us to explore both Singapore and Sentosa Island. Orchard Road and little India good for shopping. Hotel very clean and good value for money. Did not eat in hotel so cannot comment, howver as I said above a lot of restaraunts locally for food and drink. Martin G

Reviews.Title: “Good Location. Close to City Centre”
Reviews.Author: Milanbhise
Reviews.Content: Its Good hotel. Good value for money. Stay was comfortable. Good location near Clerk Quay. City centre is only 5 minutes away by taxi. Hotel offer discount on broadband service but speak to them at the time of check in. Location is on the bank of the river and peaceful. Breakfast spread offers wide choice. Indian food also offered in breakfast but may be because several Indian families were staying at the time. Staff is very friendly and make you feel comfortable. There are several good restaurants and pubs nearby. Must visit Cheeky Monkey pub which is 2 minutes away by taxi. Nana Thai Disco is close by if you are interested. MRT station Atrium is not close, taxi is only convenient option. Opp to this Hotel is Holiday Inn Atrium which offers free shuttle to Orchard Road after every 45 minutes. Have great time

Reviews.Title: “Stay only at the renovated rooms.”
Reviews.Author: suitejoe
Reviews.Content: We had 4 rooms, 3 on 13th floor and 1 on 19th floor. 13th floor rooms are renovated and its very nice. Sleek design and comfortable beds. But Small in size. Even the bathroom is small. But the room on 19th floor is horrible! Very dated and old and tired looking. Worst thing is that it also stinks! Bear in mind it's anon smoking room but it smells like foods gone bad! OMG! Pool is small and even the suite on 24th Floor is old and tired. Had stayed in the opposite Copthorne King Suite and its 10times better. Walking distance to Great World Shopping Centre and next to ZOUK.

Reviews.Title: “decent normal hotel”
Reviews.Author: PopeyeCalifornia
Reviews.Content: there is nothing strange nor not strange about this hotel. it is just fine with no spectacular ups or downs. having said that, the breakfast is very good (although not exceptional) and the rooms are slightly basic. the bathroom is slightly small and the shower did not really give hot water for the duration of my stay, although it was not really disturbing (i.e., the water is just warm not hot--I suspect the warm water capacity of the hotel-boiler is just too small when the hotel is running full capacity). all in all the hotel is just fine no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Gannon072
Reviews.Content: Staff at hotel very polite, friendly and helpful starting with us being greeted at the door and assistance with our luggage - very welcome after extremely long flights and receptionists very accommodating in our requests. We had no trouble travelling around Singapore and finding out where the tourist spots and the best places to go to as the Hotel staff were only too willing to help, espectially Ian Soh, the Duty Manager. Downside to this hotel was the drinks prices were expensive so we didn't stay long in the evening. Lovely location by the river and taxis were always on hand to take us where we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, bad service”
Reviews.Author: PandaTravels84
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 days in Singapore and in effort to keep costs low (it's Singapore after all!) we chose this hotel. We're still happy about the price...but that's about it. Pro's: slept like a baby as the room had great A/C, the view from the room was lovely and the pool was nice. Con's: truly awful service... overcrowded restaurant, they didn't clean our room the first day we had to call them, expensive internet, location is out of the way - taxi's are required. Is it too much to ask to hire people who are customer service oriented in the hotel industry?! Spend a little extra and stay close to the downtown area (perhaps the Swisshotel).

Reviews.Title: “Bland Copthorne”
Reviews.Author: mondrian
Reviews.Content: There is nothing wrong with this hotel -- service at the desk was professional, rooms are adequately furbished, and there are "the usual business hotel amenities" -- e.g. there is a business center that is free for guest use in addition to (costly) wifi in the rooms. On the other hand, it is really a paint-by-numbers place. My room had no problems, but had no touches that distinguish it from any other hotel, including ones that are more downmarket. The "waterfront" refers to a thin strip of canal that is accessible from the back of the hotel, but not so noticeable from within. Although you could certainly walk to sights in the city, it isn't pleasant to do so since you're confronted with a busy motorway right outside the hotel entrance. The hotel is not easy walking distance to the metro, and (at least when I was there) they have no shuttle to/from the airport. The main things that you can get to easily from the hotel are other huge hotels and a large mall. A few of the facilities were too small for a hotel of this size: I'm thinking particularly of the breakfast area, where there were often lines waiting to be seated. Much of the hotel was over-air conditioned (you could see people wearing coats and jumpers when it was 90 degrees and humid outside). But I have no serious complaints about the hotel's amenities; It's just that for the high price I would have hoped for something better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: soccer_football
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to Singapore on a holiday to get away from home for a while. This hotel was definitely one of the best places I have ever stayed in. The rooms were big and beds comfortable. The resort had excellent room service, they were there in about 20 minutes of ordering. The breakfast was the best buffet we have experienced in a hotel. Staff were great and go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. We even had one of the friendly staff showing us pictures of his family. We did not go out of the hotel to much as it was more of a relaxing holiday but we did go to Sentosa Island. This day was very special. We went to see the fountain show which was amazing. When you go see these shows you feel the culture of Asia as there were so many people of different religions going to watch. Taxis were very affordable and most of the drivers were friendly. Go to the markets, you will get good discounts on goods and souvenirs. However watch out for thieves. We got a camera taken stolen in China Town. We will be going back to Singapore in December for our stopover to London

Reviews.Title: “Check your room 1st”
Reviews.Author: anne.toddlambie
Reviews.Content: the shape of the Hotel means although the fittings are the same the configurations and how much is in each room is quite different Some rooms have AMAZING views towards the Marina-so ask for a room around the 15th floor and check it has the view (and configuration you would like) Great Buffets , Singapore Slings and Conference food;good pleasant service It isn't central

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ruchita_g
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent. 10 mins walk from clarke quay. Cafe Brio's by the river side is excellent and the view is amazing. swimming pool and fitness center at the 6th floor is good. Rooms are good though I thought bathroom could have been bit spacious. Since we had son of 4 yrs, it was sweet of them to provide an extra cot. There was no wifi but there was internet connection which was chargeable. Reception and especially the travel desk were very helpful. We had a great time here.

Reviews.Title: “Considerate and warm friendly service”
Reviews.Author: MtGambierSA
Reviews.Content: A three night stay and our first experience of Singapore was made especially enjoyable with the very warm and sincere friendly service provided by all staff at Grand Copthorne Waterfront. A delightful location alongside the Singapore river with an easy walk to restaurants and shopping at Clarke Quay. A water taxi journey back along the river to the hotel was great when our legs were feeling weary after a day in the city. A free courtesy coach was appreciated to access several stops including Orchard Road. Avoid Friday evening as the traffic density leads to long delays. We really appreciated the invitation to return to the hotel late on our day of checking out to enjoy a refreshing shower and relax in the lounge ahead of a midnight flight to Australia. We are happy to recommend the Grand Copthorne Waterfront for couples seeking a comfortable, relaxing and friendly stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: DebuDeb
Reviews.Content: Grand Copthorne Waterfront at Singapore is a great hotel on the Havelock Road. Though the tariff is a bit steep the service levels are preeti good. I had a pretty good experience at the hotel excpet for a bad experience at the coffee shop (Cafe Brio) during the breakfast on Set 27th wherein the Captain was a bit rud..However, when I complained through a mail later I could see detailed action plan to avert such issues in future. I think this hotel is serious about "service" and solving "customer problems" Debashis Sarkar..

Reviews.Title: “Extrememly helpful staff, good location - you'll need to use taxis”
Reviews.Author: Kowhaikiwi
Reviews.Content: Staff couldn't have been more helpful when we arrived at 8am after a 12 hour flight and gave us an early check in and late check out! Nice rooms , some interconnecting, and a small but lovely pool area. Didn't eat there but meals looked nice. Great european-style shopping centre a few minutes walk away. I would definately stay there with the family again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: DeborahMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in a Club Floor room. We were very impressed with the staff who could not do enough to help. The service at the Club Lounge was very good and we especially enjoyed the evening cocktails. We will stay here on our next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, excellent hotel, made our stay in Singapore Perfect”
Reviews.Author: LockFamily308
Reviews.Content: I cannot express how happy we were to be staying at the Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel. From the moment we arrived we had exceptional service. My husband & I were travelling with our 1 year old daughter and the staff at the Grand made our stay so much easier. They were stop to talk and play with her, communicating with her and making the trip enjoyable for her. They learnt her name on the first day, and every day would look out for her and call out to her and have a little play. We even had staff at the Brio's restaurant help feed her whilst we tried to enjoy some of our own breakfast (Which is sometimes a hard thing to do with a 1 year old) A staff member "Ann" gave us fantastic service, and made us smile every day. She always made a special effort to say hello. We felt welcomed the whole time! Like we were staying with family!! I felt very special as well, car doors opened for us, luggage taken away and delivered to our room, we were treated like royalty! When we arrived to our room, I noticed they hadn't delivered the cot, I made a phone call to the lobby and within 10 minutes they had brought they cot up all ready and made up. Every day there was always cleaning staff around, so even if you didn't leave the room until 11am, when we came back by 2/3pm the room was always made up. Housekeeping made a special effort to make up the cot and tuck my daughters teddy bear in, my daughter thought it was excellent, she would always run up to the cot to see how they had put her teddy for the day. We stay for 5 nights at the Grand Copthorne & then we transferred to another hotel but on Sentosa for 2 nights.... and let me tell you... Grand Copthorne was SUPER FANTASTIC compared to this other 5 star Spa and resort.... we wished we had not moved hotels. The hotel was super quiet, we had perfect nights sleep, and a fantastic holiday. We would definitely recommend it to anyone!! And it is only a 5 minute walk to a large shopping centre (including a supermarket- "Cold Storage") Which made it so easy with children, because we could buy fruit and milk etc If only our 5 star Australian hotels could take some training from Grand Copthorne!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Fine - decent room and fair value”
Reviews.Author: mlohara
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights in September 2010. I was apparently upgraded rooms but didnt notice anything special about the new room except it was on a higher floor with great views over Singapore (though floor to ceilling glass is not ideal for anyone with vertigo!). Staff friendly, pool good, location good, room service good and tasty (esp asian choices) Good business/ large chain-hotel but nothing particulary charming or individual about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: JYAustralia
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful. Early check in, free room upgrade.. Buffet Breakfast can be improved but for S$20... very reasonable....love walking along the river front... bars & restaurants...

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing, stay elsewhere. Definitely not business ready.”
Reviews.Author: travellingdudes
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in September and booked the expensive "club" rooms at a premium in the hope to get better service and access to the "executive club lounge on the 29th floor". What a joke. The service was abysmal. The executive club lounge is reminding of a motel 6 breakfast bar and does not compare even remotely with the basic business lounges any of the other similarly priced hotels in Singapore. It was supposed to be closed at 10pm, yet at 8:30pm they were vacuum cleaning and spraying soap on our feet during a business meeting in the lounge !!! Needless to say we had to leave and it was an extremely embarrassing moment especially for our visitors. The rooms are extremely small, fixtures are broken (e.g., two of our lamps' covers were broken), the hotel lobby has absolutely no couches or places to sit on. etc etc. Food in the morning was mediocre, especially when comparing with similarly priced hotels in Singapore. Overall, below mediocre. Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: evan290901
Reviews.Content: There were 5 family members travelling together. We booked and paid for our trip/rooms in full, 3 months prior to us arriving. We were supposed to have two rooms booked (one family and one double). When we we arrived at this hotel (late at night) there were no rooms allocated for either party and they weren't even sure if they had a room! It took us over an hour to even check in. The two rooms that we were given were not even on the same floor-after requesting ajoining. Our room (family) had two single beds and no bed for my eight year old son. At about 9pm at night they were bringing in a mattress and making up the bed. We got the distinct impression that unless you looked like you had money, they were not interested. I would not recommend this to any travellers to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “room didnt meet my expectation”
Reviews.Author: lcutajar
