Reviews.Content: Upon arrival desk staff were unfriendly and very business like, no offer to take luggage to rooms, room was quiet squashed too many chairs (2 big old cane chairs, chipped paint and one large business desk chair) very old TV and movies were $18.dollars extra, dont know if this was per night. Concierge was the best ever nothing was too much trouble, pity the front desk staff were so glum, need to learn how to smile and be nice. Swimming pool was wonderful, gym great, food was very expensive in hotel but excellent once outside. The location was excellent and the hourly shuttle into Orchard Rd was always on time, one of the drivers goes too fast then slams his brakes on. Overall this is not what we call a 5 star, bathroom nice but room/TV small and not 5 star, people need to request a better TV if you want to stay here. It cost me $10. to use the internet for 15 min???? very bad After the first night we had to request better pillows, bed was very hard.

Reviews.Title: “OK Lah”
Reviews.Author: ice46200
Reviews.Content: I would say 4-star rating is quite reasonable for this hotel. Was travelling alone but for some reason they gave me a twin-bed room which was extra spacy and quiet. The beds are quite confortable. The hotel is located right at the river (not so clean) but hey if you are a tourist here, where got time for the river lah. Singapore is a shopping city lah. You are here to shop lah! Opps.. the hotel is not really in a walking distance to the city center but luckily taxi is cheap enough in Singapore. Also quite close to a small shopping mall called "Great World City" and you can do your grocery there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Pool is a bit small. Gym...”
Reviews.Author: NicandRach
Reviews.Content: Great location. Pool is a bit small. Gym is a good size with good facilities but wouldn't want it to be busy. We stayed here on a Tuesday night for only the one night. Enjoyed a meal at clary quay (chilli crab of course) and the staff at the waterfront are excellent. The breakfast is great and what u would expect from hotel of this size and rating. We did not arrange breakfast before and it is usually $30 Singapore dollars but they discounted to $20 upon check in. I would say it is worth getting the breakfast included for the right price if you can. we paid $225 AUS off the net for our hotel room. My only con around the hotel is there is no free Internet or WIFI. There is a business centre located on level 3 but they charge like a wounded bull (expensive). There are a number of free wifi joints around like coffee shops (star bucks etc) just ask the friendly hotel staff and they will point you in the right direction.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: okeila
Reviews.Content: very nice 5star hotel nothing to complain but price view was very nice too i can recommend this hotel to others

Reviews.Title: “good stay at the Copthorne”
Reviews.Author: jakartanna
Reviews.Content: I went with my 2 nieces to singapore, for them first time, so i wanted to create a good impression for them (i love singapore). I booked the Grand Copthorne, but I 've never stayed at that hotel..for me as well first time. Staff at the reception very nice, we even got an upgrade. But when we entered the room, it appeared in renovation....no way we could stay there. So my nieces were really disappointed, and after phoning the reception they quickley came back and offered us a really nice room and sitting room on the highest floor. Gave us a lot more space and the girls loved it. They even offered my niece a birthday cake! Which was cool. However the last day we wanted to have a swim, and the pool was closed. It is in renovation......big disappointment with the ladies. The way the staff reacted however was really nice and full of attention. So in the end me and my 2 nieces were really glad we stayed at the Copthorne. Beware of the swimming pool though: check if the renovation has been finished!

Reviews.Title: “great place for business travel”
Reviews.Author: Angel84India
Reviews.Content: rooms are nice, clean and spacious. they have a great spread for breakfast. as a vegetarian, i had a sufficient variety of dishes to sample. they provide Wi-Fi connectivity in the rooms which is great for business travel. it is right next to the famous night club Zouk. the hotel is at an ideal location for travel around Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet but a bit off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: frithnow
Reviews.Content: We scored an executive room (come this way sir, you'll be checking in on the 29th floor) on Expedia as a last minute deal. Very happy with the complimentary breakfast, afternoon tea and hors d'ouvres and wifi. GCW isn't close to an MRT station so you'll either be cabbing it or on the bus. There are two close bus stops. The easiest MRT to get to is Tiong Bangh. Oh yeah, you can also get a water taxi service right out front. You'll have to book it though and it seems it's unavailable after 5pm (peak time for the boats doing sunset harbor tours) Pool got the thumbs down from our fussy deep diver 6 year old (not deep enough). I was happy with it though. The room was comfortable, clean, quiet and up to date.

Reviews.Title: “Costly bad service and smokey room”
Reviews.Author: JLdarwin
Reviews.Content: We booked and part paid for a special access room wilth king sized bed and roll-away bed non-smoking, six months in advance. On arriving they gave us a special access room, two single beds no roll away on a smoker's floor. We asked to be moved but were told that special access rooms all had single beds and apart from one room that was not a special access toom, the hotel was full. It seems tha if you have a disability, there is an assumption by the hotel that you sleep alone. The room we got stunk of cigarettes. Our eyes stung from the smoke and the floor was so badly ventilated that there was a constant haze throughout the floor and it was unpleasant to breathe. We asked for a roll-away bed for our son upon arrival at 7.00 pm. We rang a futher 4 times and was told untruthfully it was on its way. At around 11.30 pm we rang outraged that no bed had been delivered and was told that house keeping was closed. After midnight the bed was finally delivered - 5 hours after our request and after our son had fallen asleep in my bed. We stayed 3 nights. Each night we found that only 2 towels had been replaced and we would need to ring and wait for a third one to be delivered. This hotel is probalbly more suitable for single business persons on overnight stays. Except for a river which was good for long walks, it is quite far from shopping, tourist attractions and local foods.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room with a great view”
Reviews.Author: Koko-oz
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with breakfast through our travel agent at a very reasonable price (A$180 I think) as I had attended a conference there a few years earlier and been impressed with the food and service. On booking I made a request for a king bed, high floor with river view. When we checked in initially we were offerred a twin bed room but when we said that we required a king we were given one with no problems. The room was as requested, high floor with a spectacular view of the river. it was spotlessly clean and extremely comfortable. The breakfast buffet had ample choices with excellent service. The location is great for a stroll along the river to Clarke Quay and the riverfront restaurants and a quick taxi ride to Chinatown and there is a free shuttle bus to Orchard road. We asked the hotel's free shuttle bus driver if he could drop us at a location close to Little India and he was most obliging even though it was not an official stop. All in all, we had a lovely experience with friendly, helpful staff and lovely surrounds - exactly as we expected and we were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Azqaban
Reviews.Content: The Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel is quite an imposing structure. Standing more than 29 stories tall, and yet this mammoth building does not even shine in comparison to the buildings in the business district of Singapore, which its glorious structures. Nevertheless, the Grand Copthorne is a lovely hotel to stay at. It's large enough to lose your way around within it. Although, that is not true when you walk out of the hotel. The hotel has a shopping centre, which isn't extremely impressive and a coffee shop, which serves a delightful breakfast buffet, that one will not want to miss. The staff here, although polite, don't lend a feeling of warmth, which perhaps is the norm in a business-like hotel. The rooms are spacious. Remember, if you're a smoker, always opt for a room on the smoking floors. Singapore is extremely strict when it comes to these ground rules and offenders are fined very seriously. There's a good chance that you might not have the best view if you're a smoker, and if you really want a room on a higher floor with a magnificent view of the waterfront and most of Singapore's sights, you'll have to worry about taking a long elevator ride to step outside the hotel for a smoke. Singapore as a city has good signage - for roads, directions and important landmarks. It is also known as a 'real fine place'. The city has levied fines on urinating in lift, flower picking, spitting, chewing gum, smoking, not flushing, bird-feeding and garbage dumping, among several more. So, it's essential for one to be on their best behaviour. The city is also known for its inconsistent weather. If it rains while you're there, spend the evening (and even night) walking the waterfront at Fullerton, perhaps, enjoy a coffee at the Starbucks there while walking towards the impressive landmark of Singapore - the Merlion. If you're an enthusiastic shopper - head to Orchard Street for the best in clothes and to Mustafa, the 24-hour mall in Little India (known as Serangoon Road) for some of the best deals in electronics.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful hotel”
Reviews.Author: KobinBangkok
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the very worst so-called luxury hotels I have ever had the misfortune to stay in. Mouldy smelling room, no wireless internet ($28 for wired per day). No DVD player in the room. $400 a night to stay here, and a DVD player costs $100. How hard can it be? Lousy bar in lobby. Next to useless concierge - had to wait 20 mins for a taxi - others in the queue were fuming too. This place is THE PITS!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: zasoni
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel which gives value for money. Just 5 mins away from the shoppng hustle bustle of Orchard road.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with beautiful view from the hotel room”
Reviews.Author: techankur
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the hotel for 4 days,and on our request we were given 2 attached rooms,which have doors from inside.. The hotel rooms were very neat and and the river view from the hotel was simply awesome,though there were less choices for the breakfast provided in the hotel( as we are vegetarian ) Overall I would suggest this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Would never go there anymore”
Reviews.Author: JUNMING
Reviews.Content: went to stay at grand copthorne waterfront hotel for 3d2n, a celebration for my girlfriend birthday. was excited about the hotel even though mixed reviews were found with regards to the hotel. upon check-in at 230pm, was exasperated to find out from the staff name SUET, that there is no rooms left with King Sized bed. this is intolerable as we made our bookings 1month before the date. we were told to wait 45 mins for them to prepare the room with King Sized bed. what do they expect us to do in them 45mins of wait ! so i asked if we can check in to another room to rest and put our baggage down first, and the staff said it would be too troublesome. YEA THAT IS WHAT SHE SAID. 5 star hotel check-in staff saying that to us. with efforts of making it up to us, we went for a walk outside with all our baggage. the view outside the hotel is great but i was fuming. so after 40mins, we went back to SUET, the 'nice and polite' check-in staff. we were standing infront of the check-in counter for 5-10mins, while she was busily doing something, and softly said a few time, ' please hold on' ' wait for a moment' . after which SUET with her grumpy and unwelcoming face, finally spoke. she asked if we would want to have a deluxe smoking room. as we cant tolerate smokes from cigarette, we asked if we can accept the smoking room and change it if there is any smell of smoke in the room. upon hearing that, dear SUET had the face of hesitation and as we knew what she means (damn it! that would be too troublesome!) we went on to ask how much longer would they need to prepare the room she promised. she came back with the answer, 20mins. astonished by the service a 5-star hotel grand copthorne waterfront provided, we waited for another 20mins. we went to the piano bar situated in the hotel, nice cakes and good service. while we were having the cakes, dear SUET called me and said our room is ready. so we went back to the check-in desk and took the access card from her only to find our, the room on the 16th floor she promised was changed to a 17th floor room. !!!!!! more than 1hr has gone by and the room on the 16th floor we have been waiting isn't even ready ! that either shows the efficiency or the cleanliness of that room. went to the room, room was old, no toothbrush, basin choked. breakfast is decent, not the best around or even 5-star standard. pool is nice, gym is good. not being bias, but with the check-in service grand copthorne waterfront hotel (5-star) provided, i was left fuming and disappointed throughout the stay. maybe the rest of the staff is ok, maybe its just SUET, the bad egg amongst the good ones. been to many other hotels for getaways, but this is the worse experience for me.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay for a Singapore Stopover Holiday.”
Reviews.Author: jennythomas74
Reviews.Content: We were booked at this hotel as a part of our Singapore Stopover Holiday. It was a beautiful location on the river, and close to the SIA Bus stop (also included in the package), which allowed us to get around to many parts of Singapore. We were greeted by friendly and helpful bell staff, who unloaded about 24 pieces of luggage for our traveling group. We were guided to the front desk for check-in, then we each identified our bags, to be delivered within a few minutes by the friendly bell hop. Our room was comfortable and clean. The bathroom was spotless and modern, with no malfunctions. Robes and slippers were in the closet. The bed was comfortable, and King size. Our view of the Singapore River was amazing day and night. We had hoped to get to take a river boat tour, but decided against it in the lightning storm. We did have to pay for internet, which was wired, not wireless. We asked about this at check in, and were given a promotional price of S$15/day. This was down from the regular S$28/day. Rather pricey, but it was worth it to us. What's another $15 a day when we spent this much to get here? I'd like to see more hotels offer free wi-fi, but I dream... We ate the buffet breakfast one morning. Everything tasted good, and there was a wide variety. Again, it seemed a bit pricey at S$30/person, but our SIA Holiday package included 50% off dining, so again, that was not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Best singapore River view with a good hospitality”
Reviews.Author: ash2626
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on outskirts of city so very much clean and peacfull.you can enjoy the river view from the hotel but for non-smoking rooms only because they are on the backside of hotel, front road side view is also good. You will enjoy the breakfast if you like seafood and salad. Explore the city and their stores like seven leven your own.

Reviews.Title: “Its one of the best Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: gauravsh27
Reviews.Content: Hi! I love this hotel... I stayed there from 3 nights on our honeymoon trip to singapore. We stayed in many 5 star hotels over the years but this hotel is unique. I must tell you staff of this hotel is very friendly. Room service was gud too... You get a nice view of the street (see the pic attached)... I wud highly recommend this hotel for all my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Grim”
Reviews.Author: LondonAVB
Reviews.Content: Considering the normal high quality of hotels in Singapore this hotel is grim and well in need of a total refurb. Public areas are OK but rooms are particularly dirty. Mould around bath, encrusted carpets and stained chairs. Was upgraded to Executive Club room which had a better quality of mould but no more! Gym is particularly small and the sweat towels in there smelt rank. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and caring staff”
Reviews.Author: ccb01
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights - excellent location on river (especially for bum boat ride that picks you up at the hotel). Large room and well equipped bathroom, with a gorgeous view of the river from the 23rd floor. Concierge and hotel manager were extremely helpful. Buffet breakfast is extensive.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service From Staff”
Reviews.Author: sssnakealive
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in April. I do not know who gave them a 5 star rating. The hotel looked grandoise but the staff probably came from some sleazy 0 star budget hotels in singapore. They treat guest like dirt. Like we owe them a living. They are downright rude if you don't dress expensive or asian. my advice - stay away from this hotel if you are looking for good service!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to be stuck in during European airspace shutdown”
Reviews.Author: BhuddaBean
Reviews.Content: OK so we did not plan to stay in this hotel and conference centre but Quantas kindly put us up full board for 3 nights during the recent crisis with the Icelandic volcano. Large, Impressive hotel overlooking the Singapore River with nice walks, a bit away from the city centre. If you have money and want a treat, enjoy the setting, the sumptuous buffet meals (a culinary adventure) and the curteous, efficient staff. The pool on the 6th floor is nice for relaxing but too small for serious excercise. We needed to use the Internet in the Business Centre several times. It is normally quite expensive at S$28 an hour but they kindly gave us discount due to our predicament. I may be biased because I wasn't paying, but we were well looked after and enjoyed our stay very much. There were better and bigger rooms but we were grateful to have accomodation. We were disturbed by noisey cleaning of the roon next door at 7 am one morning but slept well otherwise. On the 19th floor at the rear, the view of the river and nearby apartments and tower blocks is striking. Apart from the conference centre there are not too many facilities in house. There are shops, bars and restaurants not far away, and taxis are very reasonable if you want to go further.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise that Surpassed Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: SteveSG2010
Reviews.Content: Special thanks to Delilah (Concierge) for organizing a pleasant surprise for my girlfriend on our anniversary. Delilah was patient, calm and attentive in handling my ad-hoc request, and the blue roses and delectable cake exceeded our expectations! Thank you Delilah and Corpthorne Waterfront for going the extra mile to make our weekend stay such an enjoyable one.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent for a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: MASWScreenwriter
Reviews.Content: Mostly very good with some buts...however a two day business event for 25 people was flawlessly executed. Yet there were weaknesses and inconsistencies - a hair in my partners breakfast, soggy salad, overcooked food. Our bathroom was not up to 2010 standards with a loose toilet. These weaknesses were not enough to ruin the visit but were sufficient not to merit a full 5 star rating and a little disappointing. The location of the hotel is also not exactly central. You really need to take a taxi everywhere. In the evenings the walk along the river is pleasant as long as you have plenty of time.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: RedRobCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: Not a 5 star hotel. Small rooms. Bad service. Expensiv. Bad location. Wcpensiv internet, no WiFi but only cable.

Reviews.Title: “GRAND IN NAME AND A GRAND EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: rajadu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Copthorne twice in 2009, May/jJune on the way to Europe and July, on the way back to Perth. The hotel was bookes over the internet and was our second choice after booking somewhere else and then changeing our minds. We were very glad we did. We had the most pleasent stay at the Grand Copthorne and our experiences were first class. We could not find fault with anything. The reception staff were friendly, helpfull and responsive. The rooms were spacious, clean and the beds very comfortable. The breakfasts were fantastic with an enless array of delicacies from asia and elsewhere. The FREE bus service to the city centre and chinatown was a godsend and enabled us to get to most parts of singapore with ease. This hotel was streets ahead of most that wew stayed at in Europe , in terms of VALUE and service and would not heasitate to stay there again or recomend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LittleSussex
Reviews.Content: A excellent hotel, the staff were so helpful and friendly, nothing was to much touble for them. Would stay there again and recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not great”
Reviews.Author: SeeingIsBelieving007
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable hotel, nothing special. Popular with tour groups and a very popular night club next door, has a slightly chaotic feel to it. Rooms were OK. Don't expect 5 star service. Location is inconvenient - not particular close to anything, fair walk along the river to Clarke Quay. You will need to get taxis. An OK option for a weekend in SIngapore, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Refurbished but lacking quality service for price, too bad good location”
Reviews.Author: pilotss2001
Reviews.Content: The hotel is grand and a good location near Cualkers Caye, the new refurbished rooms are very stylish and comfortable. The doors let a lot of hallway noise in and the walls seem a little thin. The hotel is in good condition and if the service was better it would really be a great place to stay. The restaurants are pricey but the food is good. The service at the restaurants are horrid. No worries as there are many many places to eat in Singapore. The water taxi can take you easily to the hot spots and taxis are cheap. Zouk, the hot spot of the island is right behind the hotel. It is an upscale nightclub and has very good service. The pool loses its sun early in the afternoon. The gym is very nice. The price of this hotel is not commensurate with its quality.

Reviews.Title: “not worth it”
Reviews.Author: travelbee10
Reviews.Content: far from mrt station, small room, sink are clogging, hotel staff not friendly, everything are expensive, internet for US 20 / day

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: munna50099
Reviews.Content: The best part of Grand Copthorne Water Front Hotel is its location, its probably the most pristine part of Singapore. The Lobby of the hotel is spacious, the staff friendly and the rooms (we upgraded to a suite for a family of 4) are nice and cozy with a good view of the city from the top floors. The hotel ambience is good and it bustles with activity all around the day. We being vegetarians had a tough time to pick something up for lunch or dinner and preferred the Indian restaurants elsewhere in the city. The continental breakfasts were good with a good choice even for vegans. I would definitely recommend this hotel for family leisure travellers to stay at a resonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't represent a 4star hotel”
Reviews.Author: weyling
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights after we check out from Grand Park City hall (4 nights). We regretted straight away since we checked in. The people in the reception are far from friendly, they are cold and detached. The people in the concierge are even worst. We asked for the best transportation to go to science museum or the closest mrt and they just answered ignorantly, which then we never asked anymore. Thanks a lot guys. No people in the lobby has a smile on their face, no warm welcome, no greet and defirnitely no welcoming drink. Totally the opposite from the people from the Park Hotel who are very pleasant and helpful. The room is old & smells of urine. I figured that the smell is from the rubbish bins that are opened and no plastic that can be thrown away together with rubbish. The glasses were never been washed and no coffee or sugar once they are finished. The breakfast is just standard compared to park hotel. I really think this is the worst 4 star hotel I ever went to. Very poor hospitality and performance. So much different from the nice photos shown from the hotel, nothing is nice here. Far to get the nearest mrt.

Reviews.Title: “Room looking a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: Katlesh
Reviews.Content: From the outside the hotel looks very big and grand but inside my room was very tired and worn. It wasn't dirty - but it had a shabby feel to it. Not really something you expect from a place like Singapore...and its certainly not the cheapest place to stay in town. On the plus side for some people it is staggering distance from Zouk. I thought the huge crowds of people hanging around for the club might disturb my sleep...but I was pleased to find that it didn't. All in all it didn't wow me...it was just very average.

Reviews.Title: “Not that close to central area but excellent”
Reviews.Author: yoshi0o
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is not so close to popular areas like Orchard or City Hall - although by taxi, it's only about 5 minutes. However, it's in walking distance to Robertson Quay and Clark Quay areas, where there are a lot of bars, restaurants & nightclubs. Also it's right next to Zouk, a very popular nightclub. The staff were overall very professional, although the front staff didn't seem very friendly. The hotel porters & the room service staff were great and well-organised.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: BigHugh51
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at the Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel twice during the last few years. We have found it to be a comfortable and pleasant establishment in which to stay. Whilst the rooms are certainly not luxurious, they are well appointed and well maintained. It would be a good idea to request a river view room on one of the higher floors. The views from such a room are both spectacular and interesting. Try to avoid a room on the other side of the building. The view from those rooms is rather dull and uninspiring. One also needs to be wary about the size of the room that you may be allocated. Because the building is an irregular shape, some of the rooms are large whilst others are quite small. Friends travelling with us on our last visit, were given a room that was small and cramped and really not much bigger than a broom cupboard, whilst our room, right next door was large and comfortable. You should try to ensure that you get your buffet breakfast in your tariff. The range and quality of food available at the buffet breakfast (served in a dining area adjacent to the hotel’s main foyer) is outstanding. Service at breakfast is usually efficient and friendly. The hotel has an adequately equipped gymnasium and the swimming pool area is pleasant enough without being outstanding. In relation to amenities, the biggest plus for this hotel is its location immediately adjacent to the Singapore River. There is a very pleasant dining and promenading area between the hotel and the river. Some reviewers have been critical of the location of this hotel. We, however, have found it to be ideal. Sure, it is a bit off the beaten tourist path, but its location allows for a pleasant 10 minute stroll along the river to Boat Quay and Clarke Quay. Five minutes’ walk in the opposite direction is the large and well appointed Great World Shopping Centre. Other tourist and shopping attractions can be easily accessed by water taxis, cheap car taxis and a range of shuttle buses, most of which are free. The general standard of the service in the hotel is quite good. A particular strength is the service provided at the concierge desk. The staff operating this desk provided outstanding service. They were helpful, friendly and extremely efficient. The staff at the travel and touring desk located in the foyer were also helpful and efficient. The bell staff were also exceptionally helpful in dealing with our luggage and in organizing taxis and other transfers. We have found the reception desk staff to be efficient in dealing with both check-in and check-out. However, the reception staff need to be better trained in the art of being friendly and welcoming. Our experience was that they appeared to be somewhat cold and detached. Overall we have really enjoyed our two stays at the Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel (for four nights on both occasions) and we look forward to staying there again, in the relatively near future.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable, high standard”
Reviews.Author: Gloryfan
Reviews.Content: Had three short stays here in October & November 2009. Rooms are nice and well appointed with comfortable beds. I had nice views of the river. Reception and concierge were efficient, polite and helpful. Pool area is well maintained. Good location on the Singapore River, 10-15 min walk to Clarke Quay and Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel, ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: comrade98
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights early December 09. Like most things in Singapore, it is difficult to fault - good rooms, good service. Rooftop pool is fine but not fantastic, good for a dip after a day in the city. Easy walking distance to Robertson Quay, Clarke Quay and Boat Quay. Booze very over priced though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: copperiw
Reviews.Content: After a 7 hour flight from Australia to Singapore, it was great to finally arrive at the Copthorne Waterfront Hotel. First impressions of the hotel were great, check in was swift and courteous, the reception staff being expert at their job. We were shown to our room by an attentive porter who was anxious to please. Our room was quite comfortable with a king size bed, although slightly short for my 6ft length, it's width certainly made up the shortfall. Everything in the room was as expected of the hotel, from the decore and furnishings to the excellent soaps and shampoos in the bathroom. The breakfast in the morning was excellent with a wide choice of eats on offer. Overall, the hotel was excellent value for money, although a little far from the main shopping areas of Orchard Road, the hotel offers an excellent free shuttle bus service to this area. Taxis are readily available for a nominal fee to other areas of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfy rooms but Atrocious service!”
Reviews.Author: ThePrivateer
Reviews.Content: As locals, we knew that this wouldn’t be a 5-star experience, but booked it at a good price for a weekend getaway. By no means a quiet hotel, being located next to the mega popular club Zouk, and seemingly popular with huge tour groups (particularly from India, at least when we were there). Not quite the middle of town, but transport is plentiful and quick. Overall, we enjoyed the room very much, but the ABYSMAL service standards marred the experience somewhat – see reservation and breakfast sections below. Reservation Experience – Shockingly bad! We booked online followed by a phone call to doubly make sure that we got what we wanted, and were assured nothing would go wrong. However, upon check-in, wrong rooms were still allocated (non-smoking, twin beds etc) and eventually we had to make compromises as they had reserved the wrong type of rooms for us. In addition, the receptionist (an Indian gentleman) was highly rude and condescending, even as we were trying to help the hotel deal with their own mistake in our booking. Bottom score for this. Room – Must have been a refurbished room as everything looked slick and new. Cleanliness top notch, and amenities like bathrobes and slippers were nice. Immensely comfy beds (though on the soft side) were a huge plus point, and the TV was large with a good selection of pay and free channels. Very happy!! Bathroom – A tad small with no bathtub, but perfectly adequate and no bruised elbows/knees in the shower cubicle. Room Service – We only ordered a soup, but it came nicely presented with many bread rolls, water and full setting. Promptly too. Breakfast – Another major downside to this hotel. Packed to the gills, the restaurant struggled to keep food on the counter, and we were forced to make do with whatever was left. Food was mediocre, 3-star quality at best. Atrocious service here as well (perhaps due to the large crowd). We were allocated a table but when we returned with food, found that it had been given to another couple. When queried, the waitress replied “You took so long to take your food so I didn’t know if you were coming back!” Huh??? After our first round, we went back to the buffet table for refills and juice (barely 3 minutes), and when we returned, our table had been cleared and re-set once again! Efficiency is no excuse, as there were countless other tables that were left uncleared for our entire stay in the restaurant! In summary, this is a hotel for those who are only interested in the extremely comfortable room, as we are, and who can tolerate all other sorts of nonsense (shocking service, crowds, some noise in the hallways).

Reviews.Title: “Watch Booking rate!”
Reviews.Author: SANTACLAUS1
Reviews.Content: Average Hotel certainly not 5*. Booked 5 nights at an agreed rate both by telephone and email, then upon Check Out an extra £200 added to room rate as apparently there system is different to what was agreed!!!! So be careful when paying your bill as they seem to add money to it (layering technique) and previous verbal and written agreed rate's can be changed and seem to stand for nothing. I see this as corrupt! Will not be staying at again plus it is out of the way from most shops and attraction's and in the heat you wont want to walk too far so will need to take taxi's everywhere. Walls in rooms thin as I had to be moved to a different room due to the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Make my Family Happy and satisfy”
Reviews.Author: JAKA321
Reviews.Content: My Family member was very happy and satisfy along the vacation for Excellent Apartment room, and service. special thanks to miss Chris Wong.

Reviews.Title: “Not very memorable”
Reviews.Author: Colin330
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during Grand Prix weekend when the hotel was probably quite full. Despite this all the staff were always courteous, polite and efficient. Our room (902) with twin beds was on the small side – I’m not sure if this was a standard room or not. The bathroom was tiny and the shower cubicle was showing signs of its age with grubby grouting in places. All the room amenities were there, it just felt what it was, a little squashed. Unusually, a complimentary bottle of water was provided for each of us throughout our 4 night stay. For such a large hotel (570+ rooms) it never felt crowded except at breakfast – the dining area is too small and can’t cope with so many guests. The choice available from the buffet breakfast, great value at just S$20 and of good quality, was impressive though. You can walk all the way to the city along the riverfront (and away from the traffic) directly from the hotel. If you want to stay away from the city centre, it’s ideal – it’s just 10 mins by cab, but for those visiting Singapore for leisure I’d recommend staying somewhere nearer to the city centre or Orchard Rd if you want to be in easy reach of the many shopping centres. Taxi’s are very cheap though so it’s not a major disadvantage. What was odd, was the number of taxi drivers who didn’t know of the hotel – has it changed it’s name in recent times? During a chat in the bar with a businessman from India also attending the Grand Prix, we agreed on this: there was nothing really wrong with the hotel but equally, it was entirely unmemorable.

Reviews.Title: “Refurbished rooms with great views ruined by terrible service”
Reviews.Author: PandEKew
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Traders Hotel I expected great service in Singapore - I was very disappointed at the Waterfront. A great welcome was ruined by being offered the wrong bags, having to chase a package to be delivered to my room, no offer of tea or coffee at breakfast and the slowest and rudest check-out I have had in a long time. The views from the hotel are great BUT you have to get a cab o be anywhere... The only good point was Pontini's a gem of an Italian (pizza's a little basic) with fabulous service. So in summary, though the rooms are large, the service is poor; I'd rather have a smaller room near to the town centre.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Hellywobs
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were courteous. The room was comfortable but rather small, especially with a camp bed for my 6 year old son in it and the design of the shower meant that it was very easy to flood the bathroom in my jet-lagged stupor! Breakfast was good the first day but on the second day it was very busy and we didn't get nearly as good service with coffee etc - it's a very small space for the size of hotel. The location is nice, right next to the river and it's easy to walk or sail along the river to the restaurants etc at Robertsons Quay and Clarke Quay (I can recommend the Boomerang restaurant about 5 minutes away for people with kids) and beyond to the main sights of Singapore. I enjoyed the stay but felt the hotel was too expensive for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed!!bad location and service”
Reviews.Author: piccaninny
Reviews.Content: stayed there for 2 nights, found really difficult for getting our way to city or MRT, the staff are lack of professional knowlege about the simple informations. the front desk and the door man were failed to provide informations about the transportation service and even the front desk manager doesn't know anything about the airport transfer, all they suggest is taking the taxi..they definetely need more trainnings!! especially the front desk!! the room is very small, no bath, the ceiling is abit dirty. swimming pool is extremely small. food is okay very disappointed, will never return to that hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: 7piranda
Reviews.Content: We were there for about 4 nights on our way to Bali. My son was 1 year and 8 months old at the time, I was pregnant with my second son (and maybe a little fussy) and after a long flight from Frankfurt - we found our bed to be very comfortable and we slept about 14 hours. My son received a very nice wooden baby cot with bed linens like ours- just little size, and think he liked it. The room was spacios, clean, and the bathroom very practical with a shower cabine and a bath tub. Restaurant was nice, especially the terrace on the Riverside. We've asked something for our son that wasn't on the menu ( grilled chicken breast with mashed potatoes) and they were very prompt. The hotel is not centrally located, but we could walk to China Town where we had real chinese food in one of those "push the tray" restaurants, and also to a little shopping mall called World Plaza I think. To other locations just take the taxi. If you have children don't miss the Zoo. Singapore is one of the safest and most civilized places I've been to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but far from main shopping area and transport”
Reviews.Author: Alexandria-family
Reviews.Content: I was here for a business trip and the hotel served the purpose. The staff were really helpful. The breakfast was wonderful. I had very little free time and would have preferred easy access to the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “I got a great rate so it was a good hotel"”
Reviews.Author: AndrewinMiami
Reviews.Content: I used a website where I got a rate just over $100 a night. I guess if I had paid the advertised rate, my review would not be so positive. My room was big enough and bathroom was clean and well organized - not sure what the other guys rooms looked like I was in 1702 at the end of the corridor. A larger closet/more drawers might have helped but for a week I was OK. Breakfast was included in the price and was a mega buffet of all imaginable tastes. Just wish they would have brought the coffee round a bit quicker. The bar is nice but pricey so I would not recommend eating at the hotel - use the 1 for 1 offers to get a reasonable priced cold beer at the ned of a day walking round in the heat/humidity. Location is a brisk 20 minute walk from Chinatown or cab ride. If you are going to walk, shorts and tee shirts are required and expect to be hot and sweaty. Its 20 minutes to the MRT but I was told there was a free shuttle which I never used. All in all this hotel is OK, pricey unless you get a deal, nothing special considering it is the flagship of Copthornes and a bit decentralized but I had a pretty good time for a week

Reviews.Title: “Good for Stop over.”
Reviews.Author: LloydNZ
Reviews.Content: A little bit away from everything but taxis are cheap. We walked for 20 min to underground to get train to Orchard Road. We then got taxi back which was cheaper than train. We were upgraded to ecectutive suite which was very nice for the fierst stay of a world tour. Everything about hotel was good and is worth staying there for the very pleasant walk down the Singapore River to the business area. If you are looking for somewhere to eat, you pass many restaurants on the way. For breakfast or lunch we recommend the TCC chain of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: GemmaL0uise
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. Nice hotel but nothing outstanding. Good breakfast. A pleasant bar with grand piano and patio area overlooking the river. Swimming Pool and well equipped gym. Fifteen minute walk from Clarke Quay, where there were plenty of restaurants and nightlife along the river. Also the nearest Metro station. Recommend Orchard Street for shopping, shopping and shopping. Visit to Raffles and the Long Bar for a Singapore sling is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Club room not up to scratch and not worth paying premium for”
Reviews.Author: lobster1972
Reviews.Content: Staff at main lobby was unpleasant til they noticed we were club customers then immediately started to smile and get friendly. We were taken upstairs to club lounge for check in, there was no welcome drinks or anything. Staff did not explain the benefits of club privileges or where everything was. This is poor service for club rooms as you pay premium rate. The room it self was nothing exciting just extra corner for the writing desk. The bathroom was shocking and disgusting, it looks like its in middle of renovation. Tiles were falling of the bath tub. We then discovered the room did not have any bath towels or bath robes. Notify club manager and he was very apologetic and seem extremely embarrassed and offered free drinks to compensate. We did not take up the free drink offer but told them we booked the club room for a reason. But all the troubles and problems was soon forgotten after my husband and I had a great dinner and lovely wine.

Reviews.Title: “not in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: awayweekender
Reviews.Content: Whilst the location is reasonably central, this is not the best-situated 4* hotel in Singapore. It's situated on a busy street (Havelock Rd) with the nearest shopping mall (Great World City) 2 large blocks away. This does not sound like much, but you'll still want a (cheap) taxi in wet/humid conditions, in which case you might as well cab it to the Orchard Road shops. It's a reasonably new hotel (9-10 years old) so standard rooms are small, and views not spectacular unless you're on the highest floors. Ask for larger rooms which have a brighter feel (e.g those ending in 04). The hotel backs onto the Singapore river, a very narrow but pleasantly landscaped channel with walkways but again, there's nothing noteworthy within walking distance. The surrounding buildings are mostly hotels of lower (3*) standard with some construction work on one side of the hotel (condominiums rising everywhere); late at night the area just outside the hotel entrance is infested with teens hanging out near the extremely popular 'Zouk' disco, so access to the hotel is by room key in the small hours of the morning; Restaurants are ok (Pontini is one of the better Italian restaurants); the conference floor on level 4 is always buzzing with exhibitors; Coffee shop / pastry counter in lobby; Breakfast buffet has a good selection; Maserati showroom just next door add some panache. More on the rooms: comments: standard rooms are not large; beds good; aircon works (3 fan settings & thermostat); bathroom has all the basics but again quite cramped for a 4* hotel; cleaners do an acceptable job, but could have more attention to detail. I found myself using a bathmat to seal off the rather large gap underneath the door, to stop draughts and to shut out noise (piped music in corridors is audible inside the room at night and can be a little irritating). If you are after a 4* hotel and this is going to be your only stay in Singapore, you should definitely choose a more central location within walking distance of the main attractions. However this hotel is -accordingly- reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alyn50
Reviews.Content: Well this hotel was picked from reviews that I had seen on trip advisor. No complaints about the condition of the hotel or the very helpful and attentive staff who made us feel a valued customer. Room we had was on the top floor no smoking room and was set away from any other room on the 30th floor. Fantastic views of the city and the river. Main problem that for a 5 star hotel you only qualify for 2 hours free internet access a day (one hour per person). That aside the hotel pool was ok but the breakfast was a little bit cold for cooked items that have been standing for a while and there was no opportunity to get a freshly cooked egg if you wanted it. That said there was a very good selection for every taste and plenty available. Best way into the city was the river taxi. See the concierge for times or there is a free shuttle bus to Orchard road shopping every hour.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall but still lacking”
Reviews.Author: Ricbkk
Reviews.Content: In a place like Singapore where it feels like there are more hotels than homes you could be forgiven for believing that every hotel needs to be at the top of its' game in order to keep customers returning. Copthorne Waterfront (one of three Copthorne hotels on the small business island) Is a very pleseant hotel with good ammunities, location and staff. Breakfast by the river is a great weay to start your day and the staff are always eager but never pushy. There are more than adequate ways to pamper yourself with a nice sized swimming pool, spa service and numerous restaraunts however the rooms didn't have the feel of a 5 star hotel. There were no tea making facilities (even on the executive floors) and the furniture probably hadn't been retouched since the 1980's. Saying that the bedding was a soft a mid summers breeze anabling me to have a great night's sleep even after a frustrating day looking around the Singapore Expo. Food was also a suprising low point of the hotel. We had our breakfast included but after 5 days it became a little uninteresting. The breakfast was exactly the same everyday. The eggs were the same, as were sausages which only had one selection and even the bakery and Chinese food which you can usually find rotate on a daily basis even in 3 star hotel. Besides the lack of inspirational food and aging decor the hotel was a lovely place to stay.The view was good, the staff were courteous and the location was just where I needed it to be. If people can find a good rate for this hotel I would recommend it but I wouldnt go as far as saying it stole my heart. Waterfront your ok but Conrad is still beating you.

Reviews.Title: “Not really satisfied but not bad”
Reviews.Author: matgray
Reviews.Content: I was very fortunate to be on the Club floor where the service was outstanding. Quite disappointed with the room, it was quite small and smelt a bit musty. On the first night I found a cockroach or some such thing scurrying along the carpet, I pointed this out later and suggested that more attention could be paid to pest extermination in their warm climate. I was a bit sisappointed that I did not receive a reply to the client's report in which I relayed this info. Why go to the trouble completing these things if they dont reply to such complaints! Because of the location, all travel had to be done by taxi. Not a memorable experience except for the great service on the Club floor.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ahar3
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for only two nights with my wife and two young children. Staff was friendly and always helpfull when needed. Hotel is located conveniently close to a shopping centre. Room was clean and bed firm. Our bed linen was in desperate need for a change. Blanked and bed cover were both ripped from old age. Room on river side was quiet. Was initially a bit hesitant about the hotel but would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Waterfront view”
Reviews.Author: NinuMumbai
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the business meeting. The usual warmth was missing, which is a part of Singapore Hotels. Though the staff was friendly to all requests, but the warmth and personal touch was missing. The room was slightly cramped, but otherwise OK for all other purposes. The lobby is average, but the breakfast is very elaborate and nice. The location of the hotel is far off from main shopping areas. The waterfront view is amazing. I found this place a little lifeless

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, supposed 5-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrBrownMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I have previously stayed in Singapore for business (5-star hotel) and wanted to stay somewhere different, which was probably a big mistake in hindsight! The location of the hotel was fine and taxis are very cheap in Singapore. The hotel was very disappointing, having booked a room for 3 nights via Wotif - I'm not sure if having booked at a cheap rate made a difference to the room we were given, but it was very tiny and the decor was 80's style. The staff were not overly friendly or helpful at all. Disappointing and would not return or recommend. And they wanted to charge huge rates for internet connection, when we could walk down the road and get free Wi Fi.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel with 3 star attitude and service”
Reviews.Author: rajan2905
Reviews.Content: Checked into the hotel at 12 midnight last month with my family while coming from Bali. Had booked a superior room which looked very nice with LCD TV well done up room which looked like a 5 star hotel room. On enquiring on extra bed was ofered a Deluxe room at an upcharge... was told was a much larger room than the superior which was true. Room quality however was at best 4 star. The wood work was shabby which needed poilsh, had an archaic 25 inch conventional TV; wash basin was cracked; wall paper peeling off no complimentary water or anything in the room. It took half an hour for someone to send up water after telling me that they did not provide the same (even though the superior room had the same).... next day asked for a room change was shown similar rooms eually poor in decor. I delclined and promised a better room.... well no one contacted me after that followed up again next day and even the next... many people came on line and offered help but nothing came through. three days passed and on last day finally was offewred the room which i politely declined as was not wise to move with kids n that too for the lst night. Hotel seriously needs to get its act together and understand the word service. I work as president in a multi billion dollar retail company and understand customer service... this hotel surely does not...... or maybe because am an Indian....Definately not recommended for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, great room, excellent breakfast, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: GrantCMiddlesex_UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights recently and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful (checkin took about 5 minutes) and the room on the 25th floor was excellent (this was probably an upgraded room). The pool was smallish but very nice (there was a little construction noise from the building next door, but this is pretty standard fro Singapore I think). The breakfast buffet was very good and the restaurant pleasant, looking out over the river. There isn't much nearby (not a bad thing!) but taxis are cheap and you can get anywhere quickly. If you want somewhere good (and cheap!) to eat there's a mall about 5 minutes walk away (just turn right out of the front of the hotel - you can't miss it, its a huge brown building, several towers) with an excellent food hall in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Fair hotel. Maybe not for birthdays.”
Reviews.Author: LPY123
Reviews.Content: My guy decided to give me a stay at this hotel as birthday present. After confirming that, I wrote to them asking if they do anything special for birthdays. As we stayed on a Fri, I wanted to check if they can give us a late check-out. They told me that's subject to availability. No issues there; they may be running full. Check-in was ok. I must admit that I had hoped the reception would at least wish me a happy birthday. Nadda. The room was big and though it was a smoking room, there were no unpleasant smells. Bed seemed to be King size. We were hoping to catch some cable but they had limited channels. No MTVs. The bed was a bit too soft for my liking and the pillows to flat. But that's personal preference I guess. But I can confirm that the bed was sunken in the middle, so I didn't get a good night's sleep. Besides, the occupants in the next room was quite audible and doors closing can be heard as well. We checked out promptly the next day. I must say I'm disappointed that there was nothing special for a guest's birthday. Even a note would have brighten the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTraveller001
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with most of what you would expect from a 5 star property. Rooms were ok in size. I was on the 22nd floor and had a great view of the city ( and new year eve fireworks). It was nice to spend a couple of hours by the pool. I did not eat in the restaurant but I noticed a decent menu which was not overly priced. The only downside is this hotel is not close to an MRT station. So you either need to take a bus, or a taxi. I found the nearest station is probably Clarke Quay but is really too far to walk in the Singapore heat. There were some nice cafes along the river for breakfast. A large shopping centre across the road a couple of minutes walk with all the usual stores, restaurant, and food court.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location on the Singapore River with incredibly friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: bronh2008
Reviews.Content: Initial impressions were excellent with the staff at reception extremely friendly and courteous despite the late hour of checkin after our flight. During our 5 night stay this initial impression was reinforced with staff going out of their way to assist and make our stay as pleasant as possible. The room and facilities were very modern, very clean and we were given (on request) a room with a view of the river which was a real bonus. The hop on/hop off bus is a short walk up Havelock Road and Great World City shopping centre a short walk in the opposite direction. Robertson Quay is a longer walk but very pleasant and Clarke Quay is a longer, but quite manageable walk. Take the water taxi (ask the concierge to book) for a very pleasant trip up the Singapore River.

Reviews.Title: “Great value money”
Reviews.Author: bjinblue
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was situated on the river within a half hour walk to China Town and most other shopping strips and restaurants. The Hotel itself was clean and the staff were friendly. We had a king size bed which was comfortable. The only fault would be that the shower, (which was a shower over bath type set up with a shower curtain) leaked all over the floor every time it was used. This had also caused damage to the tiles which had been repaired but it was vary obvious and looked a bit crude. The room was modern, and roomy enough for two people. W had a great view of the river from the 21st floor. The room was well cleaned very day. Great value for money when compared to a hotel in Australia

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WizardMelbourne
Reviews.Content: It really is a great place to stay. The hotel is situated on the bank of the river and we received everything we expected from this class of hotel. We stayed 4 nights, May 14-18, check in and out, fast and efficient. However some comments that do not detract from the hotel, but could go a long way to making things ever better. Smile, oh dear what has happened to the smiles, during the fours days it was hard to find any staff member with a smile on their face. I know it's Singapore and hot, but a smile goes a long way to making guests feel even better about their stay in your hotel. We booked the breakfast package and it was value for money, 4 days at Australian dollars $705 all inclusive. During our research throught the various sites, including direct with the hotel, the rates fluctuated between A$705 and $A1050 so look around. The breakfast selection is great, something for everyone, and even when eating late there is still a good selection to be had. One point to be made is the egg chefs, there is only one cooking point for fresh cooked eggs and at peak time this can cause a wait, and there is a reluctance of the chefs to want to cook anything other than omelets. If you ask for scrambled or fried eggs, you are directed to the warmers where the pre cooked eggs are slowly going cold. Stand your ground, state you want freshly cooked eggs and it will be done, but not with a smile. Our room was on the 19th floor and abutted the construction work going on next door to the hotel and at 7am each morning the whine of machinery started up, not overly intrusive, but audible nevertheless, also the dull beat of music can be heard from the night club down below in the early hours of the morning. Suggestions are to ask for a room away from the construction site and all will be fine. The room itself was fine, mattress a little firmer than we like, but acceptable, small bathroom, but everything included, large shower, hot water with great pressure. Flatscreen TV, plenty of station choices and free internet access. The hotel is situated away from the main shopping areas and it's a 19 minute stroll to Clarke Quay underground station, 25-30 minutes to Orchard Road. Note, strolling is as fast as one wants to go in the heat of Singapore, anything more than a stroll is considered exercise and that can be done once you arrive home.There is a free hotel courtesy bus through the day, as well as taxis to get you around. There is a small shopping centre about 5 minutes from the hotel with a good array of shops and eating places, there is also a small hawker centre in the flats opposite the hotel where local food is hot, tasty and cheap. Eating within the hotel is expensive as expected in this class of hotel, however the eateries in the Clarke Quay area start just 10 minutes stroll away. Costs at some of the eateries are more expensive than the hotel so it pays to check the menu before sitting down. A well appointed hotel, clean and efficiently run, value for money if you find the right rate, and well recommended. We would stay here next trip. A final note for the staff...................Smile please, it costs nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Loved our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Henny111
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Copthorne Waterfront in April 09. We had been booked into a standard room which was comfortable, clean, well equipped but on the small side and with a view out of the back. The bathroom was nothing special, but our main problem was my very tall husband had trouble fitting under the over bath shower. This would have been ok for a night or two, but as we were there for a week we decided to upgrade to a Club Deluxe room. Best decision ever!! We were given a tour of two rooms to choose from! And chose a large room on floor 29 with fantastic views over Singapore and the river. The bathroom was huge with a separate large shower. In fact the only "problem " we had was that I found the mattress too hard in the new room. No problem - they swapped the mattress from the old room! We loved the use of the Club lounge for breakfast and evening drinks and fantastic canapes. Non alcoholic drinks in the minibar were "free" as were all day refreshments in the club lounge. We made use of the two pieces of complimentary laundry. The extra cost for Club rooms is definitely worth it for a more comfortable stay. The staff were all so friendly, efficient and helpful. We ate in the restaurant a couple of nights and the food was excellent but expensive. All the public areas were calm, cool and relaxing. The only downside was the pool area which, when we stayed there is completely overlooked by a very noisy building site next door and is also completely in the shade in the afternoon. Location wise was no problem for us. It may be slightly out of the centre, but taxis are very cheap and plentiful and the bus stop outside also takes you to Orchard Rd or to the Marina area. It is also possible to walk 20 mins along the river to Clarke Quay, although be aware of the heat and humidity. Overall we had a fantastic stay at this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Plain & Simple”
Reviews.Author: simon_manurulz
Reviews.Content: What i liked most about my stay at the Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel, was the fact that the basics where taken care of. What I mean is, the first thing I look at in a hotel is the quality of accommodation, which i was very satisfied with.Nice & Cozy king size bed,good shape to the room, 29 inch television(not too many channels though).Excellent bathroom. Then of course you go on to other amenities like room service, restaurants, etc... Room service was prompt and efficient. Then comes the food. I can't really review the food here cause i didn't eat much at the hotel, but i did have breakfast at the hotel, once at the coffee shop and the other in my room, and it was ok, nothing special. Coming down to location of the hotel. Convenient, not too far from orchard, 5-10 min by cab. The reception was very helpful whenever required. My room had an excellent view which I was most impressed with ( always request for a room with a good view,makes the stay even more enjoyable). I was there for two nights and I must say that I got what I had expected. This hotel is definitely worth a try.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katster88
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Copthorne for a full week and it was wonderful. The staff was very accommodative and hotel has a beautiful view of the river. We stayed on the club floor which has an amazing view of the city. Ask for the 29th floor if you can. Club services include free internet, 2 pieces of laundry a day, breakfast, cocktails and appetizers in the lounge. The concierge also helped us get tickets to a sold out musical. Some people complained about the far distance from the metro but taxis are abundant and cheap. The Italian restaurant Poniti is delicious. Make sure you try the pasta and pizza! The hotel is also next to a very good nightspot known as Zouk. But you cant hear the crowds! The pool is very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Indianfrommumbai
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a good place for business conferences. It has a variety of rooms and if you chance upon a large room, its is beautiful. The best thing about the place is undoubtedly its location. It is close to most places worth seeing in singapore, including clubs, sentosa, orchard road etc. The food is average and so is the pool. But the hotel has good clean rooms and good service at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: NinNelson
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, we had a fabulous room on the 14th Floor looking up the river – absolutely stunning at night. The room was large and new, great bed, nice furnishings. Lovely pure white linen. Breakfast is great, but after two days gorging ourselves we walked up the river a bit (and crossed at the first bridge, then a long a bit more – 5-10mins) to a nice café for a lighter breakfast. Nothing in Singapore is cheap – and this was no exception. However, you get what you pay for. Bit of a walk (20-25mins) to the MRT, but we enjoyed this (you need to walk off the stupendous breakfast) and once or twice got a taxi back from there to make like simple. ** Getting a taxi on a Sunday night (family night out) is impossible. DO go on the Singapore Flyer - a highlight - what a view. Nice pool, but in shade in afteroon

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, bad location, bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: lomainttraveler
Reviews.Content: If you are unfamiliar with Singapore you may be tempted to stay at this hotel. I would not recommend it. I had to stay there on business and found the hotel located far away from shopping, the rooms are very small, the common areas are not particularly well air conditioned and finally my room had bed bugs or something that bit me repeatedly when I stayed there. While Singapore is small, the hotel is relatively far away from the shopping and sights that are Singapore. In addition there is a lively street business each night around the hotel. Not their fault but its there. I did not get a chance to check out the workout facilities. Overall, there are better places to stay in Singapore at reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Warm and welcoming 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: TomandClare
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with very friendly welcoming staff. Pontini's Italian restaurant was truly excellent within the hotel and the club lounge catered for our every need. In fact all the facilities were first class and the location of the hotel on the Waterfront was so convenient that we could have spent the week just using the pool and taking the occasional pleasure boat to the waterfront attractions nearby. Would definitely stay here again the next time we visit Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view of River”
Reviews.Author: LeapinLiz
Reviews.Content: If you plan on staying here ask for a river view - our first room looked onto the highrise buildings (not sure why when the hotel was only half full) The staff varies greatly - some of the staff are excellent - especially the 2 young ladies on reception - some of the staff are not over friendly though. (some are very aloof) One morning the buffet breakfast was great - another morning is was very average and the service was very average! Make sure you ask for a window seat (they dont like u to have an opinion on where u wish to sit) Overall the Hotel was ok - and after being moved to a river view room, it was so much nicer. It's a pleasant 15 - 20 minute walk to Clarke Quay. World City Shopping Centre is a short walk and has a fabulous eatery downstairs - we only discovered this on our last day, which was a shame!

Reviews.Title: “excellant service”
Reviews.Author: mrtravelshoes
Reviews.Content: During our three day stay, I turned thirty, and the wonderful staff brought me a chocolate cake as a present. Fantastic service and very thoughtful staff. The hotel was a good price for Singapore and was clean and comfortable. A wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: jwyh
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights between 9th - 11th December. We booked on www.wotif.com and the room cost $190SGD. We booked about an 1hr before we got to the hotel and the room was already ready for us. We were also upgraded to a Deluxe room. The room had a very nice bathroom with a separate bath and shower. Everything was very clean (like most of Singapore!) Location was good - in Singapore you're never really that far away from the action. Clarke Quay was a 15 minute walk away, Chinatown was about a 1/2 hour walk. We didn't know about the shuffle service at the time and we just walked everywhere! If we got really far, then we'd get a taxi back. Taxis aren't too expensive. Staff were friendly and helpful. Gym was well equiped and the pool was a good size. Overall, would stay here again for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to improve on the small details.”
Reviews.Author: thechinesecockney
Reviews.Content: I book this via the mystery hotel option on Wotif (although easy to work out which hotel it was), and would not agree with the self rated 5 star that the hotel gives itself. Overall, the hotel is decent, we had a city view room which looked at the building site next door. The room was clean and a good size, but the bathroom was dated and needs updating, with the bath itself and surrounding tiles all a disgusting brown colour. Also a warning that the design of the shower in the bath means that it will flood the bathroom floor, so can become slippery. The hotel is a decent location, a pleasant 15-20 min walk to Robertson Quay and Clarke Quay where you can find plenty of restaurants etc. Just 5 mins walk away is Great World City mall, which has lots of coffee shops if you wants an alternative option for breakfast. The hotel doesn't really have any character or "soul", the staff are not particularly friendly. Checkin was clinical and not welcoming, and just the small things are missing like not holding the door open as you walk behind them, so letting the door slam into you. We also waited for 20 mins for service in the outside area of the bar, ended up leaving when no staff around. Not sure I would return to this hotel in the future, but it was a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, efficient and great view!”
Reviews.Author: Vidooshak
Reviews.Content: There are about 3 hotels with the Copthorne brand in close vicinity of each other. The Copthorne Waterfront is probably the most elegant of them all. Situated on banks of the river, it had a great view of the river and distant coast from my room on the 22nd floor. The rooms itself are quite spacious and large, with ample closet space and comfortable beds. The bathroom has a tub as well as shower cube. The TV is still the old fashioned CRT and limited to free channels (only HBO, CNN, BBC and Discovery for English) so that was a dampener. They have a great offer where Broadband is offered at 50% off (comes to $10 US) and service is again good. In fact, the best thing about the hotel was impeccable service. They made sure to replenish the free water bottles, tea/coffee and even shoe shine and carry bag. This is becoming increasingly rare and I have complained in many hotels for the shoddy housekeeping. For me, a room well-taken care of makes all the difference. Breakfast is huge and again offers a nice view of the pool garden, especially nice if it rains. They have delicious Korean, Japanese, Western and local food sections. My favorite were the juicy fruits-- lychee, dragon fruit and melons. Location is good, walking distance from Zouk, Clark Quay and Orchard Street. Check-in and check-out was both quick and sympathetic (they let me in at 7AM though check-in is at 2PM). Overall, a place I am sure to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: ACChua
Reviews.Content: The Grand Copthorne is situated in an alternative hotel district by the river, a short taxi ride away from the Civic District or the Orchard Road Shopping District, but near happening places such as Zouk and Clarke Quay. Great World City - a mall with several boutiques, restaurants and a supermarket - is a mere 5 minute walk. Though not near any MRT stations, this location is ideal for those seeking a quieter location without leaving the central core of Singapore. The hotel is typical of a 4-star hotel with the level of service and facilities expected from its stars rating. The newspaper (Straits Times) is delivered to the room on a daily basis free-of-charge. The rooms are clean, and reasonably furnished. Standard amenities such as hair dryer, toothbrush, shampoo and soap are provided. The in-room TV sets are still the traditional box-type instead of the LCD variety. Internet use is chargeable, and there is no free Wifi reception within range. The gym, which is located near the swimming pool, is also complimentary. A number of exercise machines are available, as well as a small reading area inside. Breakfast was also included with our stay. This consisted of a reasonably-sized buffet consisting of breads, fruits, bacon, sausages, omelet, etc. The good thing about the breakfast area is that most tables have a good view of the Singapore River courtesy of the floor-to-ceiling glass. Due to the relative distance of the MRT stations (the nearest ones would be Clarke Quay or Outram Park which may take a good 30 minutes walk), the hotel provides free shuttle service at hourly intervals up to a certain time of the day. Otherwise, taxis are very easy to find. Overall, we had a comfortable and hassle-free stay at the Grand Copthorne. Nothing about it made us say - "wow" but we didn't find anything bad either. I might consider staying here again next time but then again for this level of service and comfort, there are probably other more competitively-priced hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore stay”
Reviews.Author: sukhwani
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, close to everything. Food was great. They have a travel agent in the Lobby of the Hotel. We booked all the tours through them, they were inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful grand copthorne waterfront singapore”
Reviews.Author: giselleSussex
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were fortunate enough to have this hotel recommended by a friend who had previously stayed there. This was our first visit to Singapore and the hotel made the trip memorable. We were upgraded to a Club Suite which was fantastic. The beds are extremely comfortable and the bathroom is luxurious. The views are terrific. The Club floor has a Club room which provides a very substantial breakfast and food and drinks throughout the day, all of which are complimentary. Nothing was too much trouble for the ever attentive staff who wanted to make our stay as pleasant as possible. The hotel also has an excellent restaurant and bar on the Ground level with access to the waterfront where we were served afternoon tea on our last day. Throughout our visit , the staff did everything possible to help us enjoy exploring Singapore from making bookings on tours , checking dinner reservations and calling taxis. The level of care and attention was out-standing.

Reviews.Title: “OK but no soul”
Reviews.Author: nzbased
Reviews.Content: booked through "wotif.com' mystery package - S$190 a night. Good price for Singapore. Check-in suggested we could upgrade to a club-room with cocktails for S$90 a day extra. Room small for a 5 star (as rated by the hotel), bed is good, room has no soul - most walls have no pictures or decoration, cheap curtains. Location by the river is good to go on a river taxi to the night food/drinks down Boat Quay but not near the MRT and due to road cnfiguration taxis near to go in a circle to get there or from there. Public areas OK - gym well equipped. Staff efficient but lack enthusiasm.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: ramesh_chugh
Reviews.Content: Since the hotel booking ws done by the comapby , i had no sya in it.But whn i checked in , i ws amazed.Except for the delay in checking in ,the rooms were good.We stayed on 13th floor and the view ws good.The toilet ws clean and spacious.The buffet breakfast ws gr8 and the bar ws excellent.Since Zouk is very near,so incase ur looking at having some wild fun,it is at a great location.The swimming pool ws nice and so ws the room. We stayed for 4 nights and enjoyed it throughly.taxis r easliy available and the staff ws friendly. i wud stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: apsinpdx
Reviews.Content: our flight got there early in the morning, and check in time was 2pm. They offered us free breakfast, and let us relax in a quite lounge. And then at about 10:30 they approached us and gave us a room. There was no turning back from there - first impression is truly the last. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: stefan52
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 night stopover at the copthorne on our way to europe. The hotel is located on the river away from the shopping area.We found it quiet and relaxing after the bustle of the shopping district. The room was small but comfortable with all the amenities you would expect in a large hotel. We swam in the pool and used the gym facilities all of which were adequate. We were able to walk along the waterfront to Clark quay which has terrific restaurants.The buffet breakfast was standard.Staff were very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Changed rooms Two times!!”
Reviews.Author: pilotboy1985
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in an good location, however the bathrooms are in need of some TLC!. We first checked in, and was given our room, a deluxe room with a king bed. The room its self seemed to be alright, but when I went into the bathroom I was shocked and appalled to see mould on the walls, and on the ceiling. As I looked further I could see a peice of the ceiling had been repaired at one time, and it had now "collapsed" because I could see where the ceiling was caving in. I have never seen such a state in a bathroom my entire life!. I got a face cloth and wiped the wall where the mould was, and sure it enough, it came off onto the white face cloth, and now the white face cloth had a streak of dark green on it. I was disgusted. I took my suitcases back down and informed reception of this room which was clearly in violation of a health code. She didn't seem apologetic, but acted like she expected someone to complain. She gave me two new keys. I went to the room and the first thing I inspected was the bathroom. Much to my delight the bathroom was really nice, and sparkling! I walked out the bathroom and noticed the room was much, much smaller! The bed was crammed in, and the bed appeared to be smaller. I called down to the front desk and was informed I was in a standard room. I explained I had paid for a Deluxe room, and expected to receive one. After waiting in the room for 1 hour they sent someone up to the smaller room with my new room keys. When I entered the new room I held my breath! I didn't know what to expect.
