Luckily, this was a deluxe room, and was liveable. The breakfast buffet wasn't all that bad, to be honest. However it seemed like a crime to ask for Apple Juice. I explained I do not drink Coffee because I can't handle caffeine, and I couldn't drink Orange Juice because it gives me heartburn. He advised what's there, is all I can have. coffee, Orange Juice or Pineapple Juice. I asked him to please check with someone else, and sure enough someone came with Apple Juice. I had to repeat this dance every morning. As a Canadian, I couldn't get over the cost of the pop in the Mini-Bar. Something like $10 USD/CAD. I could not believe this, however I heard Singapore was expensive so I figured the mini-bar would be as much. Instead we walked down to a store, under some apartments, and got some pop to put in the mini-bar to keep cool. Upon check out we noticed a charge for pop from the mini-bar! I brought this to the attention of the reception girl, who, after 10 minutes, decided to remove the charge!. I will not return to this hotel again, I will look for a much better hotel next time, which shouldn't be hard to find.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel critic”
Reviews.Author: Hotelcritic0815
Reviews.Content: We were in Juli 2008 for 3 nights in the standard rooms. The achievement at the price is very good. Rooms are quiet. The cigarettes and kitchen smell is disturbing by the air conditioning system in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a Fantastic City”
Reviews.Author: graemeboro
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Singapore with my family for two weeks and was really impressed by the Grand Copthorne Waterfront. The location is ideal and you can walk right into the city centre and tourist attractions although I only realised this later in the week. Singapore is very confusing to cover on foot but taxis are cheap enough so we caught them regularly from the front of the hotel. There were a few mistakes from a customer service point of view but I do think everyone genuinely wanted to help. We arrived at 7.00am and were immediately given a complementary drink. Although the policy is that you cannot have your room until 2.00pm the lady said she would find a room by 8.00am. We were actually upgraded to the top floor. Fantastic, a room really early overlooking the city. All going well except a few minor issues. When we got to the room there was no bed for my daughter. A quick call sorted this out and an elderly lady was sent up with a bed. Why they didn’t send someone else I don’t know. So with that ironed out all was well. Well until 5.00am the following morning when we were told to pack up and move rooms. When my wife questioned this we were told it was because the early room was an upgrade just for one night. The first we heard. So we packed up, and then at 6.00am got a call to say unpack and you can stay there. A good resolution but where was the communication. Once we got over this the rest of the holiday was first class. The room was comfortable, and newly fitted. The hotel was immaculate throughout. We never used the restaurant as eating out in Singapore can be so cheap. The swimming pool was great too. It’s on the sixth floor and is a reasonable size although it can get busy. The Jacuzzi isn’t too bad but not that bubbly. There is some construction accross the road but that never really disturbed us. All the staff are very friendly and despite the early mistakes were always wanting to help. We were always made to feel very welcome. Singapore is magnificent place and this is a magnificent hotel if not for a few hiccups. I would certainly give it another go

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: thaurbangypsy
Reviews.Content: This hotel (as well as Singapore) were very disappointing. The staff upon check-in were rude and looked like they did not want to be there – smile for goodness sakes! You work in hospitality! My room was dirty (carpet stains) and the washroom had torn towels in it. The soap was not enough to wash your hands and the closet door looked like it was ready to fall off. Although the hotel was in a good part of the city, it did not feel safe. There were always people in the hallways moving carts around and leaving them in front of the elevator. The pool was under construction and had little sun so I did not stay there for long. There was not much to do around the hotel and you have to take a taxi everywhere – an expensive one I might add. We made it out to Sentosa Island and I would say save your money. Not much to do but walk around and pay too much for food and drinks. The best part of our experience here was the buffet dinner. There was a lot of selection and our waiter was pleasant and helpful. Other than that, stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Scary lifts!”
Reviews.Author: Szeling1972
Reviews.Content: This was the one 5 star hotel I stayed at on my trip to Singapore. The lobby was top notch but my room a bit worn - chipped furniture - but otherwise the rooms and service were fine. The pool was also quite nice and very clean, though not that big. What really got me was the lifts. In order to get to my 15th floor room I had to insert my room key then press the floor number in order for the lifts to work (for what I assume are security reasons). Quite a few times I did this, the doors to the lifts closed and I was stuck in there for a minute or two before the doors opened again and I had to repeat the process. I found this quite scary, particulary as, as with most lifts, the aircon in the lifts wasn't great. I jumped out of lifts looking freaked out quite a few times and saw a number of other people bursting out of lifts looking freaked out and trying to get out as fast as possible. So if you are claustrophobic at all, this definitely is not the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very 1970's...”
Reviews.Author: Melnq8
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a night at the Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel when my flight from Singapore to Japan was cancelled. The airline provided the hotel and two meals in the hotel's restaurant for its stranded passengers. Check in was very quick and efficient, especially considering the number of people the front desk staff had to deal with from the cancelled flight. I was given a room on the 26th floor, which was jokingly referred to as an Executive Floor. My room was very small and had a double (yes a double) bed which was very low to the floor, two ratty old wicker chairs, a table and a desk chair. It was entirely too crowded and the decor felt like something from the 1970's. The tiny bed had a nice cotton duvet, but the carpet was worn and stained, as were the chair cushions. The furniture was old and chipped and it was a bit depressing. I did like the soft lighting though - plenty of lamps, which always makes me happy. The AC was good and cold too, the way I like it. But an Executive room??? I think not. My room overlooked the river and a massive construction site. The walls were very thin and the hotel reminded me of my stay at the M Hotel in Singapore, which like the Copthorne, is part of the Millennium Group of hotels. The decent sized bathroom was more contemporary, had good lighting and nice amenities. The 26th floor hallway felt much like the room, stained, old and in need of refurbishment. As sad as the room was, the buffet meals served in the hotel's restaurant were very good. I'm not generally a fan of buffets, but I was impressed with this one, particularly the assortment of fresh salads. I had to call maintenace for a problem with the TV set and I was pleased with the prompt service - someone was at my door within five minutes of my call. I was also happy with the staff in general - everyone I dealt with was helpful and friendly. Would I stay here again? Probably not. Too many better options in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: KJMFourMarks
Reviews.Content: We were travelling with our 2 young sons (12 & 9) and our travel agent made a reservation for a room with at least 2 double beds to accomodate all 4 of us. Unfortunately this hotel does not apparently have rooms like this. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted and told that we had been given a complimentary upgrade to a Suite on the 25th floor. So far so good. Unfortunately we found the room only contained 1 x King bed plus 1 x fold away bed. At 2300 Hrs after a 9 hour flight from Sydney this is the last thing we needed. A return visit to Reception involved a protracted discussion over the fact that despite accepting our booking from our travel agent, the hotel did not have rooms for 4 persons and who would pay the $50 required for them to put a 2nd fold-away bed in the room. (us or our travel agent). A rather petty position for the hotel to adopt in my opinion but a very helpful Duty Manager accepted that this was the responsibility of our Travel Agent. Once this was resolved , the 2nd fold-away bed arrived very quickly and easily fitted into the Suite with a little re-arranging of the furniture. The room was nicely furnished and the bathroom was particularly well appointed with separate bath and large shower. Our rate included Breakfast and this was good, with a wide selection available including, "Full English, Omelettes cooked to order, Continental and Asian options. In my opinion, apart from the view, this hotel was superior to the previous hotel on this trip, the Shangri-la, Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Victorianlad
Reviews.Content: Securing a discount rate, I expected that we would stay in the hotel's worst room. Check in was quick and efficient considering we were first-time guests. Perhaps Lady Luck or my guardian angel was smiling, but the room was terrific: quiet, good bed with crisp linen, a great bathroom and suffcient toiletries. The swimming pool was first class, and pool towels readily available as were hot showers after the dip. After a good sleep and an adequate if not outstanding breakfast, I departed lugging a suitcase along the river. This would be my only minor criticism: a bit far from the MRT but to be fair, there are nearby bus stops.

Reviews.Title: “Really Dumpy”
Reviews.Author: Pierreaway
Reviews.Content: Paid US $320 for the Superior room which was moldy, smelly and basically the type of room you would get at a US $100 Days Inn. Complained but couldn't get upgraded to anything better. I would highly recommend not to stay here for more than it is worth (US $100). Great service, nice lobby but this doesn't compensate at all (the location is really bad too).

Reviews.Title: “Club Room: Great service and good value”
Reviews.Author: smulholland24
Reviews.Content: We booked the Grand Copthorne through Qantas online which seemed to have the best deal going for an executive club room in Singapore for the period of time we where there (8 nights Jan to Feb) We had a room with king size bed on the top floor (30) and although not the largest it was certainly reasonable size. The bathroom had a separate shower (unlike previous review below), bath with shower attachments, etc. Decent array of toiletries (razor, toothbrush, etc). The rooms must all differ slightly in configuration. I agree with the review below that the electricity does shut off when you remove the key card, but that is the same for many hotels I've experienced in Europe and Australia. The air conditioning does keep going, so the room was always a good temperature. There is a port at the writing desk for broadband and two electricity points, but could do with more given the amount of gadgets we seem to have (2 laptops, mobile phones, etc), let alone wanting to boil the kettle for tea/coffee. With regard to the tea and coffee complaints made in earlier reviews, yes there are only 2 of everything provided, but we found that housekeeping was more than happy to supply us with more. On the night we arrived we rang and requested extra supplies and proper milk. These were sent up very quickly and with no fuss (or charge). Housekeeping came both morning and evening and replenished and refreshed the rooms as required. As per previous review there was the free broadband provided in the room (although you have to go through the process of signing up to a plan - we didn't get charged) although I'm not sure if the freebie was only for a short time. We used the laundry service nearly every day taking advantage of the 2 free pieces. Also free soft drinks and juice from the minibar. The best part of the stay at the hotel was the facility of the executive club lounge on level 29 and the service we received from the wonderful staff that worked there ( thank you Lydia, Johnathon, Jaya, Delilah, Lydia, Al-Zafik, Yousif and Himirami). Breakfast is included for Club room and is served in the lounge from about 7 till 10 every morning. The buffet selection isn't huge, but there was a choice of British, European and Asian plus the ability to order the usual eggs, bacon, sausage, tomato and hash browns. There never seemed to be more than half a dozen people in at a time, so a nice relaxed atmosphere. Tea, coffee, juice and soft drinks are available throughout the day (FOC) and there are complimentary drinks and hors d'oeuvres from 6pm to 8pm. There was one evening we were so tired from sight seeing that we ended up snacking out on the hors d'oeuvres as a light supper. Yes the hotel is slightly further out (but so are Mirimar, Furama Riverfront, Holiday Inn which were all next door or across the road), but a taxi up to Orchard Road was about S$5 and there is a free shuttle bus running between these hotels, Orchard Rd and Clark Quay MRT. The hotel is right on the river and you can walk along and across the foot bridge to Robinson Quay (8-10 mins) and Clarke Quay (15 mins) for lunch or dinner. If you want a taxi then you never had to wait long at the door before one arrives. I found the business service center well organised and very efficient. I don't know if I would have enjoyed the hotel as much had we not been in a club room. The staff in the Executive Club Lounge were wonderful dealing with all our little requests (eg the milk, band aids, etc) and making us feel very welcome. If you can afford the extra $$ then it's definitely a hotel to put on your shortlist.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable alternative”
Reviews.Author: dutchkiwi
Reviews.Content: Staying in Singapore is getting expensive, especially when there are large events and conferences going on. Last week was not different. Where my regular hotels are chargeing S$ 600 to S$ 800 per night, I found that over the top and an internet search revealed that special rates at the Grand Copthorne were still going. So a call was placed to the hotel and a S$ 370 plus GST and SVC was found. This gave me a club floor room with breakfast and cocktails in the lounge, two pieces of laundry per day and free internet. Good value. Whilst the room i was staying in was nothing special (no separate shower), I found the staff cordial and friendly. Especially the enthusiastic door man, telling me all about his family of whom he was seemongly very proud. The room as mentioned previously, is nothing special. The lighting needs to be sorted as well as the electicity supply. Upon leaving the room, taking the keycard, your laptop battery drains as it switches all power off including the powerpointsd behind the desk. I once had lunch at the buffet in the lobby and found it very good. The food is good and fresh and there is an abundance of choice. The hotel is a reasonably central to all major destinations, all a short cab drive away. As taxis are still very cheap compared to oter parts of the world, it is not a problem that the hotel is a very walking distance away from the major destinations. All in all, the Grand Copthorne offered good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: steve15182
Reviews.Content: Despite the hotel appearing to be nice, I was pretty disappointed in the end. After waiting in line ~15 min to check in, I was directed to my room on the 7th floor, bearing in mind the entire 6th floor was being renovated. Construction noise went to well into the night (11pm) and after killing a few small cockroaches in the bathroom, I called down to the front desk to get a room reassignment. The next morning they switched the room up to the 23rd floor, I don't understand why they were even opening the rooms on the 7th floor if they have space in the higher level rooms. The room on the 23rd floor was fine, although the walls are thinner than I would have liked. Breakfast was decent. However, when the conference center gives out breakfast coupons to their group, they completely overtook the restaurant and nothing was left at the buffet. The hotel is incredibly inconvenient to any MRT stop which was a bit frustrating at times, although they do have a steady stream of taxis which was nice. All in all, I would definitely not stay here again given the opportunity, nor would I recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “building noise within hotel”
Reviews.Author: bubbles92
Reviews.Content: Building work on sixth floor noise was terrible vibrating through the walls. Advised that it was management policy not to advise clients before their stay. Therefore was unable to change hotel as stay was pre-booked and paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: ShropshireWildwoods
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Sentosa Resort and Spa on our way out to New Zealand we decided on a city hotel for return. We were disappointed. The check in stafff were disinterested, even at midnight when we were exhausted they didn't volunteer the way to the lifts! The room was rather shabby, scratches on furniture, very wobbly pull out for keyboard, no bedside tables, poor lighting, the only place light enough to read was on the loo! Towels grey and tired. Very mean with coffee and tea in room, only 2 sachets of coffee and 2 tea bags. The bed was very comfortable No apologies posted for the fact that gym and fitness suite under refurb and therefore completely out of use. This also meant it was noisy on pool terrace. We had to ask 5 staff how to get to internet access as business suite was closed for a public holiday. As all the dining and cafes are on the groung floor this makes it very busy, nowhere to chiil. We ended up going to the Botanic Gardens for some peace! In conclusion rather tired decor. Not much to recommend it

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: MytimeSydney
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 6 night stay at the Grand Copthorne in Singapore. My husband was there on business (so the Hotel was booked for us by his company and we had no choice on the matter, however they first tried the Swissotel Stamford and another city Hotel and both were fully booked so this was their third choice), I tagged along as I hadn't been to Singapore before. I had read the reviews on this site before going, so to be honest my expectations were not very high >> I was pleasantly surprised. We had a club room on the 30th floor, the views were interesting but unfortunately there was a building site next to the Hotel but it wasn't too noisy (however, I must add that it's difficult to avoid building sites as Singapore is full of them, everywhere you look you are surrounded by them). The executive club really made staying at the hotel worthwhile as you recieve lot's of little perks (see previous review, evening alcoholic drinks 6-8pm, breakfast, laundry service/ limit 2 piece per day and so on). The services was extra good, in many ways, check-in and out super quick and efficient, we also had a late check out (only until 1 pm) on request as we had an evening flight, we ended up coming back to the hotel and having a swim and shower before going to the airport. No problem for the Hotel to hold your luggage. The hotel decor is pretty average and the room wasn't that spacious but it was very clean and comfortable. Location and current facilities are probably the downside to this hotel, it's a 20 min walk to the closest MRT, but I must add it's a very pleasant walk on the riverside pathway so easy to find plently of bars and restaurants in that area, Clarke Quay and Robertson Quay. We actually walked home from the Esplanade Theatres (giant durians) which took a little over 40 mins and it was a good way to walk off our dinner. Take some good walking shoes. Taxis are so reasonable (about $4/5 singapore to get up to orchard rd, $20 dollars from the airport) that it doesn't really matter. I walked alot, used buses (once I got the hang of it, make sure you have small change as they don't give change), used the MRT, tried the Hotel shuttle but it was a real milk run and took over 20mins to get to orchard rd which usually takes 5 mins), I did discover another free shuttle which goes from Great World City straight to Orchard rd/ Orchard MRT and back again. Great World City is a few mins walk from the hotel and is a good shopping centre with a great food court downstairs and some nice restaurants and shops too. Go out of the Hotel and turn right, cross the rd and walk down. A free shuttle goes ever 20 mins or so from there. The gym is being refurbed so that's out but it's good to run along the river path, the pool is small but was pleasant, the spa didn't work and wasn't heated. I would stay here again if it was executive club because the service was great, the staff were friendly and efficient and the little extra's made it nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: JxD
Reviews.Content: Second stay in Singapore for us on a 6 day holiday rather than business this time. A well kept hotel and staff were always very helpful. Food was very good. Room was not the biggest we've ever stayed in but had everything we needed and was very clean. Free bottled water was provided everyday. Well worth upgrading to a club room for the executive club. Our room was on the 30th floor with excellent river / city views, this also allowed access to the club lounge with complimentary refreshments and 2 hrs of complimentary alcoholic drinks in the evenings, plus lots of other perks including breakfast and lots of complimentary non-alcoholic drinks from your minibar. Situated along the river about 10 - 15 minute walk through Robinsons Quay to Clarke Quay. Very nice walking in evening when temperature drops to a comfortable level. Taxis are very cheap in Singapore so getting around is not a problem. Zouk Nightclub was next door also. The downsides for me was that the gym was being uprated and if you wanted the use of one, the hotel would provide transport to another hotel closeby to use theirs. This was not very convieniant and the drinks in the main bar on groundfloor were also very expensive. Staff made us feel very welcome and would definately consider staying again in the future for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, but not terrible”
Reviews.Author: JamesG28
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Copthorne for three nights as part of a conference at the hotel. There were two major negatives with the hotel. Firstly, the room was quite small and fairly tired in terms of fit-out. One of the power sockets nearly came of the wall when I unplugged the iron. The bathroom had a shower cubicle but no bath. It wasn't awful but it was a bit drab and disappointing. The second issue is location. The GCS isn't really near anything. You can walk along the river to Robertson Walk and Clarke Quay, but it's a bit of a walk and I wouldn't relish it on a hot day. There aren't really any shops nearby, which is unusual for Singapore, unless you count the disappointing Great World City mall which is five to ten minutes walk up the road and not worth the trip. To get to pretty much anywhere, whether sightseeing, shopping or business meetings, requires a taxi. The hotel isn't really near to any MRT station, so you're reliant on road transport. Having said those things, the service seemed generally pretty good, the food was quite passable, and the hotel is quite cheap by Singapore standards. It's hard though to think of any particular kind of traveller who wouldn't frankly be better staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Jewster
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our holiday to Bali, after stopping off at Singapore on the way for 3 nights. We arrived to the hotel 9:00 in the morning, to find our rooms wouldn't be ready until 12:30, this left us hanging around the hotel lobby on sofas waiting for our rooms which did waste time. Our room was immaculate, had everything you could possibly need, and looked newly refurbished. We had breakfast included in our stay, which was of excellent standard, and offered such a wide variety of foods. The staff in the hotel were friendly, and offered us complimentry drinks whilst waiting for our rooms, and were quick to respond to any problems. The pool was quite small, and also cold, this could be due to the bad weather we experienced, but other than this it seemed to be kept very clean. We used the pool bar for some snacks, the food was good, and quick service. The hotel was located right by the waterfront, and was within walking distance to local shops/ restaurants. Had an enjoyable stay, the only downside was that we were located on a floor for 'smoking' so everytime we walked out the lift the smell was rather strong. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but adequate room”
Reviews.Author: SYLow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my family for a wedding. The room was really tiny by American standards. However, it was compensated by the good service, decent views of the cityline. The room was rather new and everything worked well. The restaurants were well serviced and food was good. The hotel is not located within the famous Orchard Road shopping belt but public transportation is easily available.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: summerdaisy77
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night in a twin room. Great price, l Lovely hotel - great room , not the best location but there is free hotel shuttle location to Orchard and Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was fine for the money”
Reviews.Author: diannuccia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights on the way home to the UK from Australia. We got a good deal on the hotel and our superior room was comfortable with good beds and powerful shower. The decor in the room was slightly tired but nothing major. The hotel buffet breakfast was excellent with an amazing array of food - something for every taste and diet. We had dinner in the restaurant before our flight - it was a thai buffet and was delicious, again with wonderful array of food. We noticed that many local people eat at the hotel which is a good recommendation. The hotel is not in the centre but the walk along the river is pleasant if rather hot, and taxis are cheap and plentiful. We would definitely stay here again if we got a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly dull but okay really I guess”
Reviews.Author: unclejames
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business for four days or so. It claims it's quite near Clarke Quay, but it isn't - a good fifteen minutes' walk away. Having said that, it's not too far, I guess; certainly possible to walk into downtown from the hotel if you wanted to. (I didn't.) The television included BBC World, which was nice, and the room has a radio alarm clock (useful for 88.9 FM, which is the BBC World Service). I found the room rather cold, and the thermostat on the air conditioning didn't appear to do much. But the room was nice, the bathroom very good, and, you know... yawn... Blimey is it a dull, business, bland, hotel though. The place is even coloured beige. Staff wander around being just pleasant enough; breakfast is just tasty enough; the bar just nice enough; the wifi just cheap enough. If it was up to me I'd rename it 'The Average Copthorne Waterfront Hotel'. Which isn't a bad thing. Just not a very good thing either.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: EZT
Reviews.Content: I do not share the views of the reviewers posted so far. This hotel has problems: Location is quite poor. If you are a tourist you are not close to Orchard Road (a taxi ride, which is not ideal). If you're in business, you are in no man's land. In other words, location is poor. Rooms are small and not well decorated. They are old Bathrooms are also quite small. Worse still, my room (and we had 2) had a powerful smell, and were not well cleaned. Prices: It is expensive for the location, and the quality of the rooms. Facilities. Average pool and fitness centre. Nothing great. Breakfast OK, but generally not included in your rate. My advice? For the same money, you may do better elsewhere. And for a bit more, you will get 4 times more than you'd get at this property. Summary: Not a disaster, but below average, and certainly no value for money.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: superstardj
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a very comfortable two nights at the Grand Copthorne. It's a top-class hotel, and if you're used to staying at the Hyatts and Marriotts of this world, you won't be dissapointed - essentially fully-featured to keep the jaded business traveller happy. The location, right on the river, is also excellent for taking a stroll and taking in the great sights the river has to offer. Orchard Road and Singapore's major shopping districts are also nearby (but hey, this is Singapore, everywhere's pretty close). Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stinks room but helpful staffs”
Reviews.Author: twisted_couple
Reviews.Content: We checked in this hotel as my work colleague in Singapore recommended. With the river view room on the non-smoking floor, there is no such advantage about it. When I first step into the room, my gosh! I felt like this room was held a party all night long. All the cigarette smells in the room really got on my nerve. I have to call the front desk, see if I can change the room. Unfortunately, we checked in quite early while other guests probably still sleeping, so there was no room available. I asked for the air-refresher instead. Quickly the house keeping came with a spray bottle of air-refresher. The room suddenly smells nicer. The room is great for business people who want comfort in a small space, but I would suggest the other way to romance-oriented couple. I have to say that all staffs at this hotel are very helpful and very nice. All my questions and requests were responded quickly.

Reviews.Title: “great time at the grand”
Reviews.Author: chetz
Reviews.Content: as the first stop on the start of a six week foray out to the far east the Grand Copthorne Waterfront had a benchmark to set and we are glad to say it put the bar pretty high up as far as we were concerned. Initial check in seemed to falter as we were told there were no double rooms available and we had been allocated a twin however the sight of my face must have prompted the receptionist as she offered us double room in the next band up, i think it was up from superior to superior plus, yes we had to pay a small surcharge but it was only a few pounds more per night and it WAS the start of the holiday...we were totally taken aback by the size of the room on the 14th floor with its views down the river towards the heart of the city.Any calls to room service for items such as an iron, extra condiments were dealt with rapidly...why do hotels only give you 2 or 3 pots of milk??!! Breakfasts which were included in our rate were filling and set us up for the day and the hotels position was such that it was a mere 10 minute walk along the riverside to get to hotspots like clarke quay and boat quay. we used the concierge for a couple of trips out, the night safari and sentosa island, yes we know we could have done it cheaper ourselves but this was a semi relaxed trip and prices were ok. Daily paper was delivered and laundry facility good, don"t bother with the internet via tv..it takes too long and the business centre seemed a bit pricy for internet access..better to find somewhere outside. we didn"t even get to see the pool area. Overall we really enjoyed the Waterfront and would return, it seemed to be placed well for access to various areas like orchard road and little india..there were always taxis available in the hotel and they were not particularly expensive, staff were courteous and helpful and we didn"t experience problems that others have complained of or are we just not as picky??

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - would recommend”
Reviews.Author: AmershamSouthWales
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Grand Copthorne Waterfront from 14th January 2007. Arrived at mid-night, very hot and tired and was very unhappy with the room I was allocated; carpet was very dirty and stained, and that I wanted another room. Girl on Reception initially advised me that the hotel was "fully booked" I peristed with my dissatistaction and stated if it was earlier in the day I would have found another hotel, and did not wish to even unpack my bags in the room, and she eventually "found" me another room (even though she had earlier said that there were no other rooms in the hotel available)!!!!!!! The room I was given was lovely, very clean and comfortable, with lovely river views. From the on, I had no complaints whatsoever. The service I received was excellent, and the concierge was exceptionally helpful when I enquired about local attractions and transport etc. Lovely dining facilities in the breakast room with lovely views over the river. Choice of food was excellent as was the waitress service. I had easy access to transport system and overall thoroughly enjoyed ny stay in Singapore and would recommend the hotel (just enquire before hand about the room you have been allocated; mine was on the 20th Floor!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel if on Club floor”
Reviews.Author: LeeCSingapore
Reviews.Content: I have staye din many hotels in Singapore and apart from the Ritz Carlton this is by far the best option. I have arranged a deal with the hotel for club floor rooms and it is by far cheaper than the majority of hotels you find. Free internet, laundry, soft drinks from the mini bar, breakfast, evening drinks (including alcohol) and snacks... All this included in the price... Service by the club staff is great, they really look after you and nothing is too much trouble. The service in the general restaurant is a little poor but the Italian is also great, anyway you are in a big city so go for a 10 minute walk down to Clarke Quay.... I will stay here from now on which is likely to be 12 times in 2007... For the person who complained about an iron, ASK THEM they turn up in 10 minutes.... Yes the pool is monitored but it does state this also... Give it a go, it is worthwhile....

Reviews.Title: “Well below expectationa”
Reviews.Author: Caroline1043
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this and 2 other hotels in Singapore during December, and this was by far the worst. It is not a great location for business as you have to get a cab from the business district and that can be difficult, also they closed down the Executive Lounge well before the stated 10:30pm. This was not a real problem, but given we paid double the rate at the Fullerton, presumably mainly for this service, it was not a great sign. My room had a particularly bad odour and there was no iron, which was provided for convenience in the other (cheaper) hotels we stayed in. Finally there is a nightclub attached to the hotel, and the noise is not an issue, but it does seem that many of the staff would rather look after the young disco crowd than the hotel guests, which is also off putting.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: Tet14
Reviews.Content: After a 12 hour flight we arrived early in the morning and check-in was only 2 pm. Staff immediately arranged a room high in the 30 store building, luggage was taken off our hands and they even offered a drink. Great reception. Our room was at the 22nd floor and had endless views on CBD and Singapore River. It was not the largest of rooms but more than large enough for us and very clean. Room also was very silent and no a/c noises. Bathroom was enourmous with all the amenities. Sumptuous breakfast included. We had no complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: expectant customer
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay. Reception looks good, is large and comfortable. Location is great, a good part of Singapore and my view from my room was very good, as long as you are on one of the higher floors. Room size is not huge, size is adequate and bathroom aws also of OK size, not big. Bed was comfortable and room was quiet, important points. Breakfast buffet area was very good, plentiful, great east or west selections and good service. I had a 1 night stopover on the London-Sydney run, and this hotel suited that very well.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault the view”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Couldn' fault the view or location in this hotel but it is only just 4* if you stay in a Club room. The superior rooms are very small and tired. The pool area has absolutely no control over unattended children and there is a constant smell from the kitchen extractor fans and little or no service from the pool staff.It is a very busy hotel with many groups, business and tourists and we would definately stay in a 5* if we returned.

Reviews.Title: “Even great with Kids”
Reviews.Author: Euphonium
Reviews.Content: Agree with a lot of the comments already written, great location, in walking distance along the river to fabulous restaurants. Breakfast very good. Even the laundry over the road is highly recommended quick and efficient. Have a 7 year old and 3 year old with us. They loved the pool and the staff know my children by first name. Buffet evening meal in Cafe Brio also to be recommended my daughter is hooked on marsh mallows and the chocolate fountain. If you are bringing children there is also a play area across the road for when they need to let off steam. Our room is on the 25th floor with amazing views over the city.
